loans.name: Suriya

texts.en: Suriya is 48 years old, married and has four children. Suriya is very skilled in the art of hand embroidery and has been using this skill for many years to earn a living. She can make beautiful designs and patterns with her hand. Her skill is known throughout the town. She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. This loan will enable her to purchase more beads, threads, frames to meet orders of her customers on time to earn a good amount of profit. This monetary help can take Suriya closer to her dream of building her own house.

loans.use: to purchase more beads, threads, frames to meet orders of her customers on time to earn a good amount of profit.

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en:
Zipporah is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food .
For the past seven years, she has operated a cosmetic shop business, selling retail to her neighbors and passesrby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. Zipporah dreams of establishing a retail shop business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 20,000, she wants to purchase cosmetics and open another cosmetic shop. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and open another cosmetic shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy leather.soles, glue, eyelets, and shoelaces for his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sewing materials.

loans.name: Sobirdjon

texts.ru:
Собирджону 39 лет он женат и отец троих детей. Образование у него средне-специальное .  Занимается Собирджон животноводством и садоводством. Это основное занятие , которым могут  зарабатывать на жизнь жители села. Вырос Собирджон в селе неподалеку от города  и впитал от природы и земли всю силу которая она могла дать людям живущим в сельской местности , так как в селе нет больших заводов и фабрик воздух и вода не загрязнены  вредными выбросами. Орифджон любит своё село он очень трудолюбивый человек. Выращивая скот и тем самым зарабатывая  на жизнь он помогает также своим  пожилым родителям. Он сам на небольшом участке выращивает  кормовые.
 Для приобретения удобрений и зерна для посева и для  подготовки к весеннему севу ему  необходим кредит.  Он надеется,что  взяв необходимую сумму с Арванд"  сможет повысить финансовое состояние своей семьи.
texts.en: Sobirdjon is 39 years old, married and a father of three children. He has a specialized secondary education. Sobirdjon is involved in animal husbandry. This is the primary type of activity, with which the village residents can earn a living. Sobirdjon grew up in a village not far from the town and absorbed all of the power from the nature and land that could be given to people living in a rural area. Because the village does not have large plants and factories, the air and water are not polluted with harmful substances. Sobirdjon loves his village. He is a very hardworking person. He also helps his elderly parents by raising livestock and earning a living with this business. He grows feed crops on a small plot of land. Sobirdjon needs a loan to purchase fertilizers and seeds for the sowing and preparation for the spring season. He hopes that he will be able to raise his family's financial status by obtaining the necessary amount from Arvand.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru: Гулбахор 41 год. Она  замужем.У нее большая семья, четверо прекрасных детей. Гулбахор трудолюбивая женщина, любящая мать и прекрасная хозяйка. Вместе с мужем они содержать свою большую дружную семью. У нее свой бизнес. Она арендует небольшой магазин. Торгует Гулбахор  продовольственными товарами первой необходимости. Дети по  мере возможности после школьных занятий помогают родителям, но   Гулбахор считает основное занятие , которым  должны заниматься дети это получение образования.  Как и все родители ей хотелось бы дать своим детям хорошее образование. Для этого ей и мужу необходимо много работать. Сейчас Гулбахор хочет расширить ассортимент товаров и для этого хочет взять недостающую сумму  в кредит. Она уверена , что при помощи  "Арванд"  сможет поднять доходность своей семьи до необходимого уровня.
texts.en: Gulbahor is 41 years old. She is married and has a large family with four beautiful children. Gulbahor is a hardworking woman, loving mother and beautiful homemaker. She and her husband provide for their large and friendly family. She has her own business. She leases a small store, where she sells essential consumer products. The children help the parents whenever possible after school, but Gulbahor thinks that the children's primary focus should be obtaining education. Just like all parents, she wants to give her children good education. She and her husband need to work a lot to provide this. Now Gulbahor wants to expand the selection of her products and obtain a loan for the necessary amount. She is convinced that, with the help of Arvand, she will be able to raise her family's income to the necessary level.

loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Nhóm 17 - Bình Xuyên Group

texts.en: Toan, 47, works in agricultural production and eans a monthly income of about VND 720,000. She is married with two grown children. She has been a member of the local Women's Union since 1990. Her household does not have a hygienic latrine yet. With this loan, Toan will have a septic tank toilet installed in her home in order to improve the quality of life for her family members and contribute to sanitary improvement in her community. In this photo, Toan is pictured fourth from the left.

loans.use: To pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for hand-washing with soap

loans.name: Ghulam  Fatima

texts.en: Ghulam Fatima is 38 years old, married and is the mother of six children. She is keen to provide her family with a better standard of living. That is why she started a business selling livestock with the support of her husband. She earns a good amount of income to help meet her household expenses. Now, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more animals for reselling in the market. She desires to improve her standard of living thorough all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more livestock for reselling in the market.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en: Safia is a 49-year-old married woman. She is a vigorous lady, and has been running a business selling bed sheets in order to earn a good amount to contribute to her family's income. She buys collections of bed sheets in various colors and designs from the market, at wholesale rates, and then sells them to the people in her community. She has a varied customer base, and is able to earn enough through her business. Safia is requesting a 40,000 PKR loan from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of bed covers, spreads, and pillows, in different colors and designs, to attract more customers and to expand her inventory. Safia expects her loan to provide a boost in her earnings, and she plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of bed covers, spreads, and pillows in different colors and designs, to attract more customers and to expand her inventory.

loans.name: Ismatillo

texts.ru:
Исматилло 47 лет. У него средне-специальное образование. Исматилло работает фельдшером в амбулатории села. Он оказывает медицинскую помощь жителям села. У него двое детей . Старший сын  учится в выcшем учебном заведении и на учебу необходимы средства. Исматилло считает , что  хорошее образование необходимо для будущего и поэтому он старается, чтобы  сын получил высшее образование и в будущем конечно же устроился на хорошо оплачиваемую работу. 
Так как  выплатить сразу всю сумму взноса за учебу у него не получается он хочет взять кредит для оплаты обучения сына, так как погашать частями долг ему будет легче. Для этой цели он обратился в"Арванд" и узнав о поддержке КИВА он надеется что сможет воплотить свои планы в реальность.
texts.en: Ismatillo is 47 years old. He has a specialized secondary education. Ismatillo works as a paramedic at the village ambulance. He provides medical aid to the village residents. He has two children. His oldest son attends a university and requires money to pay for the education. Ismatillo thinks that a good education is necessary for the future and tries to ensure that his son obtains higher education and, of course, finds a good-paying job in the future. Because he cannot pay the entire university tuition, he wants to obtain a loan to pay for his son's education, since it will be easier for him to pay off the debt in parts. He came to Arvand for this goal and, after learning about the support from Kiva, he hopes that he will be able to realize his plans.

loans.use: to buy for his son's university tuition

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Razia  is a 51-year-old married woman. In order to support her husband in taking care of the family she began a business of milk selling. She is known in her town for providing good quality milk. She owns buffaloes for milking. She is happily supporting her family with the income generated. She has requested for a loan of 40,000 PKR  in order to purchase another buffalo to inflate her sales in order to generate more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to inflate her sales in order to generate more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.name: Marie Thérèse

texts.fr:
Marie Thérèse est une cliente d’un de nos guichets qui se situent en zone rurale. Elle est couturière depuis 10 ans, mais s’active aussi dans le commerce. Marie Thérèse vient solliciter un crédit de cent cinquante milles pour acheter des céréales : mil, arachide, haricots à un prix très abordable, les stocker pendant des mois pour pouvoir les revendre à un prix plus intéressant. 
En faisant du stockage, cela n’empêche pas à Marie-Thérèse d’exercer son activité de confection, de quoi, elle pourra régler ses besoins quotidiens ainsi que la dépense quotidienne. 
Elle désire développer plus son activité de couture et ouvrir un grand atelier de confection.
texts.en:
Marie Thérèse is a client at one of the branches that is situated in a rural area. She has been a seamstress for ten years, but she also works in commerce. 

She is seeking a loan for 150,000 [francs CFA] to buy cereals--millet, groundnuts, beans--at an affordable price, which she will store for some months and then resell at a better price.

Doing this work does not interfere with her tailoring business, and she is able to manage her everyday needs, especially her everyday expenses.

Marie Thérèse wishes to further develop her tailoring business and open a large workshop.

loans.use: to buy cereals to resell

loans.name: Almira

texts.ru:
Альмире 53 года. У нее высшее образование ,  она работает врачом в городской клинической больнице.  Очень любит свою профессию, так как  она понимает, что от нее зависит здоровье а порою и жизнь ее пациентов. Альмира одна воспитала своих детей и вот теперь , когда они подросли  и стали самостоятельными она не перестает помогать молодом семьям детей. Она помогает растить внука. 
Сейчас Альмира хочет взять кредит для оплаты учебы внука. Она придает большое значение образованию и хочет внести  и свой вклад в образовании внуков и тем самым помочь детям. Она заранее благодарна "Арванд " в поддержке и помощи.
texts.en:
Almira is 53 years old. She has a higher education. She works as a doctor in the city's clinical hospital. She really loves her profession as she understands that her patients' health, and occasionally their lives, depend on her. Almira raised her children alone and now that they are all grown-up and self-sufficient, she has not stopped helping her children's young families. She helps raise her grandson.

Now Almira wants to take out a loan to pay for her grandson' tuition. She attaches a huge importance to education and wants to make a contribution to her grandson' education and thus help her children. She thanks Arvand in advance for their support and assistance.

loans.use: to pay for her grandson's tuition.

loans.name: Nhóm 18 - Bình Xuyên Group

texts.en: Gon, 43, works in the agricultural sector where she earns a monthly income of about VND 730,000. She is married with three children still in school. She has been a member of the local Women's Union since 2002. Her family is in an economic hardship situation and could not afford to have a sanitary latrine. With this loan, she will build a septic tank toilet, which will improve the hygiene and health for the family members by preventing diseases commonly associated with unhygienic toilets. In this photo, she is pictured first from the left.

loans.use: To pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for hand-washing with soap

loans.name: Nhóm 8 - Bình Xuyên Group

texts.en: Mrs. Dao, pictured first from the left, is 57-years-old. She works as a farmer who makes about VND 720,000 monthly. She is married with four grown children. She has been a member of the local Women's Union since 1987. Her family does not have a sanitary latrine. With this loan, Dao will have a septic tank toilet installed in her home, which will improve the hygiene and health of her family members and contribute to environmental protection.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for hand-washing with soap.

loans.name: Nhóm 21 - Bình Xuyên Group

texts.en: Mrs. Tuân, 52, works in the agricultural sector and earns about 750,000 dong (VND) monthly. She is married with five grown children, who live separately from her. She has been a member of the local women's union since 1999. Her husband's health is not good for work. Her family does not have a hygienic toilet. With this loan, Tuân will build a septic tank latrine to improve the health of family members by preventing diseases commonly associated with unhygienic toilets. In this photo, she is pictured first from the left.

loans.use: To pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for hand washing with soap

loans.name: Nhóm 9 - Bình Xuyên Group

texts.en: Mrs. Khanh, 50, works in the agricultural sector and makes about VND 730,000 monthly. She is married with one grown child. She has been a member of the Women's Union since 1985. Her family does not have a sanitary toilet yet. Khanh is requesting for a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a sanitary toilet. This will not only improve her family's hygiene and health but also contribute to the sanitary improvement in her community. In this photo, she is pictured first from the left.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for hand-washing with soap.

loans.name: Nhóm 10 - Bình Xuyên Group

texts.en: Mrs. Lam, 41, works in agricultural production with a monthly income of approximately VND 730,000. She is married with three children still in school. She has been a member of the local Women's Union since 1994. Now, her family is in an economic hardship situation and cannot afford to have a hygienic toilet. Therefore, Lam is requesting a loan which will help her family build a septic tank latrine. This will improve the health of her family members and contribute to environmental protection. In this photo, she is pictured first from the left.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for hand-washing with soap.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is single and has two children who attend school. She lives in Kampala, Uganda and takes care of one additional family member. She makes chips, fried chicken, and fish at the market, which she has been doing for six years. She works seven days a week. Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. 

Florence requested a loan from MCDT SACCO for 900,000 UGX, which she will use to buy a bag of Irish potatoes, cooking oil, spices, cabbages, and serving dishes. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food. Her goal is to build permanent business premises.

loans.use: to purchase Irish potatoes, cooking oil, spices, cabbages, and serving dishes.

loans.name: Youssouf

texts.fr:
Né en 1972 à BALALA, YOUSSOUF vit avec ses six enfants et son épouse dans une famille nucléaire à BALALA, un des villages de DANGASSA dans l’Arrondissement de KOUROUBA, Préfecture de KATI (Région de Koulikoro, République du MALI).
YOUSSOUF  n’a pas eu la chance de progresser à l’école, très vite  s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente de céréales: maïs, mil et  du haricot. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de ses clientèles, YOUSSOUF décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Il est à son premier prêt individuel  de commerce qui sera utilisé pour acheter, 5 sacs de maïs et 5 sacs de haricot. Il s’approvisionne à DIALAKOROBA et DANGASSA. Il effectue ses ventes  au comptant, à crédit, en gros, en détail et à domicile,  à une clientèle composés d’hommes et de femmes. 
YOUSSOUF espère réaliser (avec le prêt octroyé )un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et  s’investir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Born in 1972 in Balala, Youssouf lives with his six children and his wife. They live in a nuclear family in Balala, one of the villages of Dangassa in the district of Kourouba, in the commune of Kati (Koulikoro region, Republic of Mali). Youssouf did not have the opportunity to go through school, he quickly became interested in income generating activities, notably purchasing and selling grains: corn, millet and beans. 

In order to satisfy the growing needs of his customers, Youssouf decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso. He is at his first individual loan which will be used to purchase five bags of corn and five bags of beans. He gets his stock from Dialakoroba and Dangassa. He carries out his transactions by cash and credit, wholesale, retail and at home to a customer base of men and women. 

With his portion of the loan, Youssouf hopes to make an average monthly profit of 100 000 FCFA which will be used to repay his loan and to invest in his business.

loans.use: to buy agricultural products.

loans.name: Mirzorahim

texts.ru:
Мирзорахим молодой амбициозный человек, стремящийся сейчас начать свой бизнес. В возрасте 28 лет он открывает столовую в центре своего города Худжанд. До этого времени он работал мастером по ремонту домов и эта работа у него была сезонная, т.е. зимой он оставался совсем без источника дохода.
Мирзорахим женат. Его жена домохозяйка и у них имеется двухлетний сын. Мирзорахим уже нашел хорошее помещение для столовой и арендовал его. На сумму запрашиваемого кредита он хочет приобрести электрическую плиту, газ, а также необходимые продукты. Мирзорахим уже составил меню для своей столовой, который будет включать завтраки, первые и вторые блюда, такие как суп, рассольник, знаменитый худжандский плов и т.д. Он считает, что этот бизнес ему принесет успех, и надеется на вашу финансовую поддержку, в которой он сейчас нуждается.
texts.en:
Mirzorahim is a young, ambitious person who is striving to start his own business.  At the age of 28, he's opening a cafeteria-style diner in the center of his city, Khujand.  He previously worked as a home repair contractor, and this job of his was seasonal; that is, during winters, he would have to make do without any source of income at all.  

Mirzorahim is married; his wife is a homemaker, and they have a two-year-old son together.  Mirzorahim has already found a good building for his diner and has rented it.  Using the money he's requesting with this loan, he wants to buy an electric stove and stock up on gas as well as necessary food items.
Mirzorahim has already created a menu for his diner which will include breakfasts, starter dishes and main courses, including soup, rassolnik, the famous Khujand pilaf and so on.  He feels that this business will bring him success, and is counting on your financial support, which he is currently in need of.

loans.use: buy an electric stove and stock up on gas and necessary food items

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita is a 44-year-old married woman living in Ajuy, Iloilo. She has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than seven years now. Fishing is a lucrative venture in their community. Nenita is asking for a loan to buy fishing gear like nets, hooks, lead weights, floaters, and buckets for storage. This loan will enable Nenita and her husband to improve their fishing business, thus augmenting their income and profit. In the future, Nenita hopes of making their fishing business a success.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear like nets, hooks, lead weights, floaters, and buckets for storage

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children who all go to school. She takes care of one additional family member. She operates a boutique selling second-hand clothes. She has been in this business for the last six years. She gets additional income from rental houses. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy bales of second-hand clothes. Her major challenge includes seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to build a permanent business location. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Ramata

texts.fr:
Madame Ramata est l’une des pliés du banc village, elle compte à son actif plusieurs cycles dans le banc villageois et est restée très dynamique durant tout ce temps. Elle est âgée de 61 ans, est divorcée et mère de 04 enfants dont 01 fille et 03 garçons. Son activité s’inscrit dans l’achat et la revente de produits agricoles plus particulièrement l’arachide, le mil. Elle jouit d’une grande expérience dans ce domaine pour l’avoir fait pendant des années. 

Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter 20 sacs de 50 kg de graine d’arachide  non décortiqué pour décortiquer et revendre.

Les bénéfices lui serviront d’aider de mieux nourrir sa famille et de subvenir à ses propres besoins.
texts.en:
Ramata has been a member of the 'Banc Villageois' for some time and has benefitted from several loans.  During this time she has remained a dynamic business woman. 

Ramata is 61 years old, divorced and mother to four children, one girl and three boys.  She sells agricultural products, notably peanuts and millet, and has many years experience in this trade.

Her loan will be used to buy twenty 50 kg sacks of peanuts which she will shell and then resell.  Ramata's profits will help her to feed her family and meet her own needs.

loans.use: to buy 20 sacks, of 50 kgs each, of peanuts to be shelled and resold.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Mariées uniqement dans des ménages monogamiques, les huit membres du groupe Danaya ont en moyenne 42 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kalaban-coura l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu à Kalaban-coura. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, tubercules (pommes de terre), condiments et bananes plantains. Dans l’intention d’accroitre leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Ami (femme arrêtée en 2èmeposition de la  droite vers la gauche sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de tubercules (pommes de terre). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 8 sacs de pommes de terre en gros à Médine. La revente se fait en détails à  en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Ami compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 95 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
All married in monogamous households, the eight members of the Danaya group are on average 42 years old with five children. They all live in Kalaban-Coura, one of Bamako's neighborhoods, and became acquainted through neighborhood ties and their income-generating activities in Kalaban-Coura.

Group members are small retail merchants of tubers (potatoes), condiments and plantain bananas. Seeking to increase their working capital, group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second group loan cycle.

Mrs. Ami (the woman standing in the second position from right to left in the photo) is a great seller of tubers (potatoes). She plans to use her loan to buy eight bags of potatoes wholesale in Medina. Retail sales are conducted as an itinerant vendor to a clientele composed mainly of women.

Ami expects to achieve with this loan average monthly profits of 95,000 FCFA, which will be reinvested in the business and used to meet the household's small needs.

loans.use: buy tubers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase clothing.

loans.name: Sandra Maria

texts.es:
En el año 2000 nació el negocio de confección a terceros de la señora Sandra, empresa que hasta hoy cuenta con tres empleadas y que como tal son tercerizados por otras empresas vendedoras de prendas.
Ella es madre de una pequeña de 9 años de edad y se encuentra muy motivada pues gracias a las asesorías y el apoyo que recibe de la corporación interactuar ha logrado mejorar su negocio, uno de los impedimentos para que esta empresaria crezca es la falta de capital para invertir en maquinaria y es por esta razón que Sandra desea solicitar un apoyo para la compra y reparación y mantenimiento de maquinaria para la confección.
Dicho apoyo mejorara sus tiempos de producción y con la ayuda de dios podrá generar un empleo.
texts.en:
Sandra started her business making clothes for third parties in 2000. The business has three employees, and other companies outsource making clothing to them.

She is the mother of a young, 9-year-old daughter, and she is very motivated. Thanks to the advice and support that she receives from Interactuar, she has succeeded in improving her business. One of the hurdles that this businesswoman has overcome is the lack of capital to invest in machinery. This is the reason that Sandra wants to request a loan to buy, repair, and maintain machinery for manufacturing clothing.

This support will improve her production times, and with the help of God, she will be able to generate work.

loans.use: to buy, repair, and maintain machinery for manufacturing clothing.

loans.name: Jaime Alberto

texts.es:
Él es Jaime un carpintero de 37 años de edad, soltero y padre de un hijo de 15 años de edad que inicio su negocio por gusto al trabajo independiente y pro la obvia necesidad de realizar una actividad que le significara un ingreso para mantener su hogar y mandarle plata a su hijo de 15 años.
Su sueño es poder comprar una vivienda propia y trabaja duro para materializar ese sueño, su objetivo es iniciar con una casa de madera el cual pueda construir con sus propias manos  pero para ello debe juntar dinero, quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de una maquina ruteadora, insumos y materia prima que sería madera.
texts.en:
This is Jaime, who is a 37-year-old carpenter. He is single and is the father of a 15-year-old son. He started his business because he likes working independently and because of the need to do work that offers an income to maintain his household and send money to his son.

His dream is to be able to buy his own house, and he works hard to achieve this dream. His goal is to begin with a house made of wood, which he can build with his own hands, but for this, he must collect money. He wants to request a loan to buy a router machine, supplies, and raw materials (wood).

loans.use: to buy a router machine, supplies and wood for his business, since he is looking to build a house with his own hands.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DANAYA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 37 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Yamadibougou, préfecture de Barouéli, Région de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de l’habillement et de savon.
Les femmes du groupe DANAYA sont à leurs vingt deuxième prêts solidaires.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente MAINI, deuxième personne de la gauche vers la droite est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de l’habillement. 
Elle compte acheter des puces de pagne chez les grossistes à Bamako.
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce au marché à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 70 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The DANAYA group is made up of married women who are on average 37 years old with two children. They all live in traditional families in the Yamadibougou village, Barouéli prefecture, Ségou region (the fourth administrative region of Mali).
They know each other because they are relatives, neighbours, and friends. They sell clothing and soap.
These women are on their 22nd group loan.
With the goal of satisfying high customer demand, they have come to Soro Yiriwaso.
Maini, pictured second on the left, is illiterate. She currently sells clothing.
She plans to buy bundles of loincloth from the wholesalers in Bamako.
She sells in the market to mixed clientele. She expects to make a monthly profit of 70 000 CFA which she will reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.en: Lorenzo is a 46-year-old fisherman from Ajuy, Iloilo. He has been engaged in the fishing business for more than 15 years now. Fishing is his main source of income. Lorenzo wants to improve this venture but he lacks the capital to do so. Sot, he joined CEVI to borrow money to buy fishing gear like fishing nets and a new boat engine. This loan will be a great help to Lorenzo in improving his business as well as his income and profit. Lorenzo dreams of improving his livelihood in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear like fishing nets and a new boat engine

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI  est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 33 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Fana, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréales, de l’habillement, fruits et légumes, de boisson et d’articles divers.
Les femmes du groupe BENKADI  sont à leur septième prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente FATOUMATA, première personne de la droite vers la gauche dans le rang des assises est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse friperie. Elle compte acheter deux balles de friperie chez les grossistes à Bamako.
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle et au marché à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40.000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group  is made up of married women who are on average 33 years old with 3 children. They all live in traditional families in the village of Fana, Dioila prefecture, Koulikoro region (the second administrative region of Mali).
They know each other because they are relatives, neighbours, and friends. They sell grains, clothing, fruits and vegetables, drinks, and more.
They are on their seventh group loan.
With the goal of satisfying great customer demand, they have come to Soro Yiriwaso.
Fatoumata, pictured first on the right, seated, is illiterate. She currently sells used clothing.
She plans to buy two flats of used clothing from the wholesalers at Barnako.
She sells from home or in the market to a mixed clientele. She expects to make a monthly profit of 40 000 CFA, which she will reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Ramata's Group

texts.fr:
Ce  groupe  créé le 04 Juillet  2008 lors de l’inauguration leur banc villageois. Il compte en son sein des femmes qui habitent toutes dans le même village. Elles partagent des valeurs de solidarité et entre aide qui caractérisent leurs actions et relations entre membre. Le banc villageois est à son onzième cycle ce qui fait que les femmes jouissent d’une bonne expérience dans le petit commerce qui constitue leur activité  principale.

Madame Ramata  (debout à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants dont 02 filles. Elle s'investi toujours dans la vente de légumes plus précisément la vente d’aubergine et de piment, activité qui lui respectivement rapporte après chaque tourné un bénéfice nette de 25 000  et 7 000 F CFA.

Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 5 sacs de piment, du gombo et divers légumes pour la revente.

 Les bénéfices lui servent d’une part à participer de manière significative aux dépenses quotidiennes de nourriture et frais scolaire pour les enfants et d’autres part à accroître son épargner.
texts.en:
This group was created 4 July 2008 during the inauguration of their banc villageois. It is made up of women who all live in the same village. These women share values of solidarity and mutual aid, and this characterizes their actions and relations between each other. The banc villageois is on its 11th loan cycle, which has given these women a good experience with their work in small-scale commerce.

Ramata (who is standing on the far right with her hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. She is married and a mother of three children, of whom two are girls. Ramata has always invested in the selling of vegetables, more specifically, eggplant and peppers, which brings her a net profit of 25,000 and 7,000 francs CFA respectively.

With this new loan, she plans to buy five sacs of peppers, okra, and other types of vegetables to resell. A part of these earnings will allow her to contribute in a real way to covering the everyday expenses related to food and her children's school fees. The other part will be used to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy five sacs of peppers, okra, and other vegetables to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy grains and peanuts

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJIGUISSEME est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 45 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Fana, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréales, de jarre et de boisson.
Les femmes du groupe DJIGUISSEME sont à leur dixième prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente CHATA, personne au milieu dans le rang des debout est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de jarre. Elle compte acheter des jarres chez les grossistes à Markala.
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce au marché à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 70 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The DJIGUISSEME group is made up of married women who are on average 45 years old with 5 children. They all live in traditional families in the village of Fana, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region (the second administrative region of Mali).
They know each other because they are relatives, neighbours, and friends. They sell grains, earthenware, and drinks.
These women are on their 10th group loan.
With the goal of satisfying their high customer demand, they have come to Soro Yiriwaso.
Chata, photographed in the middle of the standing row, is illiterate. She currently sells earthenware. She plans to buy products from the wholesalers in Markala.
She sells to mixed clientele in the market. She expects to make a monthly profit of 70 000 FCA which she will reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy earthenware.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a large amount of rice to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy leather sheets for shoe making for her husband's business

loans.name: Aizhamal

texts.en:
Aizhamal is a freshman at the American University of Central Asia, Department of Software Engineering. Here is her story:

“A big family has big problems. We have seven in our family: my parents, my two older brothers, me and two siblings at school. My father and one of the older brothers are unemployed due to their health problems. My mother is the only breadwinner of our family. My second brother is a student at another local university. We have a lack of money all the time, always trying to save money and thinking about how to earn more. I try to help my family and work in summers, which is hardly enough to buy books and clothes for myself for the semester. We also have a field, and we grow vegetables and fruits, Part of it we eat, and the rest we sell at the markets.

We live in Issyk-Kul region in Kyrgyzstan. Last year I finished school and studied at the New Generation Academy of AUCA due to my full scholarship. It allowed me to study, live and eat for free, make me familiar with the American system of education and presented me with a lot of good friends and caring teachers. I met a new academic world where all students came from different parts of Kyrgyzstan with the same dream-to study and to enter AUCA. 

I know that AUCA is a special place, which can help me to defeat poverty in my family, be well-educated in order to achieve goals in the future, and be able to assist other needy people in my country. If I want to make the world better and establish peace in the world, I should start the improvements from myself. In this case I need a good education, which is possible just with the help of AUCA financial aid and a Kiva loan.”

loans.use: to pay for her higher education

loans.name: Nhóm 22 - Bình Xuyên Group

texts.en: Hue, pictured first from the left, is 43 years old. She works in the agricultural sector and earns a monthly income of VND 750,000. She has two school-aged children. She has been a member of the local Women's Union since 1999. Her husband passed away 10 years ago. She has to raise their two children on her own. Due to the family's economic hardship, they cannot afford to have a sanitary toilet. With this loan, she will use the funds to build a septic tank toilet, which will improve the hygiene and health for the family members by preventing diseases commonly associated with unhygienic toilets.

loans.use: To pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for handwashing with soap

loans.name: Takwa Group

texts.en:
This group is called Takwa. It consists of four women from the city of Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 290,000 YER from AMB.

Takwa is the leader of the group. She is a 54-year-old married woman and mother of four children, living in an old house which needs renovation from the inside. Her husband is the sole breadwinner of the family. He receives a very limited income which is not enough to do the necessary renovation of the house. Takwa applied for a loan of 80,000 YER from AMB to buy construction materials to renovate the house from the inside.

Takwa hopes to build the second floor and renovate it.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to renovate her house from the inside.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing and footwear

loans.name: Nhóm 23 - Bình Xuyên Group

texts.en: Mrs. Chinh, 44, works in the agricultural sector, where she earns about VND 740,000 monthly. Her 70-year-old mother has been sick for a long time and cannot move by herself, while her four children are still in school. Her husband is weak and easily gets sick for the whole year. Her family does not have a sanitary toilet. Therefore, she is requesting a loan which will help her build a sanitary latrine, to improve the health and hygiene of her family members. She has been a member of the local Women's Union since 1996. In this photo, she is pictured first from the left.

loans.use: To pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for handwashing with soap

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJEKAFO est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 51 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Yamadibougou, préfecture de Barouéli, Région de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de condiments, de l’habillement et de Pâté.
Les femmes du groupe DJEKAFO sont à leurs vingt deuxième prêts solidaires.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente OUMOU, première personne de la droite vers la gauche est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de condiments.
 Elle compte acheter des sacs de sel, des cartons de Cube Maggi, des bidons d’huile de palme, du grain d’arachide et des boites de pâte de tomate chez les grossistes à Barouéli.
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce au marché à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 90 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The DJEKAFO group is made up of married women who are on average 51 years old with 2 children. They live in traditional families in the Yamadibougou village, Barouéli prefecture, Ségou region (the fourth administrative region of Mali).
They know each other because they are relatives, neighbours, and friends. They have restaurants, sell condiments, and sell clothing.
These women are on their 22nd group loan.
With the goal of satisfying their great customer demand, they have come to Soro Yiriwaso.
Oumou, pictured first on the right, is illiterate. She currently sells condiments.
She plans to buy bags of salt, cartons of Maggi-brand flavouring, palm oil, peanut butter, and boxes of tomato paste from the wholesalers in Barouéli.
She sells in the market to mixed clientele. She expects to make a monthly profit of 90 000 CFA, which she will reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy pagnes wax (colorful West-African fabric) and aluminum cups

loans.name: Mohira

texts.en: Mohira was born in 1992. She is a hardworking woman from Tajikistan. Mohira is married and has a little child who is five years old. Her husband is a businessman and Mohira also wants to be a businesswoman. She is going to start a business with a food market. She took part in a course ‘To Get Ahead’ from the women's organization and got a certificate. She will buy food items and sell them in a local market. Her husband will help her with managing the business. She is asking for a loan of 2000 Somoni (TJS) to buy food items for organizing the new business. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy food items for organizing her new business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair his house. He wants to build a ceiling, and then he would like to install pipes, and buy building materials for his home.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 54 years. He is married, and together with his spouse, has been blessed with five children between the ages of 30 and 15 years old. John is a farmer as well as a retailer, a business he has done for the last 34 years, earning a monthly income of 48,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). His spouse provides additional income for the family.

John has requested his first loan with VisionFund Kenya of 20,000 KES, which he will use to buy more stock of sugar, milk, soap, maize flour and bread as retail stock. With the anticipated profits, John will be able to repay his loan as well as expand his business. His hope and dream for the future is to transition to wholesale business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of retail goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing and footwear for resale

loans.name: Dzame

texts.en:
Dzame is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past five years she has operated a cosmetic selling shop business, selling at retail to her neighbours and passerby.She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her businses.She dreams of establishing a retail shop business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 20,000, she wants to purchase a stock of cosmetics and food stuff to sell. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of cosmetics and food stuff

loans.name: Elma Andreina

texts.es:
Elma trabaja como ama de casa, pero siempre anda en busca de un buen futuro para sus hijas tiene dos hijas de muy pequeñas edades, ella es una mujer casada de 25 años de edad, vive en Sololá. 

Elma es una señora que le gusta apoyar a su esposo, aparte de ser ama de casa, pues ella desde hace  3 años empezó a trabajar para la empresa Avon, (productos por catalogo) ella va de casa en casa a ofrecer estos productos tales como: cosméticos, ropa, zapatos, juguetes entre otros productos, esta venta lo realiza en su comunidad y algunos lugares circunvecinos. 

 Elma empezó a trabajar para esta empresa, porque tiene un propósito, ya que uno de los anhelos de ella es remodelar su vivienda, el apoyo que ella quiere dar a esposo, es conseguir un prestamos y ella se encargaría de pagarlo, con las ganancias  que  genera su negocio y parte de este préstamo lo utilizaría también para invertir más en su negocio. Elma es una mujer que siempre ha luchado al lado de su esposo para sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Elma, 25, is a housewife who is always looking for ways to improve the future for her two little daughters.  She is married and lives in Solola.  

She likes to support her husband so, apart from looking after the housework, she started to work for Avon (a catalog company) three years ago.  She goes from home to home selling products such as cosmetics, clothes, shoes, and toys among other things.  She sells these products in her community and in the surrounding areas.  

She started working for this company because she has a strong desire to refurbish her house.  She would like to assist her husband by getting a loan and paying it back herself with the profits that she makes in her business.  She will use part of the loan to improve her home and the rest she will invest in her business.  

She has always been by her husband's side, striving for a better future for her family.

loans.use: to refurbish her house.

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam is 27 years old and a married woman. She is running a business of milk sales with her husband. They sell milk to many of their neighbors, along with butter and cheese that they make from the milk. 

 Maryam looks after the buffaloes and performs the task of collecting milk from them while her husband sells it in different places on a daily basis. They are happily doing it together to support their family. They have five children, therefore they need to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures including food, clothing, healthcare, and education.

 In order to boost their earnings, Maryam requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers.

loans.name: Nader

texts.en:
Nader is a 41-year-old married man with three children, living with his family in a very old house in Sana'a, Yemen. That house was inherited from his father and it is threatening to fall down at any time. 

Nader is the sole breadwinner of the family and his income is not enough to make the necessary renovation for that house. Nader strives hard to make the house safe but he doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, he applied for a loan of 500,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase construction materials to renovate the house.

Nader looks forward to opening a saving account in the bank to help him in purchase a piece of land to build another house.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to renovate his house.

loans.name: Kossiwa Judith

texts.fr: JUDITH est une femme mariée et mère d’un enfant ; âgée de 43 ans, elle fait le commerce des produits plastiques de tout genre depuis l’an 2000 et s’approvisionne une fois par mois au grand marché de Lomé chez les grossistes et les revend dans le marché d’Adidogomé où elle habite. JUDITH voulait un prêt pour accroître son approvisionnement en ajoutant d’autres marchandises ; ce qui pourra l’aider à mieux vendre et faire assez de bénéfices pour faire face aux besoins de leur foyer.
texts.en:
Judith is a married woman and a mother of one child. She is 43 years old and has worked selling plastic goods of all kinds since 2000. She procures her goods once a month at the main market in Lomé from wholesalers and then resells them at a Adidogomé market where she lives. 

Judith would like a loan to increase her stock by adding other types of goods. This will allow her to sell more and increase her earnings, which she will use to take care of her household expenses.

loans.use: to buy 18 dozen plastic bowls, 25 dozen pairs of plastic scissors, and seven dozen coolers

loans.name: Nhóm 30 - Bình Xuyên Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chuc, pictured first from the left, is 47 years old. She is married with three grown children. She has been a member of the local Women's Union since 1999. Her husband's health is not good, and her family is classified as a poor family. They do not have a sanitary latrine yet. 

With this loan, Chuc will use the funds to build a septic tank latrine, which will improve the health of her family members and contribute to the environmental protection.

loans.use: To pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for hand-washing with soap

loans.name: Saidbi

texts.en:
Saidbi has a dining room where she works as a cook. She cooks very tasty national dishes. Saidbi simultaneously is involved in animal husbandry in the yard of her home. She has been engaged in these activities for over ten years.

Saidbi is 58 years old. She lives in Khuroson district with two daughters who are 21 and 18 years old. Both of her daughters are engaged in trade of vegetables in the market. After work, they also help their mother in animal husbandry.

Saidbi basically is breeding young calves, and after fattening them, resells them at the livestock market. Currently Saidbi asks for a loan to buy several young calves in order to increase the number of livestock, and thus to increase the income from livestock activity.

In the future, after successful repayment of this loan, Saidbi is planning to get a repeat loan for expanding her dining room.

loans.use: To purchase several young calves

loans.name: Fatoumata Binta's Group

texts.fr:
Nouvellement inauguré ce 23 décembre 2014 ce banc villageois est composé de femmes désireux d’améliorer leurs conditions d’existence via des activités génératrices de revenu. Elles vivent dans un même village depuis plusieurs décennies et entretiennent des relations de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles s’activent dans le petit commerce. 

Madame Fatoumata Binta, âgée de 33 ans (assise à la troisième position de la gauche vers la droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette de ce groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de  trois enfants. Elle est vendeuse de la glace et de crème glacée, elle tient aussi une table où elle vend du thé, du sucre et des condiments. Elle achètera ses marchandises auprès des producteurs du village.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 02 sacs de pain de singe et 02 sacs de feuilles de bissap rouge.
 
Avec  les bénéfices, elle compte développer son activité et reprendre son activité d’aviculture
texts.en:
This group was formed very recently, on 23rd December 2014.  It is made up of women who all want to improve their living conditions by improving their businesses.  The women have lived in the same village for many years and show remarkable solidarity.  They sell various products.

Fatoumata Binta (sitting third from the right in the photo, with her hand raised) is 33 years old and the group representative.  She is married and mother to three children.  She sells ices, ice cream, tea, sugar and other food products from a small stall.  She buys her supplies from producers in the village.

Fatoumata Binta intends to buy two sacks of baobab fruit and two sacks of red hibiscus leaves.  Her profits will be used to develop her business and restart her poultry business.

loans.use: to develop her food production business and restart her poultry business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Nasur

texts.en:
Nasur lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has five children, four of whom go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells second-hand clothes from home. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last 10 years. She works six days a week. 

Nasur has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy more bales of second-hand clothes. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a truck to build rental houses. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a supply of cereals.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy rice and condiments

loans.name: Tacko's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois a été créé le 17 Septembre 2011 lors l’inauguration du dit banc villageois. Ce groupement vient d’entamer son septième cycle et  compte des femmes qui habitent toutes le même village. Elles jouissent d’une bonne entente et d’un bon esprit de groupe. Elles  ont comme activité principale le petit comme, accompagné d’activité de maraichage durant l’hivernage.

Madame Tacko (debout à l’extrême droite avec une main levée),  est l’emprunteuse vedette du  groupe. Elle est âgée 34 ans, mariée et mère de 06 enfants dont 04 garçons et 02 filles. Elle s’active dans la vente de produits de consommation courante à savoir : le riz, l’huile, le savon en morceau et divers autres produits alimentaires. Elle achète sa marchandise au marché hebdomadaire de la localité distant d’une vingtaine de kilomètre pour la revente au village. Elle pratique cette activité depuis plusieurs années.

Avec ce nouveau crédit elle compte acheter 3 sacs de riz,  un bidon d’huile, 02 sacs de sucre et divers bouillions culinaires.

Avec les bénéfices qu’elle compte accompagner son mari dans les charges de la famille, développer ses activités génératrices de revenu et consolider son épargne.
texts.en:
This banc villageois was created on September 17, 2011 at the time of the inauguration of the banc villageois. This group is just beginning its seventh cycle and is made up of women who all live in the same village. They get along with each other well and have a good group spirit. Their primary activity is small-scale commerce along with market gardens during the rainy season. 

Madame Tacko (standing on the far right with her hand raised) is the featured borrower from this group. She is 34, married, and the mother of six children, four boys and two girls. She works at selling daily-use items: rice, oil, bar soap, and various foodstuffs. She buys her merchandise in a weekly market located about 20 kilometers away, for resale in the village. She has been in this trade for several years. 

With this new loan she intends to buy three sacks of rice, one jerrycan of oil, two sacks of sugar, and various bouillon cubes used for cooking. With her profit, she intends to contribute together with her husband to covering family expenses, develop her money-earning activities, and consolidate her savings.

loans.use: to buy three sacks of rice, a jerrycan of oil, two sacks of sugar, and various bouillon cubes for cooking.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more sheep for his barn.

loans.name: Aissatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe créé en décembre 2008, est à  son quinzième cycle dan le programme. Les femmes vivent dans le même village et entretiennent de bons rapports de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles  s’activent dans le petit commerce et l’agriculture sous pluie.

Madame Aissatou (assise à  droite avec une main levée) est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 52 ans. C’est une dame tés engagée dans les activités du banc villageois, elle s’active dans la vente de produits agricoles et de la cueillette huile de palme par exemple. Elle a une grande une bonne expérience dans ce domaine. 

 Avec son crédit, elle prévoit d’acheter 03 bidons d'huile de palme, 02 bidons de 10 litres de jus de citron pour la revente.

 Avec les bénéfices,  elle compte assurer la prise en charge alimentaire, sanitaire et vestimentaire pour ces enfants d’une part et d’autre part renforcer son épargne.
texts.en:
This group was formed in December 2008.  This will be their fifteenth loan cycle.  The women all live in the same village and have demonstrated a very good sense of solidarity.  They all work in retail or rain-fed agriculture.

Aissatou (sitting on the right in the photo, with her hand raised) is the group representative.  She is 52 years old and married.  She is very active within the 'Banc Villageois' and sells agricultural products and harvests palm oil.  Aissatou has a lot of experience in her business.  She plans to use her loan to buy three drums of palm oil and two 10 litre drums of lemon juice for resale.

Aissatou will use some of her profits to pay for food, clothing and healthcare for her children.  The rest of it will be put into her savings.

loans.use: to buy 3 drums of palm oil and 2 drums (10 litres) of lemon juice for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Hai

texts.en:
Hai would like to take a further loan to buy more fish to sell from her stall. Hai's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. 

Hai hopes that her second loan will help her continue to increase the size of her business, attract new customers, and grow sales. 

Hai also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Gulbeka

texts.en:
Gulbeka was born in 1974 year. She is very hardworking woman from Tajikistan. Gulbeka is widowed, and has a child. She works hard every day to earn a living. 

Gulbeka is a sewer; she sews national dresses for women. She begun this activity 10 years ago, when her husband died. For 10 years, Gulbeka has been working hard. 

She is going to increase working capital and in this way improve business. She is asking for a loan of 800 USD to buy fabric for increasing her working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy fabric to increase her working capital

loans.name: Alexander

texts.es:
Alexander es un creativo y emprendedor joven de tan solo 21 años de edad que se desempeña en una estampación que el mismo fundo en el año 2009, es un joven que le gusta trabajar y valerse de sí mismo. 
Gracias a las enseñanzas de su padre fue que aprendió todo lo relacionado con la estampación y ahora quiere ser arriesgado, seguir con su espíritu emprendedor y generar empleo y lo hará con la ayuda de un crédito el cual invertirá en la compra de una maquina plana, 2 máquinas de aguja, maquina fileteadora.
Para Alexander el apoyo representara un gran impulso motivacional pues aparte de que será una oportunidad de expandirse podrá generar empleo.
texts.en:
Alexander is a creative and enterprising young man who is only 21 years old.  He works in a business of printing on clothing, a business he founded in the year 2009.  He is a young man who likes to work and manage by himself.

Thanks to his father’s teaching, he learned everything having to do with printing.  He now wants to take a chance, to continue with his enterprising spirit, and generate employment.  He will do it with the help of a loan.  He will use the loan to buy a lock-stitch machine, two, single needle lock-stitch sewing machines, and a serge machine.

This support stands as a great motivation for Alexander.  Besides being an opportunity to expand, he will be able to generate employment.

loans.use: to set up a sewing shop to expand his printing business.

loans.name: Oanh's Group

texts.en:
Oanh is 53 years old and lives with her son and her husband. For the past four years, Oanh has been running a food stall at the front of her house to earn an income to support her family. She is the Group Leader of a 3-member loan group that all live in Ho Chi Minh City. In the picture she is in the centre wearing a blue blouse. Each of the other group members is requesting a loan to fund income-generating activities. 

Oanh is requesting a loan to purchase a better quality and greater variety of food and appliances for her food stall. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional ones. She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: To buy food and appliances for her food stall.

loans.name: Sadafoy

texts.en:
Sadafoy was born in 1958 year. She is an industrious woman. Sadafoy is widowed and has a child. She worked for more than 26 years in a state organization as a cleaning woman. Sadafoy has experienced a lot of difficulties in her life. She has raised her son alone. Sadafoy works hard every day to earn a living. 

She needs financial support now because she is ill and she must to buy medicines for her treatment. Sadafoy is asking for a loan of 3,000 Somoni to buy medicines for treatment. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy medicines for treatment

loans.name: Sady Cristina

texts.es: Sady es una emprendedora mujer de 49 años de edad, propietaria de una tienda de víveres que funciona desde el año 1996, en un barrio ubicado en el municipio de Soledad, su idea de negocio se dío gracias a que su madre la visitó y observo que en el sector no habían tiendas de víveres, entonces le propuso a su hija que iniciara este negocio, su madre llevaba muchos años trabajando en este formato de negocio por tener una tienda en el pueblo donde vive, de esta manera Sady aceptó con gran expectativa iniciar el negocio.  Sus principales clientes son los vecinos del barrio y transeúntes del sector quienes realizan sus compras de contado o a crédito, en los horarios de atención de 6:00 a.m. a 10:00 p.m. todos los días.  Sady realiza sus compras y sus proveedores le brindan facilidad de pago, compra a graneros y también llegan preventistas de diferentes empresas a ofrecer productos de consumo masivo. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo capital que utilizará en la compra de víveres como arroz, aceite, legumbres, verduras, carnes, frutas, para surtir su negocio.  Ella manifiesta que esta inversión le generará un incremento significativo en sus ventas y mayor competitividad, porque comprará al por mayor y podrá ofrecer mejores precios. Sady es madre de una hija de 23 años, ella desea a largo plazo convertir su tienda de víveres en un negocio que tenga mayor surtido y mejores ventas.
texts.en: Sady is an entrepreneurial woman aged 49. She owns her own store that she has worked as since 1996. It is in a neighborhood located in the city of Soledad. She thanks her mom for her idea for her business because when she visited, she noticed that there were not stores where she lived. She then proposed that her daughter start this business. Her main customers are her neighbors and passersby who make their purchases in cash or credit during the open hours of 6:00 a.m. to 10:00 pm daily. Currently she is applying to a for a Kiva credit that FMSD provides and buy  supplies such as rice, oil, legumes, vegetables, meats, and fruits for her business. She said that this investment will generate a significant increase in sales and increased competitiveness, because she will buy in bulk and can offer better prices. Sady is a mother of a 23 year old daughter. Longterm, she wants to turn her grocery store into a business that has greater range and better sales.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as rice, oil, legumes, vegetables, meats, and fruits for her business.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for the family.

For the past 15 years she has operated a cosmetic selling shop business, selling at retail to her neighbours and passerby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of establishing a retail shop business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 20,000, she wants to purchase a stock of cosmetics to sell. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of cosmetics

loans.name: Rosendo Junior

texts.es: Rosendo es un joven de 22 años de edad, el cual se encuentra dedicado al negocio de tienda de víveres desde el año 2009, él inicio ayudando a su padre en las labores de la tienda y obtuvo experiencia, quiso continuar vinculado al negocio y actualmente lo administra, ya que después de haberse graduado del bachillerato su padre le cedió esta actividad ante sus dificultades de salud, él quedo encargado totalmente del negocio. En este negocio se comercializan productos de la canasta familiar como arroz, aceite, verduras, carne, leche, huevos, panes, café y demás artículos, su horario de atención es de 7 a.m. a 9:30 p.m. de lunes a domingo, él trabaja muy comprometido para cumplir con su meta de lograr estabilidad y prosperidad. Rosendo está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará víveres como arroz, aceite, verduras, carne, leche, huevos, panes, café, para mejorar el surtido del negocio. Rosendo ha tenido muchos desafíos que alcanzar como mantenerse organizado y buscar proveedores que le otorguen créditos para lograr mantener un buen stock de producto.
texts.en:
Rosendo, 22, has had a grocery store since 2009.  He started off helping his father in the shop and gained a lot of experience.  He wanted to continue in the business and once he had graduated from college his father turned it over to him due to ill health.  He is currently the person in charge.

This store sells basic household items such as rice, oil, vegetables, meat, milk, eggs, bread, coffee and other products. He opens at 7 am and closes at 9:30 pm, seven days a week.  He is very committed to achieving his goal of economic stability and prosperity.  

He is asking for a loan from Credikiva, the first he has applied for through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.  He will use it to buy supplies such as rice, oil, vegetables, meat, milk, eggs, bread, and coffee to improve the stock in his store.  

He has had to meet a lot of challenges, such as self-organization and looking for suppliers who will give him loans so that he can maintain good stock levels.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his grocery store.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is 56 years old. He is married with eight children between the ages of 10 and 38 years. Five of them go to school. He has been a farmer for 30 years. He will use the loan from Kiva to buy fertilizers for maize to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay his employees.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for maize to sell.

loans.name: Aswin

texts.en:
Aswin is a married mother of two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are medical fees.

For over ten years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and cooking fat.

loans.name: Alphonse

texts.en:
Alphonse is 27 years old. He is not married. He has been farming for 11 years, and with the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizer for maize and beans, which he will sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay for his employees.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for maize and beans

loans.name: Laura

texts.en: Laura lives in San Martin, Puebla and works helping her sister manage her home beauty parlor. Laura has lived with her parents for the last 39 years. Now that they run the beauty parlor in the house, she has to share room with her parents. She is really looking forward to having her own space and her own home. She owns a piece of land and has been saving to start building. She is now asking for a loan to start with the first phase of the construction. Given the informality of her job, Laura has no access to credit from other institutions or organizations. Laura will receive technical training and supervision to ensure that the construction meets quality and safety standards. Laura is looking forward to start her life as an independent woman.

loans.use: to start building her house

loans.name: Ny's Group

texts.en:
Ny is 35 years old and married with nine children. She lives in a rural area of the Sieam Bouk district of Steung Treng province. There are five children who are dependent on her: one is too young for school while the other four are in school. To make a living, she has been growing cassava as her main business and raising pigs to earn additional income. Cassava being destroyed by insects is the main challenge for her business. 

This is a first microloan for Ny with VisionFund. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan. Ny wants to use her loan portion to buy more cassava to grow and will use a portion of it to spend on buying soybean seeds to grow in order to earn additional income. She hopes to produce more crops from her business to sell for a good price–then she can continue supporting her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy more cassava to grow

location.town: Steung Treng Province, Sieam Bouk District

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.ru: Гулчехра жительница города Истаравшан. Ей 48 лет. Она замужем и имеет четырех детей. Она занимается торговлей женской одежды на базаре. Она покупает товар в оптовых рынках и продает в розницу на местном рынке. Её муж работает контролером. Её семья помогает ей в бизнесе.  Она подала заявку на кредит для расширения своего бизнеса. Она заранее благодарит за поддержку.
texts.en: Gulchehra, age 48, is a resident of the city of Istaravshan.  She is married and the mother of four children.  She sells women's clothes at the market.  She buys goods in wholesale at markets and sells them in the local market. Her husband works as a supervisor.  Her family help her to run the business.  She has applied for a loan in order to increase her activity.  She thanks you in advance for your support.

loans.use: to buy women's clothes.

loans.name: Nhóm 27 - Bình Xuyên Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lu, pictured first from the left, is 47 years old. She works in agricultural production and earns a monthly income of about VND 740,000. She is married, with four children still in school. She has been a member of the local Women's Union since 1999. 

Lu's family does not have a sanitary latrine yet. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a sanitary toilet. This will improve the hygiene and health of the family members by preventing diseases commonly associated with unhygienic toilets.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine, with a device for hand-washing with soap.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MARIA AUXILIADORA” iniciará el trigésimo tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Silvia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de mantas, tienda de barrio, venta de artículos de limpieza, venta de calzados, venta de pollitos, venta de chompas, venta de chompas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Silvia es integrante, ella indica que es el sexto año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una asesora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de mantas; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años, pues desde niña apoyaba a su madre en el negocio familiar y ya conocía la forma de venta de estos productos.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de telas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en la frontera Perú Bolivia. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.

En la imagen una de las socias se movió y por ello no es visible en la fotografía.
texts.en:
The communal bank 'Maria Auxiliadora' will start their thirtieth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes regional office.  It is made up of nine members and is run by a board of directors of which Silvia is the president.  The members run a variety of businesses in order to make a living such as selling blankets, a local store, sale of cleaning products, a shoe shop, sale of chickens, and the production of sweaters.  The loan system helps them to get ahead with their small businesses.  

Silvia tells us that it is her sixth year with Pro Mujer.  She became a member after an assessor from the organization visited her house.  She sells blankets for a living.  She started this business several years ago as she always helped her mother with the family business and learnt how to sell this type of product.  

She will use the loan to increase her capital and buy cloth in bulk from the wholesalers in La Paz.  She will then sell it on the border between Peru and Bolivia.  This work allows her to generate an income to be able to support her family financially as she is single and has one son.  

The thing that she likes most about Pro Mujer is the health benefits they offer.  

In the photo, one of the members is partially hidden as she moved when the photo was being taken.

loans.use: to buy cloth in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy goats.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 21-year-old single man from Bethlehem. He lives with his parents and six brothers and sisters in a small home. His father has a barber shop which has been operating for many years. Ahmad likes this job. He took a training in this field so he can work like his father. Ahmad rented a new store and he wants to start his own business. He prepared this store to be a modern barber shop. 

Ahmad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a chair for his barbershop. By taking this loan, Ahmad will be able to start his own business and improve the family income. 

Ahmad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a chair for his barbershop.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy goats.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 35 years old. He is a married man with a three-year-old child who is not yet going to school. John has been farming for 18 years, and will use the loan from Kiva to buy fertilizers to use to grow maize to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay his employees.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to use to grow maize to sell.

loans.name: Ornis José

texts.es: Ornis es un emprendedor hombre de 36 años de edad,  residente en un barrio del municipio de Barranquilla, él se encuentra dedicado a su tienda de víveres desde el año 2012, su idea de negocio surgió luego de haber trabajado por muchos años como auxiliar en un negocio de este mismo formato, él adquirió toda la destreza necesaria para las compras de los productos y aprendió a conocer este negocio tanto que decidió iniciar el suyo.
