En su tienda de víveres comercializa todos los productos referentes a la canasta familiar; café, leche, huevos, vegetales, carnes, enlatados, salsas, aderezos, bebidas, frutas y productos de aseo personal como detergentes, jabones, shampoo, sus principales clientes son los vecinos del barrio y transeúntes del sector quienes cancelan sus compras de contado y también les ofrece facilidad de pago. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará  canastas de cervezas para aprovechar la temporada decembrina y obtener mayores ganancias. Andrés es padre de un hijo de 6 años y una hija de 10 años de edad a quienes desea ofrecerles un mejor porvenir, por eso su meta familiar a largo plazo es comprar su casa y para su negocio es comprar un local.
texts.en:
Andrés is a young entrepreneur of 25 who lives in the municipality of Galapa. He has had a grocery store since 2012. The idea for his business came about when he left his native town to go to the municipality of Galapa, and he decided to live there.  

With a loan from his father he started the business. In his grocery store he sells basic household necessities, such as coffee, milk, eggs, vegetables, meats, canned goods, sauces, dressings, drinks, fruit as well as personal hygiene products such as detergents, soaps and shampoo. His main customers are people in the neighborhood and passersby who pay for their purchases with cash. He also extends credit. 

Now he is applying for a Kiva loan, his first from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, by means of which he will buy cases of beer in order to take advantage of the December season and earn more profits. 

Andres is the father of the six-year-old son and 10-year-old daughter, to whom he wishes to offer a better future. That is why his long-term family goal is to buy a home for them, and for his business to buy a store.

loans.use: To buy cases of beer in order to take advantage of the December season and earn more profits.

loans.name: Andresa

texts.en:
Andresa is from Aloran. She is a persevering and determined mother when it comes to the benefit of her family. She has always been known to provide the best for her family.

She earns a living through buying and selling grocery items. To generate more income, Andresa decided to expand her resources after she learned that she can get financial assistance from PMPC. As Andresa has saved an amount from her business, she thought of doing farming activities to earn additional income. Consequently, she requested a loan to pay for the acquisition of a pawned parcel of agricultural land to start her farming project.

Andresa smiles at the thought of having a comfortable life and providing her family and even her grandchildren a better life.

loans.use: to pay for the acquisition of a parcel of agricultural land.

loans.name: Sara Lucia

texts.es: A sus 20 años de edad Lucia es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos, el menor de 2 años y  la mayor de 5 años y ya asiste a la escuela, Lucia se dedica desde hace 2 años atrás a la venta de confites en los portones de las escuelas o colegios, Lucia va a invertir el crédito en la compra de confites para seguir trabajando y de sus ganancias tener para la alimentación y educación  de sus hijos.
texts.en: At age twenty, Lucia is a single mother. She has two children, a little boy who is two years old and a little girl who is five and already in school. For the past two years, Lucia has been working selling candy at the gates of different schools. Lucia will invest this loan in purchasing more candy in order to keep working and have enough earnings to pay for her children's food and education.

loans.use: to buy candy.

loans.name: Frolence

texts.en:
Frolence has a retail shop in Kapsabet town and has run this business for 5 years.   She is 47 years old, married and has 5 children. 

She will use this loan to buy sugar, flour, rice and cooking oil to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children. 

This is her first loan term from VisionFund Kenya and in future she hopes to have a prosperous business and support her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell.

loans.name: Llano Grande Group

texts.en:
The members of Llano Grande Group are Mexican farmers that have decided to install, in their houses without traditional electricity, Small Solar Home Systems (SSHS) which they were picking when the picture was taken, and for which is asked the funding. This will be paid back with the monthly fee that they pay for maintenance services during the first year of operation.
 
Maria, the only woman in the picture, lives as her neighbors in an isolated house where she, her husband and their daughter had neither electrical lighting nor any communications device. Now, they have four hours of efficient lighting provided by the SSHS for cooking more easily, as well as the possibility of connecting little appliances.

loans.use: for paying to have PV systems installed in her house

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay to have PV systems installed in their houses.

loans.name: Moctum Group

texts.en:
The members of Moctum Group are four Mexican farmers that have decided to install, in their houses without traditional electricity, Small Solar Home Systems (SSHS) which they were picking when the picture was taken (Anselmo, in the pasted thumbnail, couldn’t be present at that moment), and for which is asked the funding. This will be paid back with the monthly fee that these men pay for maintenance services during the first year of operation.
 
Leonardo, standing first from the left, has a very large family of seven members, including his two little granddaughters. The electricity provided by the SSHS may help this family to cook the babies’ meal or prepare brown sugar which is his livelihood.

loans.use: to have PV systems installed in their houses.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to have PV systems installed in their houses.

loans.name: Bedrije

texts.en:
Bedrije is 62 years old and has 1 child.  She requests this loan to pay for a dairy cow that she recently purchased on credit.   She has raised livestock  for a very long time and has two dairy cows and a calf.  She plants  fodder, corn, and  seasonal vegetables. She also grows grapes,  figs, plums, persimmons, and apricots.  She sells dairy products, fruit, and also vegetables  to the nearby farmer’s market. 

Bedrije and her husband each receive a retirement pension of approximately $144/month.  Their 28-year-old son who lives with them works in distribution of toiletries and receives an income.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to have PV systems installed in their houses.

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
La señora Mariela pertenece al banco comunal SAN RAFAEL, la socia continua vendiendo productos naturales para la salud, la socia agradece el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de forma disciplinada, la socia continua vendiendo sus productos naturales a sus clientes que le solicitan cada día, la socia desea que su negocio prospere, siendo  de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de productos naturales para el colesterol.
texts.en:
Mariela belongs to the communal bank group San Rafael. She continues to sell natural health products. She appreciates the loan that was granted and promises to comply with the repayment schedule in a disciplined manner. She continues selling natural products to her customers who come to her daily. She wants her business to thrive so that she can support her family.

Mariela is requesting a loan for the purchase of natural medicines for cholesterol.

loans.use: to purchase natural medicines for cholesterol to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in: cement, sand, gravel, and labor to repair the bathroom in her house.

loans.name: Gorrion Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario El Gorrion está integrado por tres mujeres laboriosas, y está coordinado por Ana de 33 años de edad, soltera, y se dedica a la venta de ropa, perfumes y sandalias desde hace 5 años. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de pacas de ropa, camisas, shores, capris, perfumes para damas y caballeros, etc. La segunda socia es la señora Rosario de 55 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de bisuterías, gaseosas, cigarros, y galletas. Y la tercera socia es la señora Juana de 55 años de edad, y es propietaria de una pulpería.
texts.en: The solidarity group El Garrion is composed of three laborious women and is coordinated by Ana, who is 33 years old, single and makes a living selling clothing, perfumes and sandals for five years now. She requests the loan to buy bales of clothing, shirts, shorts, capris, perfumes for ladies and gentlemen etc. The second member is Madam Rosario who is 55 years old and makes a living selling miscellaneous goods, drinks, cigarettes and cookies. And the third member is Madam Juana, who is 55 years old and owner of a small grocery store.

loans.use: to buy bales of clothing, shirts, shorts, capris, perfumes for ladies and gentlemen, etc. in order to increase sales

loans.name: Johna

texts.en:
Johna is a 40-year-old married woman and the mother of five children. She is from Ajuy, Iloilo. She runs a small sari-sari or retail store business, selling various goods and items to the people in her place. This is the source of her income.

Johna is asking to take a loan to buy more items to sell, like rice, canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, and others. This loan will help Johna to improve her inventory, thus attracting more buyers into her store.

In the future, Johna hopes to make her store more sustainable and productive. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, like rice, canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, and others.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
A 47-year-old woman, Rebecca earns a living through her retail store or sari-sari store business.  She is married and has three grown-up children. Rebecca runs a sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and food items to the people in her place in Ajuy, Iloilo. She has been in the business for more than 10 years now. 

She is requesting to take a loan to buy groceries like soft drinks and beverages, soap and toiletries, noodles, rice, bread and biscuits, school supplies and others. A loan will enable Rebecca to increase her stock, which will attract more buyers in her store. In the future, Rebecca dreams of improving her business so that it will generate more income.

loans.use: to buy groceries like soft drinks and beverages, soap and toiletries, noodles, rice, bread and biscuits, school supplies, etc.

loans.name: Bobokalon

texts.en:
Bobokalon is a kind man. He and his wife are farmers and have three children. He is very hardworking and kind-natured. He has a lot of friends and relations; all of them love him very much.

Bobokalon has been farming for four years, producing melon and watermelon. He has been in this line of work since 2010. His products are sold at the local market in the city.

In order to provide his sowing land with the needed attention, Bobokalon is currently requesting another loan in the amount of 5,000 somoni so that he can buy fertilizer and seeds for the new sowing season. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for the new sowing season.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a 47-year-old married woman and a mother of four grown-up children. She is from Ajuy, Iloilo.

Gemma has been engaged in a tricycle transport business with her husband for more than 15 years now. This is the source of their income.

Gemma is requesting a loan to buy a new tricycle. A loan will be of great help for Gemma in improving their income.

In the future, Gemma hopes to make their business sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy a new tricycle.

loans.name: Eliodora

texts.en:
Eliodora is a 63-year-old married woman who lives in Liloy. Her major source of income is farming,  palay trading, and selling rice. She has been in this business for 21 years. The business helped her to meet her family's financial needs, including educating her children. 

Her business provides a good income due to her loyal customers. Someday, she will have a legacy to leave to her children. Eliodora wants to expand her rice production so that her customers will be served well and able to supply also more sacks of rice in the market. She is planning for a business expansion for the good of her children and  grandchildren. She used  previous loans  to purchase sacks of palay to produce more rice.

loans.use: to pay for more sacks of palay.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 44 years old. He is married with 4 children aged between 6 and 17 years, all of them go to school. He is a farmer and has been farming for 10 years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizer to grow maize. The profits from the maize harvest will be used to buy food for home consumption.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: buy fertilizer to grow maize

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a hardworking smallholder livestock farmer in Mugwe village who is turning 59 this year. She lives together with her husband of 33 years. The couple is blessed with four children aged between 20 and 33 years. 

Jane is seeking a loan investment from Kiva lenders to construct animal housing on her farm. She has 2 cows, 2 pigs and 10 heads of poultry. The housing will offer protection and a clean and conducive environment for her animals to be comfortable and productive.  She will use the income from this investment to help her husband settle monthly bills and their child's university education fees.

loans.use: to construct a piggery

loans.name: Gelita

texts.en:
Gelita operates a motor transport business. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community in Aloran. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

For her to continue her business, she requested a loan to buy motor accessories and pay for motor parts and repair. She dreams of owning more motor units and being able to provide for the family.

loans.use: to buy motor accessories and pay for motor parts and repair.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 55 years old and lives in Aloran, Philippines. She is a persevering mother when it comes to the good of her family, especially their health needs. Fe is gaining a profit from her retailing business, direct-selling Personal Collections products.

To generate more income, Fe decided to expand her resources after she learned that she can access financial assistance from PMPC. Consequently, she requested a loan to restock more inventory of products to increase sales and be able to meet the demand of her customers.

Fe smiles at the thought of having a comfortable life and providing her family a better life.

loans.use: to restock more inventory of products to increase sales and be able to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.name: Ngabonziza

texts.en: Ngabonziza is 25 years old. He is married with one child who is one year old. He sells construction materials, and has been working in a business for four years. With the loan, he would like to buy more cement, windows, and doors to resell. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption.

loans.use: To buy more cement, windows and doors to resell.

loans.name: Al-Tfawl Group

texts.en:
Al- Tfawl  group members applied for  a previous loan from Kiva. This group consists of Amama, Amina,Nema, and Welaya. They haven't completely repaid the first loan and are applying for a concurrent loan of 110,000 YER from AMB.

Amama is the leader of the group and applied for a first loan to buy ladies' clothing to sell door-to-door. That loan helped her increase her business and she is thankful to Kiva lenders for the first loan. 

Amama wants to increase her business and buy potatoes and eggs to make sandwiches to sell to  children.  Amama applied for a concurrent loan of 50,000 YER from Kiva lenders to purchase potatoes and eggs to sell and therefore expand her business.  Amama hopes this loan will be funded.

loans.use: To purchase potatoes and eggs.

loans.name: Ziripa

texts.en: Ziripa is a 27-year-old married woman with three children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She buys and sells cocoa in Bundibugyo. She gets good profits out of her business though seasonal factors are her greatest challenge. She hopes to expand her business. She wants a loan to buy cocoa for resale.

loans.use: to buy cocoa for resale

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 42 years old, married and together with her spouse has been blessed with 5 children. She has been selling cereals for 5 years and it has been profitable. She plans to use this loan to buy more stocks of maize for sell.

She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children. This is her first loan term from VisionFund Kenya and her future hopes are to expand her business, make more income and support her family.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 51 years old. He is married with five children aged between 6 and 30 years old. He is a farmer and has been farming for 20 years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizer to grow maize. The profits from the maize harvest will be used to buy food for home consumption.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer to grow maize

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Lan, 55, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a builder for hire.

Lan has been running a business of buying and selling vegetables for four years. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more vegetables at wholesale prices to sell, thereby better satisfying her customers.

She hopes that her business will run smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables at wholesale prices to sell

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is 28 years old. She is married with 5 children aged between 1 and 12 years and 3 of them go to school. She is a farmer and has been has been farming for 10 years. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy fertilizer to grow maize. The profits from her maize harvest will be used to buy food for home consumptions.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to grow maize

loans.name: Chat

texts.en:
Chat is a 56-year-old married man with three children. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. Chat earns money from the business of repairing motorcycles and selling parts. He has been involved in this business for five years. 

Now, Chat would like to take out a loan to invest in his business. He plans to use this loan to buy motorcycle parts to stock his store and to serve more customers. He hopes that through this loan, he will be able to increase the turnover of his business. This will enable him to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: To buy motorcycle parts to stock his store and serve more customers

loans.name: Eziresi

texts.en: Eziresi is a twenty-five-year old married woman with one child living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She buys and sells cocoa and has a cocoa garden. She is a hardworking woman who has maintained her business well and is proud of that. She hopes to expand her business to get more profits and to serve her  clients better. She is affected by seasonality. She requested a loan to buy cocoa for resale.

loans.use: to buy cocoa

loans.name: Vy

texts.en:
Vi is 41 years old and married. She lives with husband and two sons in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns money by working as a truck driver. Vi earns an income to support her family by running a business selling glasses. She intends to use her loan to buy a great quantity and variety of glasses to sell.

Vi hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a great quantity and variety of  glasses to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase electricity tools  and open a store to resell them.

loans.name: Sumaira

texts.en:
Sumaira, age 30, is the mother of one son and two daughters. Her husband owns an embroidery shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. He needs to purchase a new variety of embroidery material to resell. This will help him to offer more variety to his customers and to continue his work efficiently and professionally. However, due to lack of money, he has found it difficult to replenish his inventory.

Therefore, his wife, Sumaira, is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband to purchase raw materials for embroidery, like threads, sequins, pearls, etc. Sumaira is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan amount. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy threads, sequins, and pearls for her husband's work.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase cement, bricks, and wood for building an extra room, and to make a floor for the house because now its floor is sand.

loans.name: Sebastiana

texts.es:
Sebastina es una mujer joven que lo que busca cada día es prosperidad en su vida y la de sus hijos, ella tiene 27 años de edad y tiene dos hijos uno de 8 años y el otro de 4 años. 
Sebastiana es una mujer que apoya mucho  a su esposo para la generación de ingresos, ella lo hace con el fin de que cada día su familia pueda tener todo lo necesario, ella desde hace tres años empezó a con la compra  y venta de güipiles, pues al pasar de los años  ella tiene mucha demanda en la venta,  porque los guipiles que ella vende son de diferentes tonalidades y muy bien terminados.
 Pues con esta demanda ella aparte de comprar se dio también a la tarea de aprender a bordar y hasta la fecha el negocio ha  ido progresando, ahora tiene cuatro trabajadoras que le ayudan a bordar, Pero para seguir con el negocio ella necesita más capital de trabajo, para que pueda comprar más güipiles y pagar la mano de obra para sus trabajadoras. Ella hasta hora vende únicamente en su comunidad.  Pero  el sueño de ella, es conseguir más capital y la venta lo expandirá en otras comunidades aledaña.
texts.en:
Sebastiana is a young woman who searches every day for success in her own life and the lives of her children.  She is 27 years old and has two children—one is eight, and the other is four.  Sebastiana is a woman who supports her husband a lot in earning money.  She does this so that every day her family can have everything they need.  Three years ago she started to buy and sell güipiles [traditional Guatemalan embroidered blouses].  Over the years she has had a lot of demand for her sales, because the güipiles that she sell come in different color palettes and are very well made.

With this demand, besides selling them she has also taken on the task of learning to embroider.  Now her business has continued to progress.  She currently has four workers who help her to do the embroidering, but in order to continue with the business she needs more working capital so that she can buy more güipiles and pay for her workers’ labor.  Until now, she has sold exclusively in her community, but her dream is to get more capital and expand her sales into other nearby communities.

loans.use: to buy güipiles [traditional blouses]

loans.name: Chozvo Group 2

texts.en: Chozvo 2 are a proud group of 15 farmers who cultivate maize in Catandica, Mozambique. All group members were born and live in the Chozvo area. The group sell their crop at a fair price to Empresa de Comercialização Agricola Lda (ECA), a local agribusiness which both acts as a buyer and provides the farmers with quality farming inputs and technical advice. An investment by AgDevCo has allowed ECA to purchase a state-of-the-art maize mill, designed for use in rural areas, so it can process the farmers’ crop before selling it on. The group in total farm 15 hectares of land. All farming is done manually. The farmers require finance to purchase vital farming inputs- all of them purchase seed and some choose to purchase fertiliser in addition. Access to a group loan of 28,210 Meticais (854 USD) equates to an average of 1,881 Meticais (58 USD) per participant- enough for the farmers to purchase from ECA the inputs they vitally need. Farming conditions in the area are extremely tough with only intermittent rainfall. However, since becoming participants on the Chozvo outgrower scheme all the farmers report life becoming easier. They can afford good quality fertiliser, which is purchased from ECA. The farmers’ crops are also bought by ECA every week- they come to their farms so the participants do not need to walk long distances to find a market for their crops. Since ECA’s arrival into their community, and with access to funds to purchase the necessary inputs, the farmers have seen their yields and incomes increasing threefold. This is allowing them to invest in their farms, buy motorbikes and send their children to school.

loans.use: To pay for farming inputs to increase their yields of maize

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a hardworking mother who  sells food snacks door-to-door.  She is married to Aloran. 

Rosemarie has applied for membership with PMPC and appreciates the programs and services of the Coop. Rosemarie needs additional capital to purchase raw ingredients to increase production of her food snacks. She wants to display her products in a canteen and eatery in the area to generate more income. 

She asked for 14,900 PHP.  She wanted to expand her business for her loyal customers. With her extra income, she wishes to provide her family a decent and comfortable lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients to increase production of her food snacks.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
In the year 2011, Josephine learned about Paglaum MPC and the financial assistance it gives. As a farmer in Tudela, she tried her luck and requested a loan to jump start her farm production. After several months, she was able to repay the loan. To this day, Josephine feels she owes her good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used for her business. 

Recently, Josephine requested a new loan to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer for the next cropping season. She wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply farming products to the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer

loans.name: Ymerli

texts.en:
Ymerli is shown in the photo with his wife,  Zenepe who is paralyzed. He seeks your compassion and requests a loan to pay  their water bills. They haven't had water for days, making it extremely difficult for him to care of his wife. 

Ymerli begs you for your help with this sensitive matter.

loans.use: to pay  the water bill.

loans.name: Fidela

texts.en:
Fidela has mastered her skills in making bread; she has her own unique bread recipe and is known for her homemade sweet bread. This has kept her business going for more than 10 years now. 

Recently, Fidela requested a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy more kilos of flour, sugar and margarine for bread production and to buy additional stocks for her sari-sari business. Fidela hopes to expand her bread enterprise by displaying in more store outlets, consequently generating employment at her bakery.

loans.use: to buy additional flour and ingredients

loans.name: Temporal Group

texts.en:
The members of Temporal Group are farmers who live in a small village of the Mexican State of Oaxaca where there is not traditional electrification through power lines. In this situation, they have decided to install a Small Solar Home System-SSHS. Funding is asked for financing those SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that these farmers pay for maintenance services during the first year of operation.
 
Angelina, in the middle of the picture, is 55 years old and, for the first time, she has an electricity service in her house which will provide her with 4 hours of electrical lighting daily, as well as connection to other small appliances.

loans.use: to have a PV system installed in her house

loans.name: Gulnoz

texts.en:
Gulnoz is a farmer from the rural district of Jilikul. She has been involved in agricultural activity for 6 years. Her husband is also a farmer and cattle breeder. He works together with his wife on the irrigated plot of land where they grow vegetable crops. 

Gulnoz, at the age of 35, has 4 children. They are 10, 8, 4 and 2 years old. The two elder children attend school. 

Now Gulnoz and her husband are preparing for the early planting of watermelons and other melons. For this sowing they need a loan. So Gulnoz applied for a loan to purchase watermelon and early-ripening melon seeds, as well as mineral fertilizers.

This family is awaiting your financial help.

loans.use: To purchase watermelon and early-ripening melon seeds, as well as mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Guldasta

texts.en: Guldasta is a 44-year-old married mother of three children. She is a very enterprising woman. She constantly struggles to raise her children. For more than three years, she has worked as a seamstress. Her honesty, responsibility and punctuality have been the reasons for her outstanding job performance. She believes she is doing well because she always gives the best of herself. Guldasta is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because with their support, she will be able to make improvements to her house, such as painting the walls and finishing construction. In this way, she and her family will have a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy building materials for repairing house

loans.name: Mahsuda

texts.en:
Mahsuda is 33 years old, married, and the mother of 3 children. She has a secondary education, and she has been involved in agriculture since 2007. She currently owns 3 head of cattle. She has a cowshed in her house, where she keeps her cows, and her father-in-low helps her with managing the business. Her husband is a migrant in Russia.

Mahsuda has everything she needs to keep cows at home, and she has gathered feed for the winter. She has turned to the IMON and requested a loan of 5,000 TJS (Somoni). She will use her loan to purchase cows for fattening and resale. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy cattle for increasing her working capital

loans.name: Adlah

texts.en:
Adlah is a 44-year-old married woman from Yatta, a village near the city of Hebron. She is a mother with two sons and one daughter. Her husband works as a construction worker and earns a low, seasonal  income.

Adalah started her own business three years ago to grow seasonal crops and requests a loan to buy seeds.

loans.use: to buy seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, brick, and metal sheets to repair the restroom of her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cement, sand, gravel, brick and sheet metal so that she can finish building a bathroom in her home.

loans.name: Shoirakhon

texts.en:
Shoirakhon is a young entrepreneur who took the initiative to start a business selling clothes for women to support her family and help them get ahead.

She thinks that her business is doing well due to her dedication; she works ten hours a day. At her young age, she has a clear idea of what she wants to achieve in the future.

Shoirakhon is grateful to the Kiva lenders, because with the support they provide she will be able to buy more clothes, thus increasing her sales. This will improve her family's quality of life. She will continue to work hard to create a large company.

loans.use: To buy women's clothing for increasing working capital

loans.name: Genesis Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “GENESIS” iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Verónica es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de chompas, salón de belleza, librería, servicio de diseño de uñas, tienda de barrio, venta de frazadas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Verónica es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio salón de belleza; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años por iniciativa propia al haber culminado sus estudios en una institución técnica decide emprender independientemente su negocio. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de sillas y lava cabezas) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo implementará en su espacio de servicio. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella aún es soltera.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "GENESIS" will begin its fifth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Santiago II regional hub. The group consists of nine members and is led by a board of directors, where Veronica serves as the chairwoman.

The members of the communal bank carry on various businesses, which include selling food, selling "chompas" (sweaters), running a beauty parlour, running a bookstore, offering nail design services, running a neighbourhood store, and selling blankets.

The loan that the group will take out will benefit the owners of small microbusinesses, including Veronica. She says that she joined Pro Mujer five years ago and that she became a member at the invitation of a friend who is a client from the institution. Currently, she runs a beauty parlour. She mentions that she started this business on her own initiative many years ago. After finishing her studies at a technical institution, she decided to start her business independently.   

The loan that she will take out now is to increase her working capital by purchasing chairs and a shampoo chair, which she will acquire from the wholesale vendors from the city of La Paz. Then, she will install the equipment in her salon. This line of work allows her to generate the means to support her family financially, as she is still single.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the training offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy chairs and a shampoo chair.

loans.name: Adeluz

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Adeluz; la socia pertenece al banco comunal SAN RAFAEL, la socia continua  dedicándose al negocio de llamadas telefonicas, la socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota, la socia realiza llamadas locales y nacionales de acuerdo sus clientes le soliciten, la socia desea que su negocio prospere, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de un nuevo equipo de celular.
texts.en: This member is Madam Adeluz; she belongs to the communal bank San Rafael. She continues to make a living in the phone call business. She is grateful for the loan and she is committed to comply with the payments of her quota. She makes local and national calls, according to the requests of her clients. She wishes her business to prosper and to be able to continue working in order to continue supporting her family. She requests the loan to buy a new cell phone.

loans.use: to buy a new cell phone

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 40 years old and from Baggao, Cagayan. She is married with four children. Their family earns from farming corn and raising hogs.

With indefinite income, the family finds it hard to make ends meet, especially now that their daughter Dodalyn is attending college. Dodalyn is pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in Education to become a teacher. She wants to finish college to help her parents.

To do this, Marites wants to access an education loan of PHP 7,000 from the Kiva lenders to aid in her daughter’s school fees.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's tuition fee.

loans.name: Cherelyn

texts.en:
Cherelyn is a sari-sari store owner from Ajuy, Iloilo. She is married and has four children. Cherelyn has operated her small grocery store business for more than eleven years now. This is her main source of income.

Cherelyn is asking to take a loan to buy more stock to sell such as canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, bleaching agent, cooking oil and condiments, bread and biscuits, among other items. With this, she will be able to increase her stock; thus attract more buyers in her store.

Cherelyn’s future plans include the expansion of her store and the continuous schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell such as canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, bleaching agent, cooking oil and condiments, bread and biscuits, among other items.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora is a 51-year-old married woman, and a mother of two grown up children from Ajuy, Iloilo. She runs a small sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. She is also a dressmaker. 

Aurora is asking to take a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, condiments, bread and snack foods, etc. With a loan she will be able to improve her stock, thus allowing her to attract more buyers. In the future, Aurora hopes to make her business stable and productive.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, condiments, bread and snack foods, etc.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 46 years old and from Agaman Sur, Baggao, Cagayan. She is married and blessed with four children. The family earns from farming and a piggery. With their little income they cannot provide for all the needs of their children. 

That’s why Editha wants to get an education loan of PHP10,000 from the KIVA lenders. She will use the loan to send her daughter Rina to school. Rina is taking up a BS in Education. She wants to become a teacher to help educate kids in the future.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's tuition fee.

loans.name: Abdourahmane

texts.fr:
Monsieur Abdourahmane est un jeune qui vit dans un village situé à environ 20km de la ville principale. Il est célibataire sans enfant et évolue dans le domaine du transport depuis deux ans maintenant. Abdourahmane n’a jamais bénéficié de crédit à l’IMCEC, et pour une fois, il aimerait acquérir une moto-Jakarta, pour faire du transport. Il le conduira lui-même pour pouvoir en tirer le maximum de recette car il est actif toute la journée.
Même s’il est célibataire, Abdourahmane est soutien de famille et c’est lui qui s’occupe de gérer la dépense quotidienne du foyer.
Il ne veut pas s’arrêter là, car il a aussi comme ambition d’acheter un jour un véhicule à usage de transport urbain.
texts.en:
Monsieur Abdourahmane is a young man who lives in a village situated about 20 km from the main town. He is single and has no children and has been working in the field of motorcycle transport for two years now. He has never received a loan from  UIMCEC, and for once, he would like to get a Jakarta motorcycle to do transport. He plans to drive it himself so as to get the maximum in receipts since he works all day long. 

Even though he is single, Abdourahmane supports a family, and it is he who is the breadwinner for the household. He doesn't want to stop there since it is also his ambition to one day buy a vehicle destined for urban transport.

loans.use: to buy a Jakarta motorcycle to use for motorcycle transport

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Stanley is an entrepreneur operating on a 2-acre piece of land in the Kericho region of Kenya. He has been married for 5 years. Stanley keeps three dairy cows and 20 head of poultry; has over 30 trees; and grows millet, sorghum, and a variety of other crops. At this point in his life, he is forced to work tirelessly to meet the family's growing needs. For example, his highest annual expense on his children's education alone is over USD $1,000.

To keep providing adequately for his family, he decided to think outside the box and came up with a good business plan with a favorable return on investment. He is seeking a loan of KES 60,000 to start an agrovet business. His vision is for the business to be a leading enterprise in its category in the Kericho area, offering farm inputs and animal feeds at affordable prices. He is anticipating many customers, as there is little competition in the area. He has already invested some of his own savings to get the business started. He plans to use your loan investment to purchase more items to stock the agrovet. Through the income he projects from the agrovet, he will be able to pay school fees and meet other needs of his family without much straining.

Stanley is a great client to Juhudi Kilimo; he has a perfect credit risk score. He has successfully serviced his previous loan. A single lending from you to Stanley is a big demonstration of your vote of confidence in the future of a great farmer with the strong mental fortitude of putting his family first and overcoming all other obstacles in his way to a better life.

loans.use: to start a business selling farm inputs and animal feed.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine, 53,  is a married mother of five grown children who lives in Dulag, Leyte. She earns a living by running a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells various items such as canned goods, noodles, coffee, powdered milk, soft drinks, and fabric conditioner. Her husband is a farmer.

Josephine has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase more stock for the store like noodles, soft drinks, beverages and toiletries. With this additional inventory, she could manage her income and be able to set aside money for emergency purposes. 

In the future, she is hoping that with proper knowledge and hard work, she would be able to successfully expand her business for a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase  noodles, soft drinks, beverages and toiletries for her store.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor operates a "habal-habal" or a motorcycle modified to seat more than two people. He transports passengers in his community for a certain fee.  Aside from operating a motorcycle, he also engages in rice farming. He grows and sells rice. He is married man with 11 grown children. 

He is asking for a loan to purchase tires, fuel and other motorcycle maintenance, and to purchase farm supplies. With these materials, he will be motivated to continue to handle his sources of income that will result in the smooth operation of his transportation services and improve the yield of his farm. 

Victor hopes that success is possible with proper management of resources, accompanied by hard work that will help him experience better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase tires, fuel and  other motorcycle maintenance and to purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 53 years old and has two grown children. She lives in Mayorga, Leyte. She has run a sari-sari (variety) store for more than 10 years. She sells various goods like soft drinks, shampoo, powdered soap, fabric conditioner, tooth paste, and seasonings.

She is asking for a loan to buy additional stock for the store like canned goods, beverages, noodles and toiletries. These are essential in managing her source of income. She would then be able to handle her finances and pay her dues.

Elizabeth will be earning more income and could start other possible business ventures. She is full of hope that she could handle her business successfully for the improvement of her present situation.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages, noodles and toiletries for her store.

loans.name: Noemi Luz

texts.es:
La socia Noemí pertenece al banco comunal SAN RAFAEL, la socia sigue dedicándose al negocio de ferretería, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia continua vendiendo pinturas, cementos, clavos entre otros para sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea que su negocio prospere, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de cementos entre otros.
texts.en: The member Noemi is part of the communal bank San Rafael. She continues to make a living with a hardware store. She is grateful for the granted loan and she is committed to comply with her set quota. She continues selling paint, cement, nails, among others, to her clients that request so. She wishes her business to prosper. She wishes to be able to continue working in order to continue supporting her family. She requests a loan to buy cements, among others.

loans.use: to buy cement, among others.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John, a 32-year-old farmer from Kona mbaya, a remote village in the Kitale area of Kenya, is elegant and admirable in spirit and effort. He is a role model, a mentor and an inspiration to many young farmers in his village because of his resilience despite personal challenges, and because of his passion to support his children as a primary caregiver. 

For the past 10 years, he has been involved in mixed farming, and his primary source of income has been raising sheep, growing cabbage and tomatoes and keeping dairy cows. 

John has been able to provide nutritious food for his family. After his wife lost her formal job, the role of primary caregiver of the family fell to John. It has been overwhelming because he now had to shoulder the responsibility of feeding the whole family. 

This challenge has not made him give up. “I have to do something for my family," he said. John is requesting a loan to buy an additional quality dairy cow and to build a modern dairy unit. 

The dairy cow that he plans to buy is not just an ordinary cow, but it’s a quality breed of dairy cow that will be producing between 10 and 20 liters of milk a day. This will immediately translate to more profits and increased income levels. 

The profit from selling milk will be used in repaying the loan in full, and the extra income will be used to increase his business enterprise. 

John is very visionary, and he intends that in the near future, he will start adding value to his milk business through packaging the milk before selling it. He will also start selling dairy products such as yoghurt. 

An improved income level will assure his family of a secure future. By joining Juhudi Kilimo, which assists smallholder farmers, he will also benefit from free extension services and links to markets.

loans.use: To buy a quality dairy cow and build a modern dairy unit.

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Hello world, meet Purity. She is a beautiful bachelorette from Igoji village in Central Kenya. In 2010, she started a 0.5 acre mixed-farm that has earned her a living to this day. She keeps cows and poultry for milk and egg production. She has grown five trees on the small farm.

To make more income, Purity ventured into cereal trading. In the cereal business, the more capital she lays out to acquire inventory, the more income she makes from the sales. 

She is seeking a loan to purchase cereal products for resale. She will use the sales revenue to pay business expenses and the loan debt. She will use additional income to grow her business and uplift her livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase cereals.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina runs a sari-sari store in the town of Dulag, Leyte. She sells basic household commodities like coffee, toothpaste, noodles, biscuits, vinegar, soy sauce, seasonings and powdered soap. She is married woman with two dependents. Her husband is a jeepney driver.  

She is asking for a loan to buy additional stock for the store and pay for the repair of her pig pen. These items will fill her store again and attract more consumers to come and make purchases. This will help augment her daily income. As a result, she will be able to pay her obligations and provide her family with good food.

Lina would like to expand her business and to be successful in order to support the needs of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for the store and pay for the repair of her pig pen

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Hello, lenders!  Victoria been farming for the last seven years. Because of the immense knowledge she has about farming, she commands a lot of respect among other farmers and she is viewed as a mentor in her village. She lives with her children in the Kerugoya area of Kenya, which is known for coffee plantations for export. Her primary income sources are eggs, milk, and some personal business she engages in to supplement her meager income. Generating an income through selling her harvest is the part of farming she enjoys most. Availability of labor is a major challenge for Victoria. She also keeps a dairy cow. Before joining Juhudi, Victoria could not access loans from banks since they considered her a high-risk client. She mobilized marginalized farmers and created the self-help group Gatei Pamoja. Through the group, she joined Juhudi Kilimo and learned about loan management and agribusiness. She also learned about Kiva. Victoria is seeking a loan for constructing a cow shed and to purchase farm implements. With your help, Victoria will introduce zero grazing (an environmentally sound method of cattle care) and purchase more effective modern tools that will make her farm activities much easier. This will boost her income and enable her to pay school fees for her children. Victoria waits your kindness.

loans.use: To construct a cow shed and to purchase farm implements.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Hello lenders! Meet Joyce, a 38-year-old smallholder dairy farmer based in the Thika area of Kenya. She has been married for over three decades and has four children, ages 17 to 25. 
As her family grows, so do her expenses. To increase her income, Joyce needs to increase the productivity of her few animals by increasing their feed intake. She seeks to accomplish this by acquiring a chaff cutter.
Through your loan investment, Joyce will be able to have hay cut into small pieces for feeding to livestock. The machine will cleanly and evenly cut hay into a suitable size that animals like. 
This investment will pay off with increased quantity of milk produced for sale.

loans.use: to purchase a chaff cutter

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 32 years old. She is married with four children aged between two and ten years, three of whom go to school.  

Beatrice has a shop and she has been in business for three years. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, cooking oil, and salt to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and to reinvest.

loans.use: to buy more rice, cooking oil, and salt to sell.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Christine, a mother of one, from Kienderi, a rural village in the Kerugoya area of Kenya. Christine has been involved in farming for four years! Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, and other personal businesses she engages in to make ends meet. 

From her experience, dairy farming is not only profitable, but also enjoyable: all the animals on her farm are referred to by names. She has nicknamed her cows. The challenge, however, is that growth is constrained by limited funds/capital. 

Christine is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. She has been keeping poultry for fun for many years. Recently, however, she was taught how poultry is a big business, if made commercial. She feared the high costs involved in setting up a commercial poultry farm at first, but after looking at the projections, she sees the point. 

Invest in Christine’s future. The income she will generate from her poultry farm alone is enough to facilitate timely loan repayments and savings. The loan will help Christine's family improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Alinane Group

texts.en:
Dollica used the previous loan to expand her business by buying more wrappers (local cloth for skirts), and this has benefited her, as she now has more customers. This has also increased her income. 

Dollica diverted her business from owning a saloon to a grocery shop. She opted for this business since grocery shops are scarce in her area and most people used to travel a long distance just to find a grocery.

Increasing her business has greatly helped Dollica to improve her family's living standards since she can now easily afford her children's basic needs. Dollica thanks Kiva for the previous loan that they granted her. 

She is requesting another loan to expand her business by purchasing more commodities such as juice, biscuits and rice, as these commodities are in high demand in her area.

loans.use: To buy more commodities.

loans.name: Agripina

texts.en:
Agripina has been a widow for 26 years and earns a good living from her coconut farm in Mohon, Aloran in the Philippines. This is her means of supporting her family. Agripina has been able to send all her children to school until they graduated and secured their own jobs. 

She has saved money to purchase a small parcel of land to plant coconuts and increase her farm's yield. Agripina needs  capital and requests a loan of 14,900.00 PHP  to pay for the labor to clear, plow, and plant seed. 

Agripina has high hopes that her farm will have a good, high-quality yield.

loans.use: to pay for the labor to clear, plow, and plant.

loans.name: Zail

texts.en:
Zail has a passion for selling. He is a  48-year-old married man frin  Oroquieta.  He runs a store to provide for the basic necessities of their family. Everyday he patiently tends his store until 10:00 o'clock in the evening. 

Zail wants to expand his business and joined Paglaum MPC to access insurance and financial assistance. He requests10,000 PHP to pay for assorted goods to sell. Additional inventory  means income opportunities. In the future, he dreams of sustaining his store to continuously provide for his needs and those of the  family.

loans.use: to pay for an inventory of assorted goods to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to have PV systems installed in their houses.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to have PV systems installed in he house

loans.name: Nazi

texts.en:
Nazi is a 52-years-old woman who lives in the Kareli district. She is persecuted and gets an appropriate pension from the local government. Nazi works hard and grows beans and strawberries to sell locally. However, her income is seasonal and Nazi needs another stable activity to meet financial obligations.
 
She requests 1000 GEL to start a  home-products business, The start up program is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo that will enabled her to get the requested loan to  start selling. She will purchase home products at wholesale prices and sell in her community door-to-door.
 
It is obvious that the job is hard for Nazi, but she is ready to deal with the difficulties and gradually develop her business. The Start Up credit will be a great support for her.

loans.use: to start a home products business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to have a PV system installed in his house.

loans.name: Mohannad

texts.en:
Mohannad, a 21-year-old single man from Khanyounis, lives with his parents in a simple house. His father has a barber shop in the city, earning an unstable income that is the family's sole support. Mohannad is a student in a local collage studying commerce. He wants to complete his studies and find a job to improve the familys living conditions.

Mohannad requested a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN to buy a new laptop for his studies. This purchase will enable him to complete his assignments and reports easily.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita lives in Tudela and supports her three children by building houses from the ground up. She has successfully repaid her whole loan, which she used to buy building material, paints, and to pay her workers. She wants her children to get an education and escape the life of backbreaking work she has had to endure.

loans.use: to buy building materials, paints, and pay her workers

loans.name: Sarvinoz

texts.en: Sarvinoz is a divorced mother of 3 who is the only provider for her children. Sarvinoz is going to start business and hopes to offer her children a better living standard. She is going to open a computer center to offer different computer services to local people. She completed a  course ‘To Get Ahead’. She is asking for a loan of 3000 TJS to buy a computer to start a new business. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Dioscura

texts.en:
Dioscura is a 62-year-old hardworking, widowed  woman from Oroquieta. Dioscura  makes copra and buys whole coconuts from her neighbors. Dioscura joinded the cooperative to gain access to insurances and credit. She applied for a loan to buy whole coconuts to make copra.

Dioscura hopes to succeed in this business to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy  coconuts.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a Solar Home System to replace candle consumption and have better light for his children to study at nights and increase family time

loans.name: Santa María

texts.es:
Santa María, es un mujer muy entusiasta, ella vive en Sololá junto a su esposo y a sus siete hijos la mayoría de sus hijos, los seis hijos  estudian y todos están  bajo la responsabilidad de sus padres  Santa tiene 36 años de edad. 

Santa María es una señora muy trabajadora y muy dedicada a su familia, pues ella desde hace ya varios años se dedica a la compra y venta de verduras, en el lugar donde vive, pues con  la poca  ganancia que ella tiene, ayuda a su esposo en sufragar los gastos de su hogar,  paralelo  a la venta  Santa también se  dedica también a  la agricultura, la meta de Santa Maria es conseguir un préstamo para ampliar su negocio y así poder generar más ingresos, para ayudar a sus hijos a seguir estudiando, hasta llegar hacer unos profesionales, ella no solo piensa en sus hijos, si no también otra meta es seguir trabajando duro, para que más adelante, pueda apoyar a su esposo en mejorar  su vivienda.

Santa María está muy segura que conseguirá el préstamo y con las ganancias que genera su negocio y la agricultura pagara su préstamo.
texts.en: Santa María is a very enthusiastic woman who lives in Sololá with her husband and 7 children. The majority of the children, 6, are in school and the parents are economically responsible for all the children. Santa is 36 years old, and is a very hard-working woman and very dedicated to her family. She has had a business buying and selling vegetables for several years in the place where she lives. With the little income she has, she helps her husband with the household expenses. Along with selling vegetables Santa also farms. Santa's goal is to acquire a loan to expand her business and in this way be able to generate more income in order to help her children continue attending school, until they have professional careers. She isn't only thinking of her children, but also another goal is to continue working hard so that in the future she can support her husband in improving their home. Santa Maria is very sure that she will receive the loan and with the profits is generates in her business and farming she will pay the loan.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Xhevahir

texts.en:
Xhevahir is 44 and has four children ranging in age from 18 to 22; all of them are currently going to schools respectively. 

Xhevahir is running a transportation vehicle as seen in the photograph; he transports people from villages to the city. The vehicle now is run down and needs immediate repair, and this is the reason he is requesting this loan. 

While Xhevahir has his own thing going on, his wife and daughter practice agriculture/livestock; they have one dairy cow and a calf and also three sheep. In the agricultural land that they own, they plant mostly corn and wheat, and have some apple orchards and grapevines.

loans.use: to repair the vehicle he uses to transport people

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is 27 years old and single. He does farming and he has been in this business for the past four years. 

Geoffrey plans to use this loan to buy cattle feed, seeds and fertilizer. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his farming business by buying more farm inputs. 

This is Geoffrey's first loan from VisionFund Kenya and his future hopes are to grow his business, make more income and be able to improve his living standards.

loans.use: To buy cattle feed, seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Rubirizi Tukwatanise Group

texts.en:
John Bosco is a 28-years-old Ugandan. He is married and has one child, age 4. He is a business man who operates a retail shop but he is also a produce dealer and he also drives a boda boda (motorbike taxi) to generate additional income.

His major customers are the residents of his area in Rubirizi- Mpefu. He has applied for a loan of UGX 2,000,000 to buy more stock of corn and millet  and to stock his retail shop to produce business.

His dream for the future is to build a family house and add more capital in to his business so that they can expand. The major challenges that he faces include limited capital and price fluctuations.

He describes himself as hardworking and honest in business. He has managed to expand the business and increase his profits.

loans.use: to buy corn and millet.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to have a PV systems installed in her house

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to have PV systems installed in his house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow her to reduce spending in kerosene, candles, and improve the home lighting.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali, a 28 year old Palestinian carpenter, is requesting a sum of 4,112,759 Lebanese pounds for the first time from Kiva partner Ibdaa to enhance his work facilities.
Ali has been working in this field of work for 9 years, which is enough to make him an experienced carpenter. After growing up with his family in a Palestinian refugee camp located in North Lebanon, Ali graduated from school and started working as a carpenter inside the camp.He currently lives with his wife and child who he both supports since his wife doesn't work. 
He is hoping to use the money to upgrade his carpentry tools and buy an electric generator for his shop which will boost his productivity and income.

loans.use: to buy tools and an electric generator

loans.name: Rafael

texts.en:
Rafael is a 33-years-old married man and  he  has two children. Rafael is the kind of man who always care his family and he is a responsible person.
 
Rafael has been working as a car master for two  years. His monthly income is 150 AZN. He knows his work perfectly and all of his clients like his work. But this income is not enough for him. 

Now he will also grow trees and vegetables in his garden but there is no water in his garden. Rafael needs to buy a water pump to irrigate his garden. If he gets this water pump his family’s life will change. He applied for a loan of 500 AZN from Kiva to buy a water pump.

loans.use: to buy a water pump to irrigate his garden.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a kneading machine, an oven, a mixer, a fridge, etc. and to decorate.

loans.name: Mhill

texts.en:
This is Mhill, a rural villager and a married father of five children from the north. He is in his 60s and receives a retirement pension. In addition to this little income, he has been practicing carpentry the last 40 plus years to earn a living. He makes windows and doors, chairs and also wooden barrels used for keeping alcohol, like home made wine and grappa, locally called ‘raki’.

Mhill is requesting this loan to pay for some accumulated electricity bills. Please kindly note that up until recently paying the electricity bills was tolerable due to the fact that the largest and only company failed in its operations. The company that bought the previous one has put strict rules in place, which has resulted in thousands of citizens now paying all the arrears.

loans.use: to pay for some accumulated electricity bills; the previous company has let lapse or more precisely has failed to manage properly.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to decorate the workstation she is to rent, and to purchase creams and equipment.

loans.name: Celestin

texts.en:
Celestin is 33 years old. He is married with three children aged between five and nine years; all of them go to school. He is a farmer and has been farming for four years. With the loan from Kiva, Celestin would like to buy fertilizers for his maize crops. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for his children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his maize crops

loans.name: Alexandra Geovanna

texts.es: Alexandra es una señora casada, a sus 37 años de edad tiene un hijo de 10 años que se encuentra estudiando, Alexandre se dedica a la veta de ropa y también tiene su local de  es costura donde confecciona la ropa que le piden y también exhibe ropa que comercializa,  el esposo de Alexandra trabaja de chofer, ella va a invertir el crédito en la compra de ropa para mejorar su negocio y sus ventas para seguir trabajando por bienestar de su hijo.
texts.en: Alexandra is married, 37 years old, and has a 10-year-old son who is currently studying. Alexandra makes a living selling clothing and also has a sewing store where she makes clothing that is requested. She also exhibits clothing that she sells. Alexandra's husband works as a driver. She will invest this loan to buy clothing to improve her business and her sales so she can continue working for the well-being of her son.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a strong-willed woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her piggery business. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who never gets too tired to support her family.

Recently, she requested a loan to purchase bags of animal feed. Aside from her project of concreting the pig pens, she thought of adding more pigs for commercial sale. Someday she hopes to open a meat shop in the nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feed.

location.town: Oroquieta-Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occ

loans.name: De La Mano Con Jesus Group

texts.es: Consuelo es tesorera del grupo De la Mano con Jesús, cuenta con un taller de confección especializada en buzos que ofrece a los colegios y  a mucha gente de su entorno que la conoce por la calidad de sus productos, Consuelo se siente orgullosa de su negocio sobre todo cuando confecciona ya que el trato con su personal es muy bueno.con el préstamo que le otorgo la entidad va a comprar mas mercadería como telas, cierres y mandar a hacer los estampados y bordados necesarios que requiere las prendas, en el grupo lleva cuatro años donde el trato es amistoso y cordial, Consuelo cuenta que a veces tiene problemas con clientes que demoran en pagar la mercadería, pero no hay nada que no pueda superarlo. Consuelo agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por la confianza que dan a los pequeños empresarios y dice que no los va a defraudar que luchará por hacer realidad sus sueños y tener una mejor calidad de vida para ella y los suyos.
texts.en: Consuelo is the treasurer of the "De la Mano con Jesus" group. She has a dressmaking workshop that specializes in sweatshirts that she offers to schools and other people from the surrounding areas that know her for the quality of her products. Consuelo feels proud of her business, especially when she makes clothes, as the relationship with her employees is very good. With the loan she received, she will buy more supplies such as fabric and zippers, and she will have the necessary prints and embroidery made for her clothes. She has been part of the group for 4 years, and the relationships between members are friendly and cordial. Consuelo says that she sometimes has problems with clients that take some time to pay for the products, but that there is nothing she cannot overcome. Consuelo thanks the Kiva lenders for the trust they put on small businesses and says that she won't disappoint them. She will work hard to make her dreams come true and to have a better quality of life for herself and those close to her.

loans.use: to buy materials such as fabric, zippers, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to have PV systems installed in his house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes for his clothing shop

loans.name: Bata Group

texts.en:
Ethel is 28 years old and has two children who go to school. She sells rice to people in her community. Before she started this business she used to sell onions. 

Obtaining loans helped her to change her business, since she was not earning enough money from onion selling. She will use the loan to buy more bags of rice in order to boost her business. Her main goal is to become independent and she dreams of having adequate food in her household. With the profits she made from the previous loans, she is now able to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy rice.

loans.name: Saymdin

texts.en:
Saymdin is a hardworking man from South Tajikistan. He is a careful father of 5 children. He has a farm where he grows crops. He has been busy with this business more than 6 years. 

Little by little with the passing of the time he has developed his business. He has additional income from animal husbandry. His son helps him with managing the business. 

Saymdin must make a new sowing, but he does not have the money to buy seeds, mineral fertilizers or fuel for the new sowing season. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy seeds, mineral fertilizers and fuel for the new sowing season.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to have PV systems installed in his house

loans.name: Jessei

texts.en:
Jessie is 44 years old and from Agaman Proper, Baggao, Cagayan. She is married and blessed with eight children. Her husband is a carpenter and they sell furniture for a living. 

Even though they are earning, it is sometimes insufficient for all the needs of their big family. Consequently, Jessie wants to seek financial assistance of PHP15,000 from the KIVA lenders. 

She will use this in aid of her son’s schooling. Her son, Luijimor, is taking up a BS in Information Technology.

loans.use: to pay her son's tuition fee.

loans.name: Nkio

texts.en:
In 2010, Nkio started mixed farming on a 2.25 acre farmland in Kitheo village, Central Kenya. On the farm, she keeps 2 cows, 10 head of poultry and other animals such as sheep and goats. She has also grown crops such as bananas for food and trade. 

She's very conscious of the environment, and as a result she has grown approximately 30 trees on the small farm. 

Nkio is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to grow more bananas on her farm. Growing bananas can be very costly due to the labor required. Your loan investment is going to enable her to pull together resources needed for planting more banana trees.
 
She will use the income from other sources to make loan repayments as the bananas mature. Income from the harvest will help pay for her 4-year-old's upkeep expenses.

loans.use: to pay for growing bananas on her farm.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en: Marilou is 38 years old from San Miguel, Baggao, Cagayan. She is married and blessed with three children. Their source of income is farming and tricycle rental. Even though they are earning, sometimes it is not enough for all their expenses. That’s why Marilou wants to avail an education loan of PHP 13,000 from the Kiva lenders to sustain the schooling of her daughter, Gemmalyn. Gemmalyn is taking up a BS in Secondary Education. She wants to finish college to find a stable job and send her younger siblings to school.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's tuition fees.

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
Belen is a merchant from Dulag, Leyte. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store, selling basic items, like biscuits, noodles, soft drinks, chips, bottled water, and many other items. Aside from that, she also raises and sells hogs. She is a 49-year-old, married woman with four children. 

Belen has requested a loan to purchase additional stocks, like beverages, condiments, noodles, and soft drinks. These will help her sell more goods, which is very basic for daily living. She will have more items to display and more variety and, eventually, she can cater to various customer needs. 

In the future, Belen would like to expand both her businesses for sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks, like beverages, condiments , noodles, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is a 50-year-old married woman from Ormoc City, Leyte. She has been engaged in a hog raising business with her husband for more than five years now. Hog raising is her main source of income. 

She is asking for a loan to buy piglets to raise and animal feed for them. This loan will enable her to improve the productivity of her hog raising business, thus augmenting her income and profit.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise and animal feed for them.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josphine stays with her spouse Dancun in the Chuka region of Kenya. Their 14 year union bore three children, now aged between 5 and 22 years. She has made a living off mixed farming for two decades. Today, she runs a five acre farm which consists of two cows, 17 heads of poultry, food crops and trees. In addition to the farm, the couple owns a retail shop and small rental houses. 

Rainfall patterns in Chuka is very unpredictable. Many farmers, including Josphine, have resorted to irrigation farming. She already acquired irrigation equipment which serves her during dry periods. In anticipation of planting season, she is seeking a loan to purchase water pipes for irrigation and farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer. 

She will use money from her other sources of income to make initial payments on the loan until the harvest is ready. Income made from this loan investment will help her family pay for basic needs and the children's education expenses.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and water pipes

loans.name: Ross Mere

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Ross Mere pertenece al banco comunal SAN RAFAEL, la socia continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de productos de primera necesidad, la socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota, la socia continua vendiendo arroz, azúcar, leche entre otros para sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
 La socia solicita el préstamo para compra azúcar al por mayor entre otros.
texts.en: Ross Mere belongs to the community bank SAN RAFAEL. Ross Mere continues to work in the business of selling consumer staples. She is grateful for the loan and is committed to fulfilling the payment terms. Ross Mere continues to sell rice, sugar, milk, and other other items for customers who request them. She wishes to continue working in this way to continue supporting her family. Ross Mere is requesting this loan to buy sugar and other products.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale sugar among other things.

loans.name: Tipicas Vendedoras Group

texts.en:
The six women in this group live in the town of Guineales in the Department of Suchitepéquez, Guatemala. This is an agricultural area where most of the men work in the cultivation of bananas and coffee and many of the women work in traditional weaving.  Five of the women in the group sell traditional clothing and one of them makes and sells tamales. They are all women who have never had any kind of business training and are looking forward to the classes that Namaste will give them on financial literacy and managing their money.  They also are eager to work with their Business Adviser who will help them develop a business plan and give them advice on how to grow their business.
