Micaela was elected as the president of the group as her fellow group members could see her leadership skills. She is 50 years old, married and never attended school.  Her husband works in agriculture.  She has three children. The 17 year old never attended school and works in agriculture.  The eleven year old is in fourth grade and the nine year old is in third grade. Micaela’s business is making and selling tamales.  Her tamales, which she makes in her home, are considered very delicious. She sells them on the street and also gets special orders from repeat customers.
She currently makes a monthly profit of 1,550 Guatemalan Quetzales per month.  Her goal is to increase this to 2,457 Guatemalan Quetzales during her nine-month loan cycle.  Her business adviser believes that this is a realistic goal and that she should be able to grow her business significantly.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients and tools for her food stall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow him to reduce spending in kerosene, candles, and improve the home lighting.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.en:
Jose Luis lives in a community in the Department of Yoro Honduras. He is dedicated to livestock. Age 42 years; he is married and has three children. It is clear that Jose Luis works hard to maintain his family and at night, after a hard day of work, the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity. He hopes that with the solar energy system, his children will be able to continue studying and improve the living conditions.
Jose Luis is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from SOLUZ Honduras, that will permit to have a better lighting, charge his cell phones, and saving in traditional energy expenditure.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow him to reduce spending in kerosene, candles, and improve the home lighting.

loans.name: Agabaci

texts.en:
Agabaci is married and has five children. She has a big and friendly family. Two of her children are in school, and her other children go to college.

Agabaci is living with her family in the Baku region. She has been in the poultry business for seven years. She earns money by selling eggs and chickens to her regular customers, her neighbors.

Today she wants to increase her business and has applied to Komak Credit Union for a loan in the amount of 2,100 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). With this loan, she wants to buy more chickens to raise and to sell for a profit.

Agabaci says great thanks to the Kiva organization and all of its lenders for aiding her poultry business. In the future, Agabaci wants to help her children in their education.

loans.use: to buy more chickens and increase her business; in future she wants to help her children in their education.

loans.name: Sayhon

texts.en:
Sayhon is a resident of Pyandj district, located in southwestern Tajikistan. At the age of 50, Sayhon has a husband and three adult sons. Her husband works as a construction foreman in their district, and her eldest son is a migrant worker in the Russian Federation.

Sayhon is engaged in animal husbandry. She breeds cattle in her yard and started this activity 10 years ago. Sayhon takes good care of her animals. Her husband and youngest son help her in the work. Livestock is their main activity, because through this business they support their family.

Sayhon requested a loan because she has only a small number of cows. She intends to purchase several more head of cattle to keep active and increase the number of her livestock.

loans.use: to purchase several head of cattle

loans.name: Sangimoh

texts.en:
Sangimoh is 47 years old. She lives in the Khuroson district. Sangimoh is the mother of two daughters and two sons. Her daughters are 23 and 21 years old, and her sons are 17 and 10 years old. Sangimoh is divorced and lives in the village with her children. 

Sangimoh is engaged in the livestock business. The eldest son helps her in the work. During 10 years of her life she has engaged in this activity. Sangimoh loves animals, which is why she raises livestock. She likes milking cows and providing the family with milk and dairy products. 

Sangimoh also sells fruits and vegetables at the market. She is very hardworking woman. She cares that her children do not feel in need. Sangimoh is taking a loan to buy a few head of cattle for expanding her livestock business.

In the future, with the income from her livestock business, Sangimoh plans to expand her trading business of selling fruits and vegetables. She believes in you and your support.

loans.use: To purchase a few head of cattle

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
La señora Roxana pertenece al banco comunal SAN RAFAEL, la socia sigue dedicándose  a su negocio de venta de productos naturales para la salud, la socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorga y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas, la socia continua vendiendo sus productos naturales a sus clientes que le solicitan cada día, la socia desea que su negocio prospere, siendo  de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de  productos naturales.
texts.en: Mrs. Roxana belongs to the community bank SAN RAFAEL. She continues her business of selling natural health products. She appreciates the help she has been given and thus is committed to fulfilling the payment terms. She continues to sell her natural products to her clients who request them every day. She hopes that her business prospers because it is the way that she keeps her family going. Mrs. Roxana is requesting this loan to buy natural products.

loans.use: to buy natural products.

loans.name: Shirinkhon

texts.en:
Shirinkhon was born in 1971. She is careful mother of a daughter. Her daughter is 16 years old. 

Shirinkhon is very hardworking woman. She has been busy with animal husbandry more than 10 years. Shirinkhon buys cattle, feeds them for some months and then sells them in a local market. She manages with business alone. 

Shirinkhon is asking for a loan to buy cattle, in order to increase working capital and maximize profit. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy cattle to increase her working capital

loans.name: Bibirajab

texts.en:
Bibirajab was born in 1966 in Tajikistan. She is married and has three children, two sons and a daughter. Bibirajab’s husband is a migrant worker in Russia. Bibirajab is a teacher. She works during many years in a local school and has great experience in teaching. She teaches Tajik literature and language. 

Bibirajab is going to repair her house as it is in bad condition. She is asking for a loan of 2,000 USD to buy cement and bricks, and to pay for the master of repair. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy cement and bricks, and to pay for the master of repair

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia is in the hog raising business. She raises and sells hogs as her main source of income. She is a married woman living in Talibon, Bohol. She is married with six children. Her oldest child is 20 and the youngest is 2 months old. In addition, she engages in farming, growing and selling rice.

She is asking for a loan to buy pig feed and to pay for the tuition of her children. This will help Arsenia produce healthy piglets which will be sold after a few months. This will also improve the growth of the swine, thus producing more milk to feed its young. Because of this, she will be earning more and will be able to manage on her income. She will start to provide her children with proper diets and better living conditions.
 
In the future, Arsenia is determined to expand her hog raising business by having another swine to produce more piglets. In this way, she could support the education of all her children for a brighter tomorrow.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and pay for the tuition of her children

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself as a loyal and good person. She operates a retail business where she sells scrap metals. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are metal factories. She describes her biggest business challenge as price fluctuations. 

Margaret will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy more stock of scrap metal. This will enable her to increase her income. Her business goal is to supply more scrap metal to metal factories within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of scrap metal

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman. She has six children. She describes herself to be honest . 

She operates a retail business where she sells cooking oil, washing soap, sugar, and other items. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a convenient place and her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high prices of products. 

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock: washing soap, sugar, cooking oil, and other items. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler within five years. She hopes that in the future, the business will support her family. 

This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid  successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of washing soap, sugar, cooking oil, and other items

loans.name: J Leonidas

texts.es: Don Leonidas, tiene 52 años de edad, esta soltero, vive con sus dos hijos en el municipio de Gracias, Lempira. El siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura de granos básicos, hace 11 años aumentó su producción de maíz y frijol y la vende en el mercado local. Cuenta con su propia parcela de terreno para cultivar. El préstamo que solicita es el segundo ciclo y es por 15,000 Lempiras para comprar abonos y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y frijol, con el propósito de mejorar la producción y ventas. Su plan es ampliar el cultivo, mejorar la cosecha y sus ganancias para darle calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Leonidas is 52 years old. He is single and lives with his two children in the municipality of Gracias, Lempira. 

He has always made a living in agriculture growing staple crops. Eleven years ago, he increased his production of corn and beans, and he sells it at the local market. He has his own plot of land to cultivate. 

This is the second loan that he is requesting, and it is for 15,000 Lempiras. He will use the loan to buy organic and inorganic fertilizers for his corn and bean crops in order to improve his production and sales. 

His plan is to expand his crops, and improve his harvest and earnings to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy organic and inorganic fertilizers for his corn and bean crops.

loans.name: Irma Nora

texts.es:
Irma es una mujer soltera de 50 años del sector de Marinilla, sus ganas de trabajar y estudiar son el aliento que la llevaron a solicitar un crédito para iniciar su propia empresa, su mayor razón es que no quiere depender de nadie, sabe que es autosuficiente para salir adelante, pero no desconoce que necesita mucho apoyo para construir  su idea de trabajo.
Irma quiere solicitar un crédito para iniciar su negocio de venta de comida, dicho crédito lo invertirá en la construcción de un kiosco para vender alimentos, una freidora e insumos, para vender productos fritos y comidas rápidas como perros calientes, hamburguesas, papas francesas, etc.
texts.en:
Irma is a single woman, age 50, from the area of Marinilla.  Her desire to work and study are the push that led her to request a loan to start her own business.  Her main reason is that she does not want to depend on anyone; she knows she is self-sufficient enough to get ahead, but she is aware that she will need a lot of help to build her business idea. 

Irma wants to request a loan to start her business selling prepared food.  She will invest this loan in the construction of a stand to sell food, a fryer, and ingredients to she can sell fried foods and fast foods, such as hot dogs, hamburger, french fries, etc.

loans.use: to start her own food business, for which she will invest in building a stand, a fryer, and ingredients.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
Carismática, trabajadora y honrada son tres características que debemos mencionar al hablar de María Magdalena, ella es una madre 2 hijas y se desempeña como vendedora de comidas, solicita un crédito para la compra de implementos, la razón del monto es que necesita de muchos insumos, una freidora industrial, un horno, ollas de varios tamaños, losa, cuchillos.
Al no tener dichos gerramientas su actividad esta parada, por ello es una verdadera urgencia estos instrumentos que aportaran al crecimiento y libre desarrollo de su actividad.
texts.en:
Charismatic, hardworking, and honorable are three characteristics that must be mentioned when talking about María Magdalena. She is the mother of two daughters, and she works as a food vendor.  

She is requesting a loan for the purchase of implements.  The reason for the loan amount is that she needs a lot of supplies, a commercial fryer, an oven, pots in varying sizes, dishes, and knives.

Without these implements she cannot continue with her work, so they are urgently needed.  These implements will help her business to grow and develop.

loans.use: to purchase a commercial fryer, an oven, pots, implements, and knives, as she does not have any of these items.

loans.name: Gloria Elena

texts.es:
Gloria es una mujer de un increíble corazón, su actividad principal es la de cuidar a los niños en una guardería, la foto demuestra el carisma y el amor que siente por sus muchachos.
Hablando un poco de ella es una madre separada y tiene 3 hijos, los gastos del hogar corren de cuenta de ella y aunque su sueldo en la guardería no es el ideal puede suplir sus necesidad con la venta de mercancía principalmente ropa, pero los principales beneficiados son sus niños de la guardería, los cuales les lleva juegos didácticos, dulces Etc
Solicita un crédito para la compra de ropa para hombre y dama, que es el negocio que le da el capital para mantener su hogar, ella te necesita, los niños te necesitan.
texts.en:
Gloria is a woman with an incredible heart; her main source of work is looking after children at a daycare center; the picture shows her charisma and the love she has for the kids.  

To talk a little about her, she is a separated mother who has three children; she pays for the household expenses and though her salary at the daycare center is not ideal, she is able to supplement her needs by selling merchandise, mainly clothing.  However, the children at the daycare are the ones who benefit most because she brings them educational toys, candy, etc.

She is requesting a loan to buy men's and women's clothing, as this is the business that provides her with the capital to maintain her household.  She needs you; the children need you.

loans.use: to buy men's and women's clothing to generate income and give the children at her daycare center Christmas presents.

loans.name: Juana Irene

texts.es:
Juana Irene es una mujer de 48 años de edad, vive  en Sololá, tiene cuatro hijos de las cuales dos de ellas ya están casados. 

Juana trabaja como maestra en una escuela de su comunidad, lleva ya 20 años ejerciendo esa profesión le encanta ser maestra, porque se divierte con los niños ya que cada año se relaciona con niños de diferentes edades. Desde muy pequeña aspiro ser maestra ya que esta profesión únicamente le ocupa medio de día de trabajo, porque también a ella le gustaba la repostería.

Los sueños de Juana se le hizo realidad ella ahora trabaja medio de día como maestra y por las tardes ocupa su tiempo en la repostería. Juana por la misma necesidad de viajar todos los días a la escuela decidió comprarse una motocicleta que esto lo usa como medio de transporte para llegar con facilidad a la escuela. 

Pero después de darle tanto uso a la motocicleta ahora necesita de reparar algunas piezas gastadas, pero Juana no cuenta con dinero para repararla,  ahora está buscando un préstamo para poder arreglarlo, ya que es su medio para transportarse y más ahora que en enero empieza nuevamente su ciclo escolar. 

Juana tiene esperanzas en conseguir su préstamo  y con los trabajos que realiza en la actividad de  repostería pagara su préstamo.
texts.en:
Juana Irene is a 48-year-old woman who lives in Sololá. She has 4 children, 2 of whom are already married.

Juana works as a teacher in a school in her community. She has worked in this profession for 20 years. She loves being a teacher because she has fun with the children. Every year she gets to know children of different ages. Ever since she was a child, she wanted to be a teacher because it only takes up half the workday, because she also likes pastry-making.

Juana's dreams became reality, and now she works half the day as a teacher and in the afternoons spends her time in the bakery. Because Juana needs to travel every day to school, she decided to buy herself a motorcycle that she uses to get to school easily.

But after so much use, the motorcycle now needs repairs to some of its worn-out parts, but Juana doesn't have the money to repair it. She is requesting a loan to be able to fix it, because it is her mode of transportation and moreover, January marks the start of a new school year.

Juana hopes to secure this loan and repay it through her work at the bakery.

loans.use: to pay for motorcycle repairs

loans.name: Wilson Antonio

texts.es:
El  Máster en Agroforestal: Wilson Antonio, es  Casado,  tiene 2 hijos la mayor 10 años y la menor 2  años y ½ , su esposa es ejecutiva de venta y ambos comparten los gastos del hogar, Don Wilson es  Coordinador de Investigación en la Universidad URACCAN en el Municipio de Nueva Guinea, Cuenta con su propia Vivienda que ha construido a base de créditos y con trabajo que agradece a Dios no le ha faltado, estos créditos han hecho posible que su casa esté muy bonita aunque con algunos pendientes que completará posteriormente.  Su mayor prioridad ahora es comprar Piedras Canteras, Cemento, Hierro, Inodoro, Tuberías y pagar mano de obra para realizar baño e instalar servicio sanitario en su vivienda, para lo cual solicita este crédito a Kiva.  Esta familia consolida sus ingresos pero sus gastos son altos por las inversiones que han venido realizando en su Vivienda y a Don Wilson se le hace imposible asumir con sus propios ingresos la inversión proyectada necesita el crédito para hacer realidad sus sueño y brindar mayor higiene y privacidad en su hogar.
no solo en vivienda ha invertido los créditos Kiva, también en sus estudios Profesionales ahora don Wilson tiene mayor capacidad para realizar su trabajo con mayor eficiencia y ha mejorado sus ingresos para bien de su familia.

El Sr. Wilson no omite la idea de hacer otro crédito cuando cancele el que está solicitando, si Dios se lo permite construirá una tapia   que es de mucha importancia para su familia tener mayor seguridad y tranquilidad en su Vivienda.
texts.en:
Wilson Antonio has a Masters degree in Agroforestry. He is married and has two children. His older child is 10 years old and the younger one is 2½. His wife is a sales executive for a retail furniture chain in Central America.. Don Wilson is the research coordinator at URACCAN (University of the Autonomous Regions of the Nicaraguan Caribbean Coast) in the town of Nueva Guinea.

He has his own home, which was built with the help of loans. Wilson is grateful to God that he is not lacking in work. The loans have made it possible for him to have a nice house, but there are a few things that need to be completed at a later time. His main priority right now is to buy quarry stones, cement, iron, a toilet, pipes, and to pay for labor so that a bathroom and sewage system can be installed in his home. This is why he is requesting a Kiva loan. Even with his family’s combined income, the expenses are still too high for him to make this investment in his home. It would be impossible for Don Wilson to take on this project with his income, so he needs a loan in order to fulfill his dream of providing better sanitation and privacy in his home.

Not only has Wilson invested Kiva loans into his home, but he also used them for his professional studies. Don Wilson is now better equipped to perform his job with greater efficiency and earn more income to benefit his family.

Sr. Wilson is not opposed to the idea of taking out another loan when this one has been repaid. If God allows he will build a security wall. This is very important for his family because it will provide greater safety and tranquility at home.

loans.use: to buy quarry stones, cement, iron, a toilet, pipes, and to pay for labor so that a bathroom and sewage system can be installed in his home.

loans.name: Loren

texts.en: Loren is a second-year student, taking up a Bachelor of Science in Criminology. He lives with his parents at Enrile. His mother is a hog raiser, while his father is a farmer. He is the fifth child, among six. Loren wanted to finish his education, but his family had insufficient fund to sustain their needs. That is why he is now asking for an educational loan of PHP 10,000. He will use this to pay his tuition fees. Someday, when he has become successful, he will help lift his family out of poverty.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees, toward his bachelor degree in Criminology.

loans.name: Alba Karina

texts.es:
La Joven Alba Karina de 20  años de edad, vive con su familia  en su casa propia, se dedica desde hace 3  años al negocio de venta de abarrotería, en su negocio vende frescos, churros, frijoles, arroz, azúcar, manteca, avena,  lácteos, jabón, pollo,  etc. 
Alba Karina vive en una ciudad de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras, es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Esta solicitando el préstamo para compra de productos para surtir la pulpería,  como refrescos, aguas, huevos, café, azúcar, harina, pollo, pan, queso, aceite, frijoles, arroz, etc. con el apoyo de este préstamo espera que sus ingresos mejoren y por ende su calidad de vida, es un cliente nuevo con deseos de trabajar con Prisma.
Alba Karina uno de sus sueños es tener un buen negocio bien surtido y al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro junto a su familia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras- Diciembre 2014
texts.en:
Alba Karina is a 20-year-old young woman who lives with her family in their private home. She has worked for the past three years selling groceries. At her store, she sells soda, churros [fried pastries], beans, rice, sugar, butter, oats, dairy products, ham, chicken, etc.

Alba Karina lives in the city of San Lorenzo in southern Honduras. She is an enterprising woman with a drive to succeed and she works every day to improve her quality of life.

She is requesting a loan to purchase products to stock her grocery store, such as soda, water, eggs, coffee, sugar, flour, chicken, bread, cheese, oil, beans, rice, etc. With the support of this loan, she hopes that her income will increase and her quality of life improve.

She is a new borrower with hopes for success with Prisma. One of her dreams is to have a quality, well-stocked business and at the same time, improve the future of herself and her family.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - December 2014

loans.use: to purchase soda, water, eggs, coffee, sugar, flour, chicken, bread, cheese, oil, beans, rice, etc. for her business

loans.name: Yarama

texts.en: Yarama is 35 years old  living in the village of Mundri, Western Equatoria state region of  South Sudan. A loan of 1300 ssp will help him purchase soap, sugar,  etc.

loans.use: to purchase soap, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Pov, age 51, is a local farmer form Kandal province. She is a mother of five dependent children. For her family's living, she grows rice, as a single source of income.

This is her third loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loans. She used them wisely, to improve her living conditions at a gradual pace. She will spend her entire loan to pay tuition for her daughter, who wants to pursue the bachelor degree majoring in Nursing. She hopes that her daughter can get a good job, after graduation.

loans.use: to pay tuition for her daughter, who will study Nursing.

loans.name: Manuel Jesus Carlos

texts.es:
Manuel Jesús es un señor casado de 40  años de edad vive en una comunidad llamada Nahuala Sololá  tiene 5 hijos de diferentes edades y algunos de ellos estudian en una escuelita de su comunidad. 

Manuel es un  hombre  que lucha por darle una mejor vida a su familia, actualmente él se dedica a la agricultura sembrando diversidad de hortalizas, en su comunidad, pues él desde pequeño estuvo al lado de su padre para conocer todo este proceso,  esta experiencia lo ha venido trayendo desde hace 20 años, Manuel se caso y se dio cuenta que no era suficiente esta actividad, para  mantener a su familia,  pues busco una segunda actividad ahora él se dedica también  a la albañilería. Lo que busca Manuel ahora es un préstamo para  innovar su agricultura, él anhela la siembra de  arveja dulce y comprar insumos para el mismo. Pero no cuenta con capital para hacerlo,  él considera que a través de un préstamo pueda conseguir esta meta. 

Manuel siempre piensa en el bienestar de su familia, el sueño de Manuel es que a largo plazo  con las ganancias de la producción de arveja,  puede seguir construyendo otra casita más.
texts.en: Manuel Jesús is a married 40 year old man who lives in Nahuala, Sololá . He has 5 children of different ages and some of them attend school in their community. Manuel is a man who fights to give his family a better life. Today he farms, growing a variety of crops in his community. He learned how to farm at his father's side when he was a little boy, ,and this experience has been with him for 20 years. Manuel married and realized that farming alone was not sufficient to support his family so he looked for a second job and now he also works in bricklaying. Manuel seeks a loan to invest in his farming. His goal is to plant sweet peas and buy supplies for the crops. But he doesn't have the capital to do so, therefore he is seeking a loan. Manuel also keeps his family's well-being at the forefront. He dreams that in the long term the income from his pea production will enable him to be able to continue building another little house.

loans.use: to buy seeds

loans.name: Carlos Enrique

texts.es:
Carlos un padre soltero, con una hermosa bebe de tan solo 2 años de edad, genera el sustento y los recursos gracias a su taller de reparación de motos, el cual escasea de repuestos  por lo que solicita un crédito para la compra de variedad de estos repuesto que necesita de urgencia pues le ha tocado comprarlos en talleres vecinos a una alto costo.
Con la ayuda de este crédito podrá abastecer su almacén y tener los insumos necesarios para cubrir la lamentable cifra de motos que llegan a su almacén, aclara la lamentable cifra pues diciembre representa una alta cuota de accidentalidad.
texts.en:
Carlos is a single father with a lovely baby who is just 2 years old. He creates support and resources thanks to his motorcycle repair workshop, which is short in supply of spare parts, so, he is asking for a loan to buy a variety of these spare parts that he needs urgently as he has had to buy them in neighbouring workshops at a high cost.
With the help of this loan he will be able to stock up his shop and have the necessary supplies to cover the terrible number of motorbikes that come to his shop, he explains that this number is terrible because in December there is a high accident rate.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for motorcycles.

loans.name: Nikoll

texts.en:
This is Nikoll and his wife, Marie. They are the parents of five children ranging in age from 24 down to thirteen.

Nikoll and Marie have been farmers for almost twenty years. They own eight dynyms or 8000 square meters of land; in two dynyms of this land they have grapevines, and in the other dynyms, olive groves. From the sales of their grapes they receive approximately $1500 a year, whereas the olive trees have not produced yet since they were planted in the last two years.

The couple’s oldest two children work as well; the oldest son works in construction and receives $300 a month, while the oldest daughter works in a shoe factory owned by foreigners and receives $200 a month.

Today Nikoll and Marie are applying for a 300,000 ALL loan through VisionFund Albania. They are seeking your financial help to pay for their rural retirement contribution for both of them.

loans.use: to pay for the rural retirement pension contribution for both him and his wife

loans.name: Sulaiman

texts.en:
Sulaiman is a 24-year-old married man from Jenin City. He lives with his wife and two sons in a simple house. He works as a teacher in a public school where he earns a low income. This is the only source of income to the family. Sulaiman is also a student in a local college where he studies for a master's degree in mathematics. He wants to complete his study and find a better job to improve his family's living conditions.

Sulaiman took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the university installment fees for this semester. By taking this loan, Sulaiman will be able to pay part of the urgent expenses he has.

Sulaiman appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university installment fees for this semester

loans.name: Jhonatan

texts.es:
El socio Jhonatan pertenece al banco comunal SAN RAFAEL, él socio sigue dedicándose a brindar el servicio de taxi y alquilando equipos electrónicos para los distintos compromisos que solicitan sus servicios, él socio lleva tiempo con sus negocios los cuales le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a cada uno de ellos, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra  de llantas.
texts.en:
Jhonatan is a member of the San Rafael communal bank. He continues to provide a taxi service and hire out electronic equipment to those who request his services. Jhonatan has had his businesses for some time and they are going well thanks to the effort that he puts into each one every day. 

He wants to be able to continue working so that he can continue to support his family. He is asking for a loan to buy tyres.

loans.use: to buy tyres

loans.name: Zahid

texts.en:
Zahid is a taxi driver. He is thirty-seven years old, married and has two children. One of them is eight and is in second grade at school. His other child is in preparatory school. His wife is a home-maker. Zahid lives with his lovely family in Baku region. 

Zahid is a taxi driver, so he transports passengers between various areas of the Baku area. Zahid wants to increase his business and therefore he has applied to Komak for a loan in the amount of 800 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). With this loan, he wants to repair his car. He is greatly thankful to Kiva and its lenders for their help. In the future Zahid wants to give a good education to his children.

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Ashurgul

texts.en:
Ashurgul is an ordinary rural woman who is 49 years old. She lives in the mountain area Khuroson with three sons and daughter in law. 

In order to bring a source of income to the family, Ashurgul began the livestock business in 2003 and continues it to this day. In addition, she is engaged in plant growing.

The aim of the loan is purchasing several head of cattle. Ashurgul intends to increase the quantity of cattle, because now she has only one head of cattle in her barnyard. Your support is important to her to preserve this source of income.

loans.use: To purchase several head of cattle

loans.name: Uralbek

texts.en:
Uralbek was born in 1962. He and his wife are happy and have three children. He is very hardworking and kind-natured. Uralbek has been farming for 15 years. He has a great experience in this field. He grows vegetables and sells the harvest in a local market. He also feeds cattle. 

In order to provide his vegetables business with the needed attention, he is currently requesting another loan in the amount of 2,500 somoni (TJS) to buy fertilizer and continue improving his crop production. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase cardboard boxes, reams of carbon paper, and legal- and letter-sized paper with the goal of increasing sales

loans.name: Akram

texts.ru: Акраму 22 года  . Он студент 3 курса.  С детства Акрам мечтал получить хорошее образование и  вот его мечта сбылась. Живет Акрам  в большой дружной семье .У него еще два брата.  В их большой  семье живут три поколения. Пожилые бабушка и дедушка помогают молодым дома ухаживая за самыми младшими внуками. Отец  Акрама на заработках в России. Ведь для того чтобы прокормить такую большую семью и дать образование детям  необходима финансовая стабильность.  Мама Акрама также работает на государственной работе. Хотя семейный доход достаточен для проживания  и питания но для  оплаты  за образование Акраму пришлось обратиться в «Арванд».  Он надеется что взяв кредит в Арванде он решить проблему  оплаты и продолжит учебу.
texts.en:
Akram is 22 and a third-year university student. He has dreamed since childhood of getting a good education and now his dream is coming to fruition. He lives with three generations of his large, loving family, including two brothers and his elderly grandmother and grandfather, who help out by caring for the youngest grandchildren. Akram's father is working in Russia, since feeding such a large family and educating your children requires financial stability. Akram's mother also works in a government job. 

While the family income is enough to cover living expenses and food, they have had to turn to Arvand to cover Akram's tuition. He hopes that with a loan from Arvand he will be able to solve his tuition problem and continue his studies.

loans.use: to pay his university tuition

loans.name: Arjan

texts.en:
Arjan is 44 years old and has three children. The oldest is fifteen and the youngest is three. Arjan is a tailor by profession, and the reason he is applying for this loan is to stock up on fabric, raw material, leather and other items necessary to this profession. He not only stitches clothes, but he also makes upholstery for cars from leather and fabric. His elderly father, who lives with them, receives a pension of about $198 per month. 

Arjan lived and worked in Greece for 20 years, and it is there he learned the profession. About a year and a half ago, he moved from Greece due to the economic fallout to settle in his little town of residence. As soon as he arrived, he opened up a space where he could practice his profession.

loans.use: to buy fabric, raw material, leather and other items needed in his profession

loans.name: Gervais

texts.en:
Gervais is 30 years old. He is married with one child, who is 6 years old and goes to school. He is a farmer and has been farming for eight years. With this loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizers to grow maize to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay for his workers.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to grow maize to sell.

loans.name: Rovelyn

texts.en:
Rovelyn is a businesswoman from Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 34 years old, a widow and has expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family.

Rovelyn is a full fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without any records of default. Now, she is applying for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items.

Rovelyn continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items.

loans.name: Viateur

texts.en:
Viateur is 39 years old. He is married and has three children aged between eight and two years old; two of them go to school. He has been a farmer for 22 years.

Viateur is applying for a 15,214 RWF loan through Urwego to buy fertilizer for his maize crops. The profits from his harvest will be used to pay his workers.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations.

For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his maize crops.

loans.name: Katherine

texts.en:
Katherine and her partner, Chris, started DigiTech Consulting last year with the goal of helping small businesses meet their IT needs. 

Katherine runs the operations of the business, while her partner is the IT expert. They set up computer networks, host, develop and design websites, basically, if it has to do with computers – they do it. 
 
Katherine says one of the biggest challenges is to find customers and get their name out there. She says there are many IT companies in San Diego, but you don’t get the same type of service that you get from DigiTech Consulting.  What separates them from other consulting companies is that they are a one-stop-shop for small businesses and they have a new innovative project, the Office in a Box. 

Their goal for the future is to double their client base and break even by the end of next year. They will be using their Kiva loan to build a new website as well as market their business to get new customers. They are so grateful to the generous Kiva lenders that are helping them help small businesses.

loans.use: to build a new website as well as market their business to get new customers.

loans.name: Abdulahad

texts.en:
Abdulahad is a handsome man. He was born in 1993. He lives in a village with family. He is single. He is a strong, a hardworking and clever boy. 

His father works as a livestock man. The annual income that his father gains from his activity does not covers expenditures. 

Abdulahad wants to graduate from a university. His goal is to be an economist. He hopes that being educated will help him to be a good specialist. 

He considers that he has an obligation to be helpful to the community. Abdulahad needs financial support to pay tuition for the university.

loans.use: To pay tuition

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be patient. He operates a transportation business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a marketable area, and his primary customers are travellers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. He will use the 40,000 KES loan to service his motorcycle. His business goal is to have more motorcycles for transportation within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be successful. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to service his motorcycle

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a married woman. She has five children with ages ranging from 5 years to 18 years. She describes herself to be optimistic. 

She operates a retail business where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for ten years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of charcoal. Her business goal is to be a supplier within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a better life. 

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of charcoal

loans.name: Reynilda

texts.en:
Reynilda is a married woman from Baybay, Leyte. She is thirty-six years old with three children aged three, eleven and twelve. Reynilda works hard to provide for her family. She raises hogs, grows vegetables such as squash and string beans, and also collects coconut wine to sell with the help of her husband. She is asking a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy feed, fertilizer, seedlings and tannin powder for the coconut wine. 

Reynilda hopes to see her children be successful in their studies and have a good life that is different from hers. Her income will be used to pay for her children's tuition, to buy food for her family and reinvest into her businesses.

loans.use: to buy feed, fertilizer, seedlings and tannin powder

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita engages in the food vending business. She cooked and sells  meals to the people in her community. Aside from that, she also runs a sari-sari (variety) store, and sells items like biscuits, noodles, canned goods, soft drinks, and toiletries.  She is a 48-year-old married woman with two children, aged 16 and 12 respectively.

Carmelita is asking for a loan to buy supplies for food vending and stocks for the store like food snacks and school supplies . Because of this additional stock, she would now prepare a variety of meals that would attract more customers. She will have more display of good inside her store that will surely  makes it attractive for those who pass by.

She hopes that, someday, she will reap the good harvest from which she is determined to expand her business and exert more effort to be productive and these will lead it to be sustainable as well.

loans.use: to buy supplies for food vending and stocks for the store like food snacks and school supplies

loans.name: Delma

texts.en: Delma is fifty years old. She is married with one dependent aged fourteen. She lives in Estancia, Iloilo with her family. Delma has been a Sari-sari (variety) store owner for five years now. She sells various items like coffee, sugar, detergent, seasoning and soft drinks. Together with her husband, they work hard to support the needs of their child. Delma is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy to buy gasoline, electronic load refill, canned goods, chips, candy, bath soap and condiments. Her child motivates her to work hard. She hopes that someday, she will be able to see him finish college and have a good life.

loans.use: to buy gasoline, electronic load refill, canned goods, chips, candy, bath soap and condiments

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is a 42-year-old sari-sari store owner from the community of Estancia in Iloilo. 

A sari-sari store is small convenience store, usually home-based, that sells basic commodities in a certain community. Milagros sells detergent, insect repellent, biscuits, cooking oil, candies, seasoning, shampoo, coffee, and salt.  She has been relying on her business for five years now.  

She is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy soft drinks, chips, canned goods, bath soap, shampoo, and condiments.

Milagros hopes to expand her business for sustainability. Her income will be for savings, a healthy diet, and school fees for her five children ages 3-18.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, chips, canned goods, bath soap, shampoo, and condiments

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: Alex is a married man. He has a child. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a retail business where he sells beauty products, shoes, key holders and other items. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insecurity. He will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy more stocks of shoes, key holders and other items. His business goal is to own a shop within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be a suppler. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stocks of shoes, key holders and other items

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a married man. He has two children. He operates a hardware shop where he sells pipes, cement, nails and other items. He has been involved in this business for seventeen years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. He will use the 80,000 KES loan to buy pipes, cement, nails and other items. His business goal is to own another shop within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will build a permanent residence for his family. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully

loans.use: buy pipes, cement, nails and other items

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity is a married woman. She has six children. She describes herself to be loyal and determined. She operates a beadwork business where she decorates bags with beads to sell. She has been involved in this business for ten years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. She will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy beads and other materials for making bags. She also bakes cakes to sell. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy beads and other materials for making bags

loans.name: Delima

texts.en:
Delima is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be optimistic. 

She operates a pottery business where she makes pots to sell. She has been involved in this business for 35 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy materials for making pots. Her business goal is to be a supplier within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a better life. She will use the anticipated profits to pay bills			
.

loans.use: buy materials for making pots

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be hardworking. 

She operates a retail business where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

Mary will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of charcoal. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have better living standards. 

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid  successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of charcoal

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be disciplined. She operates a retail business where she cooks fish to sell. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of business structure. She will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy more stocks of fish. Her business goal is to be successful within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable.

loans.use: buy more stock of fish

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana is a fifty-three-year-old woman from the Chiatura district. She has a husband and two school-aged sons. The only source of income for this family of four is Nana's husband's job. Nana's husband works as a hired worker and generates 250 GEL. The income is really insufficient for the family and they find it hard to tackle their financial difficulties. Nana has a great desire to do her part for the family's welfare and to be involved in her own business. She requested a loan but her application was rejected several times for not having enough income or business experience. 

Nana's loan request was approved by the start up program, a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo, which gives people a chance to start or re-start businesses. Nana plans to purchase stocks of used clothes and start selling these locally. She will sell the clothes from her house and be able to generate her own income. The loan will greatly assist Nana and her family, enabling them to cover daily costs and improve their living conditions. They await your help.

loans.use: buy used clothes

loans.name: Saparali

texts.ru: Сапарали 39 лет, женат. У него 4 детей. Сапарали в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, занимается погрузкой щебня и камней на собственном тракторе. Такого рода услуги он начал предоставлять уже после окончания училища, у Сапарали среднее образование. Сначала он перевозил камни на грузовом автомобиле (камазе), потом приобрел трактор. У него уже наработаны постоянные клиенты, ежемесячная прибыль составляет около 25,000 сом (KGS), в хороший сезон бывает больше. К сожалению трактор стал часто ломаться, поэтому Сапарали обратился в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку запчастей и ремонт трактора- единственного средства дохода семьи Сапарали. Доходы от кредита он будет откладывать на покупку большого трактора, чтобы в  дальнейшем улучшить материальное благосостояние его семьи.
texts.en:
Saparali is 39 and married with four children. He earns a living moving stones and rubble with his own tractor, a business he began right after finishing his high school education. At first he transported stones with a truck, and then he got a tractor. He now has regular customers and a monthly income of about 25,000 KGS, which can be higher in a good season. 

Unfortunately, Saparali's tractor has broken down, and so he has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 KGS to buy parts so he can repair his tractor, which is the only means of earning an income for his family. He plans to put profits from the loan toward buying a bigger tractor, which will help his family's standard of living in the future.

loans.use: to purchase parts and repair his tractor

loans.name: Zhamila

texts.ru: Жамила, 51 год, замужем. У них с мужем двое детей, дочери 14 лет, сыну -18 лет. Жамила в качестве источника дохода для своей семьи, в 2009 году начала заниматься полеводством и животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду Жамилы в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 3 овцы, также 0,54 Га обрабатываемой земли, где Жамила выращивает кукурузу и пшеницу для реализации. Ежемесячная прибыль от хозяйства составляет около 7,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Жамила обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку теленка для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита она планирует вкладывать в развитие бизнеса посредством покупки дополнительных голов скота и в образование ее детей.
texts.en:
Zhamila is 51 and married with two children, a 14-year-old daughter and an 18-year-old son. Since 2009 she has been working in agriculture and animal husbandry as a source of income for her family. Thanks to her hard work, she currently has three sheep on her farm as well as 0.54 hectares of land where she grows corn and wheat for sale. Her monthly income from the farm is about 7,000 KGS.

With the goal of further developing her business, Zhamila has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 30,000 KGS to purchase a calf for fattening and resale. She plans to put profits from the loan into further developing her business by increasing her head count of livestock, and toward her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase a calf to fatten and resell

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong, 38, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn income through their business of washing and repairing old motorbikes. Huong started this business twelve years ago. 

She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a washing machine for her motorbike washing service. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike washing machine.

loans.name: Mari

texts.en:
Mari is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor running water.

For the past year, she has operated a retail shop business, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors taking too long to repay goods taken on credit. 

With the loan of 20,000 KES that she is requesting, she wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Al- Sheab Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al- Sheab and is composed of four women and a man who live in Taiz city, Yemen.  They applied for a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB. 

The president of the group is Wedad, who is thirty-three years old. The house where she lives with her husband is small, as it consists of only one room, small kitchen and a bathroom. Wedad's husband works with a daily wage which is not enough to cover the expanding costs of the house. Wedad feels ashamed about this condition, especially if any guests come to the house. As a result, Wedad applied for a loan of 20,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase construction supplies to make an extra room.

Wedad's dream is to build a second floor for the house.

loans.use: To purchase construction supplies to make an extra room.

loans.name: Anwar

texts.en:
Anwar is a 19 years old single man from Khanyounis . He lives with his parents in a simple house. His father works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. Anwar is a student in a local collage where he studies Business Administration. He wants to complete his studies and find a job to improve the family living conditions.

Anwar took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Anwar will be able to do his homework and write reports easily.

Anwar appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a microfinance member of PMPC. She is 54 years old, married, and has a ready-to-wear business in Tudela. This is how she supports her family with a meager income of PHP 2,500 per month. Recently, Jocelyn requested a loan to purchase bags of cement to complete her house.

She wants to improve her family's living conditions and maintain her membership with the Cooperative.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement to house complete her house.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is 27 years old, married and together with his spouse has been blessed with three children. He has been a farmer in Kapsabet, and his farm has been profitable.

This will be Joel’s first loan from VisionFund Kenya. He plans to use a 20,000 KES loan to buy a cow. He will use the anticipated profits derived from his cow to improve his farm by buying more farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer.

Joel’s hopes for the future are to expand his farm, make more money and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Cristobal Alfonso

texts.es: Cristobal es un emprendedor hombre de 32 años de edad, es padre de una hija de 2 años y se dedica a la comercialización de globos, su idea de negocio surgió cuando se dedicaba a cambiar globos por chatarra o material de reciclaje, el cual luego vendía, pero consideró que le sería más rentable ofrecer los globos a las tiendas de barrio, puso en marcha su idea y le resultó viable, desde entonces sus principales clientes son las tiendas y misceláneas quienes le cancelan de contado y también les ofrece facilidad de pago.  Actualmente tiene 10 años en esta actividad en la que trabaja de lunes a domingo de 7 a.m. a 5 p.m., él es muy comprometido con su trabajo porque desea darle un excelente bienestar a su hijo y desea expandir su negocio a otros sectores de la ciudad.  Como su capital de trabajo le es insuficiente está aplicando a su primer credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará globos de diferentes calidades y tonalidades para ampliar la cobertura.  Esta inversión es muy importante para su negocio puesto que podrá comprar de contado a su proveedor,  obtener descuentos y una mayor rentabilidad.
texts.en: Cristobal is an enterprising 32-year-old man. He is the father of a 2-year-old daughter and makes a living commercializing balloons. His business idea arose when he was working in changing balloons for scrap or recycled material which he then sold. But he considered that it would be more profitable to offer the balloons to local stores. He launched his idea and it was viable. Since then, his main customers are the shops and corner stores who make payments in cash, and he also offers them ease of payment. Cristobal currently has 10 years of experience in this activity and he works Monday to Sunday, 7AM to 5PM. He is very committed to his work because he wants to give his son an excellent level of well-being. He wants to expand his business to other parts of the city. Since his working capital is insufficient he is applying for his first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Through this loan he will buy balloons of different qualities and tonalities to increase coverage. This investment is very important for his business position because he can make purchases in cash from his supplier, get discounts, and increase profitability.

loans.use: to buy balloons of different qualities and tonality to increase coverage

loans.name: Al- Fol Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al- Fol. It consists of four women from Hodeidah city, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 130,000 YER from AMB.

Sadia is the leader of the group. She is 44 years old and a mother of two children. She has a diploma certificate but couldn't find a job that will provide for her children. Her husband is the sole breadwinner of the family with a very limited income that is not enough to cover the necessary expenses of the family.

Sadia decided to start her own business selling women's clothes and perfumes door to door. She has a small amount of money which is not enough to start her own business. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase women's clothes and perfumes to resell.

Sadia hopes to expand her business more.

loans.use: to purchase women's clothes and perfumes to resell.

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es:
José, comparte su casa con su esposa y un nieto de 17 años de edad, quienes son dependientes de él, su negocio consiste en la crianza de ganado, la cual realiza todos los días sin un horario establecido, también los días miércoles y domingos sale a vender lácteos en el mercado del municipio. Su familia le brinda ayuda para realizar estas actividades.
Utilizará el préstamo para comprar comida para el ganado, crema, quesos, cuajada, requesón, etc., le permitirá tener más producto a la disposición de sus clientes en la época de fin de año, espera que las ganancias sean favorables y pueda salir adelante con sus obligaciones.
Sus proyecciones son mantenerse trabajando, aumentar su ganado y comprar un nuevo automóvil para realizar sus actividades diarias.
texts.en: José shares his home with his wife and a 17 year old grandson who are dependent upon him. His business consists of raising cattle, which he works every day, without a specific established work schedule. Also on Wednesdays and Sundays he goes out to sell dairy products in the municipal market. His family supports him in his work. He will use the loan to buy food for the cattle, cream, cheese, cheese curds, cottage cheese, etc. which will permit him to have more products available for customers for the end of the year season. He hopes that his income will be favorable and he can successfully meet his obligations. His goals are to continue working, increase his cattle, and buy a new automobile to do his daily work.

loans.use: to buy food for the cattle, cream, cheese, cheese curds, cottage cheese, etc. which will permit him to have more products available for customers for the end of the year season.

loans.name: Akmal

texts.ru: Акмалу 30 лет. Он женат и является отцом двоих прекрасных детей. Акмал очень трудолюбивый молодой человек , который заботится о своей семье и пытается как может создать хорошие условия для жизнедеятельности своей семьи.Он живет вместе со своей женой и ребенком  вместе с родителями. Он на протяжении трех лет является клиентом "Арванд" и пользуется услугами нашей организации, у него хорошая кредитная история. Жена Акмала  также помогает ему и не сидит без дела , она шьет на заказ национальную одежду и тем самым вносит свой вклад в бюджет семьи.  Акмал  занимается садоводством ,  с любовью ухаживая за своим садом он получает хороший урожай и изготавливает сухофрукты.  Для расчета с налогом , для приобретения минеральных удобрений он хочет взять кредит и так как доволен услугами "Арванд"-а он повторно обратился к нам и заранее благодарит   в поддержке.
texts.en: Akmal is 30 years old. He is married and a father of two beautiful children. Akmal is a very hardworking young man, who cares about his family and tries as much as he can to create life good conditions for his family. He lives with his wife and child and his parents. He has been a client of "Arvand" for three years and used the services of our organization, and has a good credit history. Akmal's wife also helps him and does not sit idly by; she sews national clothing to-order and, thus, makes her investment into the family's budget. Akmal is involved in gardening, caring for his garden with love, receiving a good harvest and making dried fruits. Because he is happy with "Arvand" services, he came to use once again and is grateful in advance for the support. He wants to obtain this loan to pay his tax and buy mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to pay his tax and buy mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Muborak

texts.ru: Муборак  женщина 45 лет ,замужем , мать четверых детей. Она трудолюбивая женщина,которая на протяжение уже двадцати с лишним лет работает на поле,выращивает фрукты и овощи,ухаживает за скотом.На своем участке земли она имеет 10 баранов и 2 коровы.Она любит свое дело,каждое утро она доит коров,и относит молоко на рынок для продажи.Также на ее участке земли она выращивает урюк и яблоки.Урожай ей помогает собирать старший сын.Муборак несмотря на свой возраст,целый день работает на поле.Она обратилась в МДО Арванд с заявкой на кредит,чтобы закупить корм для скота на зиму.Муборак надеется,что МДО Арванд откликнется на просьбу Муборак и выделит нужную ей сумму.
texts.en: Muborak is a 45-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. She is a hardworking woman, who has been working on a field, growing fruits and vegetables and caring for livestock for twenty plus years. She has 10 sheep and 2 cows on her land. She loves her work. She milks cows every morning and sells milk at a market. She also grows apricots and apples on her land. Her oldest son helps her gather the harvest. Muborak, despite her age, works on the field all day long. She requested a loan from MDO Arvand to buy livestock feed for the winter. Muborak hopes that MDO Arvand will respond to her request and provide her with the necessary sum.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed for the winter

loans.name: Susana

texts.en: Susana is 52 years old, married and has two adult sons. She lives with her husband in a house that she inherited from her parents. Susana has a grocery store nearby her home. She has been in business since she was very young because the store was the property of her mother. She wants to buy more merchandise for her grocery store. Although her husband works, Susana needs a loan and she will appreciate it if you help her.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her grocery store

loans.name: Sawsan

texts.en:
Sawsan is a 21 year old single woman from Nalus city. She lives with her family in a simple house. Her brother works as an employee in a local firm. This is the only source of income for the family. Sawsan is also a student in a local collage where she studies Educational Sciences. She wants to complete her studies and find a job to improve the family living conditions.

Sawsan took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the university installments for this semester. By taking this loan, Sawsan will be able to pay part of the urgent expenses she has .

Sawsan appears in the photo

loans.use: to pay the university fees for this semester.

loans.name: Lourd

texts.en:
Lourd is a 22-year-old single lady from Bethlehem city. She lives with her parents and two brothers in a simple house. Her father is a construction worker and earns a low and unstable income. Her mother works in a store selling traditional handmade pieces. Lourd is a student studying hotel management in Germany. She received a scholarship when she finished high school but she still needs some money for traveling expenses.
Lord took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay traveling expenses to go to her university. By taking this loan, Lourd will be able to take advantage of the scholarship. Lourd appears in the photo

loans.use: to pay traveling expenses to go to her university

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more sweets and groceries

loans.name: Las Chinas Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Las Chinas está integrado por tres mujeres emprendedoras de éxito, quien es coordinado por la señora Elisa de 26 años de edad, acompañada y se dedica a comercialización de cosméticos y ropa de manera ambulante desde hace seis años. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de perfumes, vanidades, brillos labiales, sombras, cremas corporales, camisas, pantalones, shores, capris, toallas, etc. La segunda socia es la señora Yasmina de 36 años de edad, y se dedica a la venta de plásticos. Y la tercera socia es la señora Johanna de 33 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace diez años.
texts.en: The group Las Chinas consists of three successful women entrepreneurs, who are coordinated by 26-year-old Mrs. Elisa who lives with a common law partner. She has made a living selling cosmetics and clothing as a street vendor for six years. She is requesting this loan to buy perfumes, compacts, lip glosses, eye shadows, body creams, shirts, pants, shorts, capris, towels, etc. The second partner is 36-year-old Mrs. Yasmina who works selling plastics. The third partner is 33-year-old Mrs. Johanna who has worked selling clothing for ten years.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, compacts, lip glosses, eye shadows, body creams, shirts, pants, shorts, capris, towels, etc.

loans.name: Omar

texts.es: Omar es residente en el corregimiento de Juan Minas del Municipio de Barranquilla,  tiene 48 años de edad y es padre de dos hijos de 21 y 23 años y una hija de 18 años de edad, él se encuentra dedicado a la venta de productos elaborados con harina de diferentes tipos y freídos en aceite, que son comida típica de la Costa Caribe Colombiana. Él elabora caribañolas (masa de yuca rellena con carnes o queso), empanadas (masa de maíz rellena con carnes o queso), papas (masa de papa rellena con carne o pollo), arepa de huevo (masa de maíz rellena de huevo), todos estos productos son sofreídos en aceite bien caliente y cuando ya están cocidos, él los ofrece en la terraza de su casa.  Omar inició este negocio en el año 2008, ante la necesidad de generar ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares, el capital inicial era muy escaso pero al trascurrir del tiempo se fue incrementando. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará insumos como  maíz, harina, arroz, verduras, carne, pollo, huevos y aceite, para incrementar su capacidad puesto que en el sector hay mucha afluencia de clientes. Omar tiene metas claras para su familia y negocio, él desea adquirir su casa propia y comercializar otros productos desde su casa como carne y pollo.  Aunque su principal desafío ha sido los recursos para lograr hacer crecer su negocio, él continua trabajando con mucho entusiasmo.
texts.en:
Omar is a resident of the small town of Juan Minas in the municipality of Barranquilla.  He is 48-years old and the father of two sons, who are 21- and 23-years old respectively, and one daughter, who is 18-years old.  
Omar makes his living selling fried products made from different types of flour, which is food typical of Columbia's Caribbean coast.  He makes "caribañolas" (yucca dough filled with meats or cheese), "empanadas" (corn dough filled with meats or cheese) "papas" (potato dough filled with meat or chicken) and "arepa de huevo" (corn dough filled with eggs).  All of these products are lightly fried in very hot oil.  Once they are cooked, Omar sells them from his home's terrace.  
Omar started his business in 2008 out of a need to generate an income to cover his family's expenses.  He had limited capital initially, but with time it started increasing.  Omar is currently applying for his first Credikiva, his first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which he will purchase supplies.  He will purchase corn, flour, rice, vegetables, meat, chicken, eggs and cooking oil.  The purchases will help him to increase his capacity, as in his area there are a large number of customers.  
Omar has clear goals for his family and his business.  He wants to acquire his own home and to sell other products from his home, such as meat and chicken.  Although his main challenge has been resources to be able to grow his business, Omar continues to work enthusiastically.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as corn, flour, rice, vegetables, chicken, eggs and cooking oil.

loans.name: Hikoyat

texts.ru:
54-летняя Хикоят проживает в районе Рудаки. Она энергичная, усердная женщина, имеющая собственный бизнес. В течение полтора года Хикоят занимается продажей пирожков и ее лавка расположена рядом с рынком, где всегда полно народу. Она печет и продает вкусные горячие пирожки с разными начинками. За счет бизнеса Хикоят получает ежедневный доход, который позволяет ей поддерживать семью.
Хикоят замужем и является матерью троих детей. У нее двое сыновей и одна дочь. Старший сын вместе с отцом находится за пределами страны на заработках, а младший сын помогает матери в ее деятельности.    
Хикоят сейчас нуждается в кредите для продолжения деятельности. Она на сумму запрашиваемого кредита хочет купить запас муки и растительного масла.  Ваша поддержка поможет ей и дальше продолжать свое любимое дело и не остаться без истичника дохода.
texts.en:
54-year-old Hikoyat lives in the Rudaki region. She is an energetic, diligent woman who runs her own business. For a year and a half she has been selling pirozhki (a kind of pastry) in her shop next to the market, where there is always a lot of people. She bakes and sells delicious hot pirozhki with various fillings. She receives a daily income from the business, which allows her to support her family.

Hikoyat is married and has three children, two sons and one daughter. Her oldest son, along with his father, is working abroad, and her youngest son helps his mother with her business.

Hikoyat currently needs a loan to continue her business. She wants to buy flour and vegetable oil with the loan amount. Your support will help her to continue her beloved occupation and not be left without a source of income.

loans.use: to buy flour and vegetable oil for her bakery

loans.name: Marie Andre's Group

texts.fr:
Ce  est créé le 02 Novembre  2006, jour de l’inauguration du banc villageois. Il est composé de  femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Elles ont une expérience solide dans le programme des bancs villageois pour avoir fait plusieurs cycles pour la majorité de ses membres. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce et l’artisanat.

Madame  Marie André (debout à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est la représentante du groupe. Elle est âgée de 40 ans, est mariée et sans enfant. C’est une femme leader dans le groupement. Elle s’active dans l’aviculture, pour se faire elle  achète des poussins  les élèvent pendant au moins 45 jours pour revendre les poulets de chair par pièce après abattage. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 04 cartons de 25 poussins et des aliments et divers vaccin pour les poussins.

 Les bénéfices de son activé lui permettront de mieux satisfaire ses besoins et d’améliorer la qualité de la nourriture.
texts.en:
This group was created 2 November 2006, on the inauguration day of the banc villageois. It is made up of women who all live in the same area. They have had a solid experience in the banc villageois system, with many members having gone through many cycles. They work primarily in small-scale commerce and making artisan goods.

Marie André (who is standing on the far right with her hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. She is 40 years old, married, and has no children. She is the leader of the group. She works in poultry farming, where she buys chicks and raises them for at least 45 days. After they are slaughtered she sells these broiler chickens by the piece. She has done well with this business. 

With this new loan, she plans to buy four boxes of 25 chicks along with the feed and various vaccinations they need. Earnings from this business will allow her to better meet her needs and to improve the quality of her family's diet.

loans.use: to buy four boxes of 25 chicks, plus feed and vaccinations

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan has a motorcycle transport business and has been in this business for 5 years now. He is 30 years old, married and, together with his spouse, has been blessed with 1 child. He also supports 3 members of his family.

He will use this loan to buy spare parts to service and repair his motorcycle. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business by buying another motorcycle.

This is his first loan term from VisionFund Kenya and in future he hopes to expand his business and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for servicing his motorcycle.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is a married man. He has one child who is 2 years old. He describes himself to be understanding. 

He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a well-populated area and his primary customers are of all types. 

He will use the KES 70,000 loan to add to his savings to buy another motorcycle. He hopes that in the future, he will have a better life. 

This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: add to his savings to buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Wilson Enrique

texts.es:
Wilson vive en una comunidad de Sololá, es un hombre muy dedicado a su trabajo y le encanta su trabajo él tiene 26 años de edad  y vive muy apegado a su esposa. 

Wilson desde hace cuatro años viene trabajando como piloto automovilista, el maneja  ahora su propio mototaxi, él es una persona muy amable por el tipo de trabajo que realiza, es muy reconocida por la sociedad ya que todos los días se relaciona con personas de diferentes edades, el realiza viajes dentro del lugar donde vive, Wilson está interesado en conseguir un préstamo, ya que lo que él requiere es tener un pequeño capital para estar prevenido en cualquier desperfecto de su pequeño vehículo, gracias a Dios él ya cuenta con mucha clientela,  por ser una persona muy amigable. Con las ganancias que genera su vehículo estaría pagando el préstamo. 

Otro sueño de Wilson es que con el trabajo que tiene, pudiera en el futuro construir una pequeña casa para que cuando tenga a sus hijos, exista ya un lugar para ellos donde vivir. Wilson tiene esperanzas de conseguir el préstamo.
texts.en:
Wilson lives in a community in Sololá. He is a man who is very dedicated to his work and he loves it. He is 26 years old and he lives with his wife who he is very devoted to.
Wilson has worked for four years as an automobile driver and he now manages his own motorcycle taxi. He is a very nice person because of the work that he does and he is well recognised in society because he works with people of different ages everyday. He makes journeys in the area where he lives. Wilson is interested in getting a loan so that he can have a little money to be prepared for any imperfections with his small vehicle. Thankfully he already has many customers as he is a very friendly person. He would pay for the loan with the money he earns from his vehicle.
Another dream Wilson has is that with the work the he has that in the future he would be able to build a small house so that when he has children they will already have a place to live. Wilson hopes to get this loan.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman. She describes herself to be optimistic. 

She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for ten years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to be a supplier within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a better living. 

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
