Fatuma is a married woman with five kids, all of whom still attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Fatuma operates a stall selling fruit and vegetables. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of competition and seasonality in her business.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase sacks of fruit, oranges, bananas and green vegetables for resale. She dreams of expanding and establishing a retail shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruit, oranges, bananas and green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 36 years old. He is married with one child who has 8 years, and she/he goes to school. He is a farmer and has been farming for 12 years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizers grow beans and maize. The profits from his harvest will be used to renovate his house.


The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to grow beans and maize

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 48 years old. He is married with seven children, aged between 3 and 24 years, and all of them go to school. He is a farmer and has been farming for 19 years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizer to grow maize. The profits from his harvest will be used to pay school fees for his children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to grow maize

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman and has been blessed with three children, all of whom attend school. Her family lives in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a fish-selling business for over ten years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passers-by. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability, leading to losses.

With the 20,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale

loans.name: Kalimirire

texts.en: Kalimirire is a 41-year-old single man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a farmer, growing bananas for commercial use; it's the business he started with a hope of educating his children to higher levels of learning. He has asked for a loan to pay labor for weeding the cucumbers and manuring such that he can improve on soil fertility.

loans.use: to pay for labor for weeding cucumbers and manuring.

loans.name: Felicien

texts.en:
Felicien is 36 years old. He is married with four children aged between 1 and 16 years, and three of them go to school. He is a farmer and has been farming for two years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizers to grow maize.. The profits from his harvest will be used to buy food for home consumptions. 
 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to grow maize

loans.name: Thuc

texts.en:
Thuc is 55 years old and married. She has 2 sons and lives with them in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn income through selling food and beverages. 

She started her business twenty years ago. She intends to take a loan to gradually expand her business by buying a larger quantity of beverages to sell to her customers. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a larger quantity of beverages to sell for her customers

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en:
Hanh is requesting a new loan to buy a greater quantity and variety of plastic products for selling. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. 

She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business and increase her income, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her working capital and buy a greater variety and quantity of plastic items.

loans.name: Anipa

texts.ru: Анипа, 48 лет, замужем. Имеет 3 детей школьного возраста. У Анипы среднее образование, она с 1996 года занимается сельским хозяйством. Она успешный фермер своего небольшого хозяйства, в котором у нее имеется: 4 коровы, 1 лошадь 10 овец. Также у нее есть 3,0 Га поливной земли, где Анипа выращивает картофель, пшеницу и эспарцет для реализации. Бизнес Анипы на сегодняшний день приносит ежемесячную прибыль в размере 9,500 сом (KGS). Она решила обратиться в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Она хочет увеличить поголовье породистых дойных коров.
texts.en:
Anipa is 48 and married with three schoolaged children. She has a high school education and has been working in farming since 1996. She is a successful farmer on her own small property, where she currently has four cows, one horse and 10 sheep as well as 3 hectares of land where she grows potatoes, wheat and hay for sale. 

Anipa's business currently brings in a monthly profit of about 9,500 KGS. She has decided to turn to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 40,000 KGS to purchase livestock. She wants to increase her head count of dairy cows.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to increase her herd

loans.name: Juana

texts.en: Juana is 48 years old and has three sons, two of them grown up. Juana is married and her husband works as a policeman. Juana makes a living by attending to the calls of a radio taxi company and she sells underwear in her free time. Juana wants a loan to buy radio equipment to rent to the radio taxi company where she works  Juana wants to buy a house in the future.

loans.use: to buy radio equipment to rent to the radio taxi company where she works

loans.name: Evariste

texts.en:
Evariste is 54 years old, married and has seven children, ages 6 to 32 years. Five of them go to school. He is a farmer and has been farming for four years. With the loan from Kiva, Evariste would like to buy fertilizer for maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for his children.


The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for maize.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 34 years old and the single mother of three children. She is a farmer, and from the sale of farm produce she is able to provide for her family’s needs. She also has a grocery store and it has been profitable. She will be using this loan to buy maize, beans and vegetables for selling in her grocery business. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

This is Hellen's fifth loan term with VisionFund Kenya and she paid her previous loans successfully. Her future hopes are to expand her business and have a happy family.

loans.use: to buy maize, beans and vegetables for selling.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 32 years old. He is married with two children aged between one and three years. One of them goes to school. Emmanuel is a farmer and has been farming for four years. With this loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizers for his maize to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption.

The agricultural sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain are under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his maize to sell.

loans.name: El Tiburón Group

texts.es:
El grupo "El Tiburón" está conformado por tres integrantes a quienes une el lazo familiar, Doña Teresa y Sovelva son madre e hija y Don Javier es esposo de esta última, ellos viven en una comunidad mazahua muy sencilla y tranquila, pero rica en tradiciones y cultura. 

Doña Sol, como le llaman de cariño en su comunidad, tiene 43 años de edad y desde hace 24 vive en unión libre con Javier, ellos son padres de dos mujeres, una de ellas ya se encuentra estudiando la Licenciatura en Contabilidad. 

Javier inició su vida como comerciante vendiendo frituras y botanas "Fue por necesidad, por falta de un empleo fijo" comentó. Tiempo atrás, la pareja vivió en la Ciudad de México y se les presentó la oportunidad de comprar zapatos de segunda mano a un buen precio así que invirtieron el capital que tenían y regresaron a su comunidad con una gran cantidad de zapatos que comenzaron a vender en los tianguis. “La primera vez teníamos mucha vergüenza, pero realmente nos fue muy bien por eso nos motivamos a seguir en el negocio”.

Actualmente Doña Sol se encarga de la venta de zapatos y Don Javier de las frituras y botanas; ambos trabajan seis días de la semana y descansan únicamente los sábados, momentos que aprovechan para realizar otras actividades ya que los dos negocios absorben todo su tiempo entre semana. 

Sol y Javier conocen a VisionFund desde hace 6 años, momento en que decidieron solicitar su primer préstamo, apoyo que les ha permitido seguir comprando su mercancía. Ellos están muy contentos y agradecidos con la institución ya que con su esfuerzo y el capital han conseguido tener mayor estabilidad y lograron comprar dos camionetas para transportar los productos fácilmente de un lugar a otro. En sus negocios todo marcha sobre ruedas y el único reto que enfrentan es la competencia, pero ellos siempre procuran ofrecer los mejores precios, calidad y sobre todo un buen trato. 

Una de las grandes metas de la pareja es poder ver realizadas profesionalmente a sus hijas, para ellos, el hecho de que sus hijas logren titularse podrán tener más oportunidades de trabajo. También quisieran hacer mejoras a su vivienda porque la han descuidado mucho ya que por el momento gran parte de sus ganancias las destinan a la educación de sus niñas. 

Esta vez, con su préstamo Doña Sol invetirá en sus zapatos, Doña Teresa en sus borreguitos y Don Javier en sus frituras y Botanas.

*La fotografía fue tomada en un pequeño parque en el municipio donde habitan los integrantes. Sol viste un suéter verde.
texts.en:
The “El Tiburón” (“The Shark”) group consists of three members who are bound by family ties; Teresa and Sovelva are mother and daughter, and Javier is the husband of Sovelva. They live in a very simple and peaceful Mazahua community which is rich in traditions and culture.

Sol, as she is affectionately called in her community, is 43 years old and has been living with Javier for 24 years. They are the parents of two women, one of which is studying towards a degree in accounting. 

Javier began his life as a trader selling fried food and snacks. “It was due to necessity, to the lack of fixed employment”, he commented. A while ago the couple was living in Mexico City and the opportunity to buy second-hand shoes at a reasonable price presented itself to them. So they invested the capital that they had and returned to their community with a great quantity of shoes, which they began to sell at the street markets. “The first time we were very embarrassed, but it went really well for us so we were motivated to continue with the business”.

Currently Sol is in charge of selling shoes and Javier is in charge of selling fried food and snacks; they both work six days a week and only rest on Saturdays, which they make the most of for doing other activities since the two businesses absorb all their time during the week.

Sol and Javier have been with VisionFund ever since six years ago when they decided to request their first loan. VisionFund’s support has enabled them to continue buying their merchandise. They are very happy with, and grateful to, the institution since with their effort and the capital they have managed to have greater stability and to buy two trucks for transporting their products easily from one place to another. In their businesses, everything goes like clockwork and the only challenge they face is the competition, but they always try to offer the best prices, quality, and, above all, good service.

One of the couple’s big goals is to be able to see their daughters become professionals. To them, the fact that their daughters will manage to get degrees would secure more work opportunities for them. They would also like to make improvements to their home because they have neglected it a lot since at the moment most of their profits go towards their girls’ education.

This time Sol will invest the loan in her shoes, Teresa will invest it in her sheepskin linings, and Javier will invest it his fried food and snacks.

*The photograph was taken in a small park in the municipality where the members live. Sol is wearing a green sweater.

loans.use: to buy more second-hand shoes

location.town: La Virgen, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a married mother of three children who are under her care and all attend school. They live in their own  house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for the children.

Mohammed operates a business selling clothes. She sells at the market to town dwellers and her neighbors. She cites her major challenge to be seasonality. Beatrice dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

With the loan she is requesting of 50,000 KES, she wants to purchase two bales of clothes for resale. Mohammed decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is a married woman and has been blessed with four children. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. For the past four years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling household consumables like wheat flour, rice and cooking oil. She cites seasonality as her major business challenge. 

Margaret is requesting 50,000 KES to boost her kiosk and to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and cooking fat oil. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Herbert

texts.en: Herbert, a 37-year-old married man with one child, owns a retail shop in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He has also been in the transportation business for four years. He started that business with capital saved from riding for others and now he has his own motorcycle. He experiences hardship due to competition for clients at stages and his vision is to build a simple house for his family. He needs the loan to add stock like washing soap, cooking oil and others for the business to sell.

loans.use: to purchase washing soap, cooking oil and other items for his retail shop

loans.name: Manos Unidas De Amadeo Repeto Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “Manos Unidas de Amadeo Repeto” en la ciudad del Cusco, la socia Lucila tiene 40 años de edad tiene 03 hijos y es conviviente, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende diferentes tipos de productos como arroz,azúcar,leche ,gaseosas entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio  el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada di a su negocio, la socia desea que su negocio prospere, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el  crédito para la compra de arroz, gaseosas  entre otros.
Los demás socios se dedican a la confección de ropas, venta de abarrotes, venta de comida los demás son profesionales en las aéreas de salud.
Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
Los socios que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de salud y trabajo.
texts.en:
The member, Lucila, is part of the "Manos Unidas de Amadeo Repeto" lending group in the city of Cusco.  Lucila is 40 years old, has three children and is married.  In addition to her daily activities, she has a grocery store where she sells a variety of products such as rice, sugar, milk, soda and others.  She has had this business for quite some time and it has gone well for her thanks to the effort she puts into it everyday.  She hopes that her business prospers that she can continue to work and support her family.  She is seeking a loan to purchase rice, soda and other products.  

The other members of the group work making clothing, selling groceries, selling food, as well as in health professions.  The members are grateful for the opportunity that they have been given and they are committed to repaying their loans in the established timeframe.  The members in the inserted photographs were late to the meeting due to health and work-related reasons.

loans.use: purchase rice, soda and other products.

loans.name: Molok Al –Khamseen Group

texts.en:
Molok Al –Khamseen is a group consisting of four women, living in Hodiedah city, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 80,000 YER from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank (AMB).

Nadia is a 25-year-old married woman living with her family in a poor area in Hodeidah. She is the leader of the group. Despite her miserable conditions, she didn't surrender to her conditions, but decided to help her husband to cover some of the necessary expenses of the family. She sells women's clothes, accessories, and cosmetics door-to-door in her area for local residents. This business needs a lot of money. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 20,000 YER from AMB to purchase various kinds of women's clothes, incense, perfumes, accessories, and cosmetics to sell door-to-door.

Nadia's dream is to have her own store to sell all kinds of women's accessories, cosmetics, and incense.

loans.use: To purchase various kinds of women's clothes, incense, perfumes, accessories, and cosmetics

loans.name: Suhrob

texts.ru:
Сухроб молодой мужчина 30 лет. Он родился и вырос в кишлаке  Ниджани города Истаравшана Согдийский области в семье столяра плотника.  Он женат и имеет троих детей. Он занимается животноводством более четырех лет. В настоящее время он содержит три крупно рогатых скота. Его жена помогает ему в животноводстве. В свободное время он работает столяром плотником. Эту приносит ему дополнительный доход. Также он занимается дехканством.  Он имеет в дехканском хозяйстве 1,5 гектара земли, из них 0,5 гектара  винограда и  1,0 гектар для выращивания овощей и лука. 
 Сухроб сотрудничает с МДО Арванд с 2012 года.  На этот раз он обратился за кредитом для расширения животноводства.  Он надеется, что этот бизнес будет успешно расширяться и приносить больше прибыли, чтобы качественно удовлетворять нужды семьи. Сухроб заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Suhrob is a young man of 30. He was born and raised in a family of a cabinet maker and carpenter in the town of Nidzhani near the city of Istaravshan in the Sogdisky region. He is married and has three children and has bee working in animal husbandry for more than four years. He currently has three cows. His wife helps him with the animals and in his free time he works as a carpenter, which brings in additional income. He also works in agriculture and has 1.5 hectares of land of which 0.5 is planted with grapes and 1 with vegetables and onions. 

Suhrob has been working with Arvand since 2012. This time he is requesting a loan to expand his animal husbandry business. He hopes that this business will grow successfully and bring in more revenue, which will improve his family's quality of life. He thanks Arvand in advance for the support.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Kushtrim

texts.en:
Kushtrim wants to thank all of the lenders for the previous support he was given. With the loan, he was able to purchase a new cow in order to reduce the cost of milk and dairy for his family and to be able to start selling the excess for profit. Kushtrim has benefited from the savings and the extra income, which is a welcome relief for his family as he works many jobs and long hours in order to provide them their basic needs. 

Not only does he continue to work in agriculture with his cow, but, he also works in construction in the summer and warmer months and now has begun his own taxi service. He uses his personal vehicle to transport people for a fee to various places. 

Now, for the second time, he is requesting a loan in order to purchase a van to provide transportation to more people at once. He is very positive that this business will help to generate more income and offer better living conditions for his family. He is grateful for the continued support from the lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a van to provide transportation to more people at once

loans.name: Dayana Group

texts.es:
La comunidad donde viven los integrantes del grupo Dayana tiene raíces mazahuas aunque la religión Católica también ha tenido una gran influencia y las familias festejan la Navidad. Cualquier tarde fría es ideal para preparar y compartir con los seres queridos una taza del tradicional ponche que se prepara con frutas de temporada como tejocote, guayaba, tamarindo, caña, manzana, canela y piloncillo además de que el sabor mejora si se sirve en un jarrito de barro.

Doña Isabel es la representante del grupo, es una mujer muy trabajadora y sonriente aunque un poco reservada; tiene 39 años de edad y está casada con el señor Riberino quien trabaja como servidor público, la pareja tiene tres hijos aunque ya solo uno depende de ellos y aún continúa estudiando la preparatoria. 

Desde hace cinco años Doña Isabel se dedica la venta de ropa, platica que su negocio lo inició porque entonces sus hijos se encontraban estudiando la preparatoria, universidad y secundaria, el empleo de su esposo era inestable y los gastos aumentaban cada vez más. “Yo necesitaba ayudar con los gastos del hogar y la educación de mis hijos. Algunas conocidas me recomendaron vender ropa porque según se obtenían buenas ganancias” y así comenzó la actividad. Todos los días Isabel sale a vender ofreciendo la mercancía casa por casa y en otros lugares de la comunidad, además ofrece a sus clientes facilidades de pago para que ellos tengan mayor oportunidad de adquirir la ropa, en ocasiones también le hacen encargos especiales. 

Doña Isabel está muy agradecida con VisionFund y KIVA por los préstamos otorgados hasta ahora porque han sido de gran ayuda ya que el mayor reto es la falta de capital para comprar más prendas. Cada que recibe su crédito, lo aprovecha al máximo buscando los mejores precios y ofertas lo que le ha facilitado conservar su negocio y con las ganancias logró ofrecer lo más necesario a sus hijos. Por el momento no considera dejar a un lado su actividad, no hasta ver realizado profesionalmente a su hijo menor. Sonriendo Doña Isabel comento “Más adelante me encantaría tener un local estable donde pudiera mostrar la ropa”. 

Los demás integrantes del grupo también están muy contentos y agradecidos con VisionFund y KIVA porque podrán invertir en sus negocios como Braulio, Ma Guadalupe y Rosa quienes invertirán en sus borreguitos; Dayana, en becerros y Doña Yolanda, en herramienta para su ferretería. 

*La fotografía fue tomada en la fuente, corazón del parque del municipio, Doña Isabel viste un suéter rosa con playera blanca y Dayana, hija de Isabel, viste un abrigo blanco. El nombre del grupo lo eligió Isabel en honor a su hija*
texts.en:
The community where the members of the Dayana group live has Mazahuan roots, although the Catholic religion has also had great influence and families celebrate Christmas there. On a cold afternoon, it's a great idea to make and share a glass of traditional punch with loved ones. It is made with tejocote [type of fruit], guava, tamarind, cane sugar, apple, cinnamon, and powdered brown sugar. The flavor is even better if it is served in a clay pitcher.

Isabel is the representative of the group. She is a hard-working woman, who is quick to smile but a little reserved. She is 39 years old and married to Riberino, who works as a public servant. The couple has three children, although now only one depends on them. He is in high school.

For 5 years now, Isabel has sold clothing for a living. She mentions that she started her business because at that time, her children were in high school, college, and junior high. Her husband's job was unstable and costs kept going up. "I needed to help cover the household costs and my children's education. Some people I know suggested that I sell clothing because they said I could make good money," and that is how she started the business.

Every day, Isabel heads out to sell merchandise from house to house, and in other areas of the community. She also offers payment plans to her customers so that they are better able to get clothing. Sometimes they request special orders.

Isabel is very thankful to VisionFund and Kiva for the loans they offer because they have been a great help, as her biggest challenge is a lack of capital to buy more clothing. Every time she receives a loan, she gets the most out of it that she can, looking for the best prices and sales. This has allowed her to maintain her business, and with her earnings, she has been able to give her children what they need most. For now, she is not thinking of stopping her work - not until her youngest son becomes a professional. Smiling, Isabel remarks, "In the future, I would love to have a permanent location where I could sell clothing."

The other group members are also very happy and thankful to VisionFund and Kiva because they will be able to invest in their business. Braulio, Maria Guadalupe, and Rosa will invest in lambs, Dayana in calves, and Yolanda in tools for her hardware store.

*The photo was taken in front of the fountain at the heart of the city park. Isabel is the one in a pink sweatshirt and white shirt. Dayana, Isabel's daughter, is in the white coat. Isabel chose the group's name in honor of her daughter.*

loans.use: to buy more clothing

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane is a farmer from the town of Armavir in the Armavir region. To assist her living, Gayane engages in pig breeding. 

A loan of 3,000 USD will help her greatly and enable her to purchase forage to feed the pigs in the winter season. Gayane relies highly on the goodwill of the lenders and will be very grateful to them for their help in collecting the needed amount of the loan.

loans.use: to purchase forage to feed the pigs in the winter season

loans.name: Muthini

texts.en:
Muthini is a married woman with one child. They live in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for the children. Muthini operates a clothes selling business where she sells at the market to her town dwellers and neighbours. She cites her major challenge to be seasonality. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. 

With this loan she is requesting of 20,000 KES, Muthini wants to purchase two bales of clothes for resale. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

loans.use: to purchase two bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Jermie

texts.en:
Jermie is 27 years old. He is married with one child who is two years. Jermie is a farmer and has been farming for four years. With this loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizers for his maize to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay for his employees.

The agricultural sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his maize to sell.

loans.name: El Futuro Group

texts.es: Futuro es un grupo solidario integrado por tres microempresarias exitosas, quien lo coordina es la señora Marta Elena de 55 años de edad, casada, comerciante de ropa y productos de belleza, este negocio lo impulsó hace treinta años con ayuda financiera de su esposo, es el décimo primer ciclo que solicita el financiamiento en ADIM para su negocio y ha demostrado ser una persona responsable con respecto a las fechas de pagas, el crédito actual lo solicita para la compra de jean para damas, blusas, camisetas, camisas de vestir, paca de ropa mixta especial, perfumes para damas, vanidades, pinturas labiales, etc., con los créditos anteriores la socia ha logrado aumentar la clientela y diversificar los productos ofrecidos. El resto de las integrantes son las señoras, Cecilia quien tiene la edad de 54 años de edad, su negocio es el destace de cerdo y elaboración de nacatamales y sopa desde hace veintidós años en su domicilio además entrega por encargo en la capital, y Martha Salvadora de 48 años de edad dedicada a la hecha y venta de tortilla, sopa y venta de fritanga desde hace quince años en su domicilio.
texts.en:
"Futuro" is a solidarity group founded by three successful small business owners.  The group is coordinated by Marta Elena who is 55, married and sells clothing and beauty products.  She started this business 30 years ago with financial help from her husband.  This is her eleventh time seeking financing for her business from ADIM, and she has demonstrated that she is a responsible person when it comes to making her payments on time.  The loan that she is requesting will be used to purchase women's jeans, blouses, t-shirts, dress shirts, a pack of mixed special clothing, women's perfume, vanities, lipstick, etc... With the previous loans, she has been able to increase her customer base and diversify her product offering.

The other members of the group are: Cecilia who is 54 and has owned a business butchering hogs, and making nacatamales and soup in her home for the past 20 years, as well as catering in the capital; and Martha Salvadora who is 48 and has a business making and selling tortillas, soup and fried foods for the past 15 years from her home.

loans.use: purchase cosmetics and clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: increase her capital and buy many packs of beer to retail.

loans.name: Baya

texts.en:
Baya is married woman with two children who attend school. Her first business was to buy pre-packaged charcoal, but she was able to expand her storage area to store up to 60,000 kg of charcoal. She buys bags and polyurethane, packages the charcoal, and sells to small businesses. 

She needs this loan to buy charcoal because she is increasing her number of customers and need to increase the amount of charcoal to meet customer demands. Her greatest desire is to provide an education for her two children  so that she can guarantee them a prosperous future. 

With the loan of 15,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal.  She decided to join Yehu to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Songteelgo De Koanga Group

texts.fr:
Monsieur MOHAMADI JOANNY est le représentant du groupe SONGTEELGO DE KOANGA. Marié, il est  père de 08 enfants. Le plus âgé à 25 ans et le moins âgé a 02 ans. 03 vont à l’école. 
Monsieur est éleveur depuis 15  ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants. 
Il veut s’acheter  20 poules.
Monsieur veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour l agrandir son activité. Il ambitionne être un grand éleveur.
texts.en:
Mr. Mohamadi Joanny is the representative for group Songteelgo de Koanga. He is married with eight children. His eldest is twenty-five years old, his youngest two. Three of the children currently go to school.

He has been raising chicken for fifteen years. He procures them from local markets. He wants to purchase twenty hens.

Mr. Mohamadi Joanny wants to use profits to expand his business. His ambition is to become a major breeder.

loans.use: to purchase twenty hens.

loans.name: Mawussi

texts.fr: Mawussi une femme de 45ans a pour conjoint un revendeur. Ils ont en charge 03 enfants tous scolarisés. Ils sont âgés de 15, 9 et 06ans. Pour aider son mari dans les charges familiales, elle a ouvert une boutique dans laquelle elle vend des pagnes, des tissus, des habits pour enfants depuis 2000. Elle s'approvisionne généralement au Grand Marché de Lomé. Son troisième crédit l'aidera à acheter des marchandises afin de satisfaire les clients. Elle souhaite agrandir son espace et approvisionner beaucoup de stock et assurer le bien - être de la famille.
texts.en:
Mawussi is a 45-year-old woman married to a retailer. They provide for three children, who all go to school; the children are fifteen, nine, and six years old.

To help her husband with the family’s expenses, she opened a store in which she sells dresses, fabrics, and children clothing since 2000. She generally procures her products from the Great Market in Lome.

Her third loan will allow her to purchase merchandise to meet demand. She wants to increase her store’s size, procure more stock, and secure her family’s well-being.

loans.use: to buy fabric and clothes.

loans.name: Las Divinas Group

texts.es:
Las 19 integrantes de este comité cuentan con actividades variadas, cada una de ellas ponen su mejor esfuerzo para ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida por medio de su trabajo y su esfuerzo.
La señora Adelaida es una de las integrantes del  comité, ella se dedica a las confecciones, y por medio de este trabajo lucha por poder mejorar sus ingresos para poder darle a su familia todo lo que ella no pudo tener.
Adelaida pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus confecciones. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe con lo cual podrá ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The 19 members of this group carry out a variety of activities and everyone puts in their best to improve their standard of living through work and effort.

Adelaide is one of the group members and works as a dressmaker. With this job she strives to better her income to give her family everything that she couldn't have.

Adelaide is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of fabric so that she can continue dressmaking. She is grateful for this opportunity which will enable her to help her family.

loans.use: to buy fabric to use for sewing

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia wants a loan to buy a machine to process Alpaca wool.  Julia, a 43-year-old single woman, lives in a rented  brick house in El Alto.

 Julia will appreciate the help and thanks Kiva for their support.

loans.use: to buy a twisting machine.

loans.name: Mbeki

texts.en:
Mbeki is a 30-year-old married man with children who are 2 and 5 years old.  One child attends school. He has farmed for 5 years and will use the loan from Kiva, to buy fertilizer. The profits from the business will be used to pay his workers.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Kantutitas De Franz Tamayo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “KANTUTITAS DE FRANZ TAMAYO” iniciará el noveno ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Teofila es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de mantas, venta de chompas de alpaca, servicio de transporte, carnicería, venta de tullmas (simbas tradicionales), venta de polleras, venta de queso.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Teofila es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción masiva de la institución que realizaron en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido y venta de mantas; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años, al aprender la técnica de tejido con sus familiares decide emprender un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene seis hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Katutitas de Franz Tamayo credit group will begin its ninth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes regional branch. It is made up of eight members and is directed by a Board of Directors where Teofila is the President. The group members carry out various businesses, among them: blanket sales, alpaca sweater sales, transportation services, butcher’s shop, tullma [traditional pigtail ties] sales, pollera [traditional, full skirts] sales, and cheese sales.

The loan that they are taking out will benefit small-time micro-enterprises, of which Teofila is one. She relates that two years ago she joined Pro Mujer, signing up at the invitation of a big campaign they did in her area.  Currently she has a business weaving and selling blankets. She relates that she began this business a number of years ago. Upon learning the weaving techniques from family members, she decided to start her own business.

The loan she is currently taking out is to increase her capital and buy wool in bulk, which she will get from the wholesale vendors in the city of La Paz. After making the blankets she will sell them from her sales stand. This line of work allows her to generate income to support her family financially, because she is married and has six children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the trainings the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy wool in bulk

loans.name: Marta Mercedes

texts.es:
Marta, tiene una venta de ropa, es casada, vive con dos hijos de 6 y 10 años de edad; hace más de 3 años surgió su negocio, oficio que aprendió dentro su familia y lo práctica por necesidad de generar ingresos económicos para aportar en los gastos familiares, poco a poco ha mejorado el inventario de ropa, hasta el momento no representa dificultades en su negocio.
Su objetivo es utilizar el capital para comprar una nueva variedad de estilos de prendas de vestir para ambos sexos y calzado para adultos y niños, abastecerá su negocio, tendrá nuevos productos para la temporada de mejores ventas y su situación financiera mejorara.
Los sueños de Marta son crecer con su negocio, tener más clientes satisfechos, mejorar las utilidades y lo más importante dar a su familia un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Marta sells clothing, is married, and lives with her 6 and 10 year-old children. Over 3 years ago she set up her business, a trade which she learned from her family and does out of the necessity to generate income to cover the household costs. Little by little she has improved her inventory of clothing and so far there have been no difficulties in her business. 

Her aim is to use the capital to buy a new variety of clothing styles for both sexes, and footwear for adults and children, with which she will supply her business. She will have new products for the season with the best sales, and her financial situation will improve.

Marta dreams of expanding her business, having more satisfied customers, improving her profits and most importantly giving her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a new variety of clothing styles for both sexes and footwear for adults and children, in order to supply her business

loans.name: Relwende Group

texts.fr:
Monsieur OUMAROU  est le représentant du groupe RELWENDE I DE TANGHIN. Marié, il est  père de 10 enfants. Le plus âgé à 18 ans et le moins âgé a 01 an. 04 vont à l’école. 
Monsieur est éleveur depuis 30 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants.
Il veut s’acheter  02 moutons.
Monsieur veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour  aider à la scolarisation de ses enfants. Il ambitionne acheter un bœuf et devenir un grand éleveur.
texts.en:
Mr. Oumarou is the representative for group Relwende I of Tanghin. He is married with ten children. His eldest is eighteen years old, his youngest one. Four of the children currently go to school.

He has been a breeder for thirty years. He procures his supplies from local markets. He wants to purchase two sheep.

Mr. Oumarou wants to use profits to help with his children’s schooling. His ambition is to purchase on ox and to become a major breeder.

loans.use: to buy two sheep.

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal AMAUTA, la socia Marleni tiene 45 años de edad y es casada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a ejercer su carrera como docente del nivel secundaria, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su trabajo él cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para de un televisor.
La socia se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Marleni, 45, belongs to the AMAUTA community bank.  She is married and works as a high school teacher.  She has been a teacher for several years and has worked hard, she says, to build a successful career.  She hopes to continue working because it is her means of helping her family move ahead.

Marleni is applying for a loan that she will use to buy a television and says that she is committed to repaying your loans in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to purchase a television

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN”; Este banco se ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Rosaura, la socia tiene 42 años de edad es separada y tiene 05 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de carnes, la socia vende en uno de los mercados de la ciudad del Cusco, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose  a este negocio e l cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de carnes.
Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de venta de comida, plastiqueria, ferretería, venta de anticuchos, docente, venta de ropa, transporté.
Las socias que salen en la foto adjunta son socios que pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo,
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN”. This bank is located in the district of Wanchaq, which is part of the province of Cusco in the Cusco region.

The featured member is Rosaura, who is 42, separated, and has 5 children. She alternates her daily activities with the running of her meat-selling business. She sells in one of the Cusco city markets. She has been running this business for a long time, and it is going well thanks to the effort that she puts into her work every day. She wants to be able to continue working and in this way continue to support her family. She is asking for a loan to buy meat.

The other members are in the following businesses: food sales, plastic shop, hardware store, kebab sales, teaching, clothing sales, transport. The members in the added-on photo are the members who are asked permission to arrive late to the meeting for work reasons.

The member [Rosaura] is grateful to those who contribute to this dream through the lending process and she promises to comply with the instalment payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy meat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase  goats.

loans.name: Sophie

texts.en:
Sophie is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school food.

For the past 20 years, Sophie has operated a cosmetics shop, her customers mainly town residents and neighbours. She dreams of expanding her business to better meet her family's basic needs. 

With the loan of 15,000 KES that she is requesting, Sophie wants to purchase perfumes, lipsticks and body lotions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, lipsticks and body lotions for her business

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.es:
Vladimir es un joven de 23 años, nació en una población rural del departamento de La Paz llamada Chucamarca, donde estudio hasta lograr su título de bachiller, no pudo ingresar a la universidad pues la situación económica de su familia era muy difícil y decidió ir a trabajar junto a su padre a un centro minero, al cabo de un año su padre perdió la vida en un accidente dentro de la mina y Vladimir tuvo que buscar empleo fuera de la ciudad para ayudar a su madre, quien se hiso cargo sola de la crianza de sus tres hermanos menores, meses después retornó a La Paz e ingreso al proyecto hidroeléctrico Kenko Senkata, donde por las mañanas desempeño las funciones de soldador y por las tardes se dedicó a estudiar la carrera de Técnico Medio en Mecánica Industrial, sin embargo Vladimir al terminar su carrera empezó a trabajar en el proyecto La Cumbre lugar en donde decidió especializarse en Soldadura SMAW, para ser un soldador calificado y así percibir los ingresos que le permitan apoyar a su madre y a sus tres hermanos.
Vladimir agradece a las personas que a través de sus recursos económicos le permitirán seguir estudiando y cumplir sus sueños de superación.
texts.en: Vladimir is a 23 year old young man. He was born in a rural area of La Paz department called Chucamarca, where he completed high school but could enter the university as his family's economic situation was very difficult. He decided to go to work with his father in a mining center. After one year his father lost his life in an accident inside the mine. Vladimir had to look for work outside of the city to support this mother, who was now in charge of raising his three younger siblings. Months later he returned to La Paz and entered the Kenko Senkata hydroelectric project where in the morning he works welding and in the afternoons he studied a technical career in industrial mechanics. Nevertheless Vladimar, upon finishing his studies, began working on the La Cumbre project where he decided to specialize in arc welding, in order to be a qualified welder and receive the associated income that will enable him to support his mother and three siblings. Vladimir is thankful to the people who through their economic resources will permit him to continue studying and help him accomplish his dreams of being successful.

loans.use: to pay for career training as an arc welder.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase wholesale vegetables.

loans.name: Muferanji Group

texts.en:
Alice has 3 children and a business to sell plastic plates, basins, and cups. She runs this business to support her family, providing their basic needs, and pay their medical bills. 

She will use the loan to buy more materials and  expand her business. She hopes of owning a restaurant one day and dreams of building a permanent house. There has been a positive change since she received the loans, she has built her house and she is able to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy plates and basins.

loans.name: Carmen Del Rosario

texts.es:
EL Grupo de Crédito Simón Bolívar se reúne cada quince días en el sitio Cárcel Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Carmen, tiene 44 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen seis hijos 4 mayores de edad y dos de 16 y 8 años que estudian en colegio y escuela cinco de sus hijos aun viven con ellos. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña Carmen es una mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta ganar lo suyo para ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar, ella con sus hijos  tienen una pequeña fábrica de ladrillos (material utilizado en la construcción de viviendas), sus hijos son los encargados de fabricar los ladrillos mientras que ella es la que se encarga de realizar las ventas, vende en su casa a comerciantes que llegan hasta su fábrica y en ocasiones contratan un camión y entregan directamente a las construcciones, así ella y sus hijos se ganan sus ingresos para salir adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar leña, aserrín, agua, palmito que son los materiales que emplean para elaborar los ladrillos. Lleva tres ciclos en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho. Sus sueños son tener un camión para entregar los ladrillos.
texts.en:
The Simon Bolivar Credit Group meets every fifteen days in Carcel Canton Montecristi, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its handicrafts which are recognized nationally and wolrdwide. This is the area which makes the famous toquilla straw hats (Panama hats).

This is where Carmen, who is 44 years old lives. She is married and has six children from that relationship, four adult children and a 16 year old and an 8 year old who study at high school and elementary school. Five of her children still live with them. Her husband is an driver.

Carmen is a very hard working woman who enjoys earning her own money to help her husband with the household expenses. She and her children have a small brick factory (material used in the construction of houses). Her children are in charge of making the bricks, while she takes care of making sales.  She sells in her home to retailers who come to her factory and they occasionally hire a truck and deliver directly to construction sites. In this way, she and her children earn their income to move forward.

This loan is to buy wood, sawdust, water and palm fronds, which are the materials they use to make bricks. Carmen has been with the credit group for three cycles and she likes it because the loans help her a lot. Her dream is to have a truck to deliver the bricks.

loans.use: to buy wood, sawdust, water and palm fronds.

loans.name: Eilenn Patricia

texts.es: Eilenn, es  residente de un barrio ubicado en Barranquilla, es una joven de 23 años de edad que se dedica a la elaboración de picadas y postres, este negocio es familiar, su mamá lleva varios años en esta actividad y conoce muy bien este tipo de negocio, Eileen decidió incorporarse a este negocio en vista de la experiencia y el éxito de su madre.  Actualmente ella ofrece sus productos a los habitantes del barrio donde reside y también a algunas personas de barrios aledaños al sector, ella trabaja de lunes a domingo de 9 a.m. a  6 p.m., sus ventas las realiza de contado, así mismo sus compras las realiza a graneros y les cancela de contado.  Ella está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará insumos como harina, aceite, huevos y demás ingredientes para la preparación de sus productos. Esta inversión beneficiara la producción y con ello las ventas, que para esta época del año incrementa por las festividades decembrinas.  Eilenn es una mujer con metas claras para su futuro, ella desea tener su propia casa y ampliar su nivel comercial.
texts.en:
Eilenn is a resident of a neighborhood in Barranquilla. She is a 23-year-old woman who earns a living with the preparation of snacks and desserts. Her business is a family business: her mother has spent several years in this activity and is very familiar with this type of business. Eileen decided to join this business in the light of experience and success of her mother.

Currently, she offers her products to the residents of the neighborhood where she lives, and also to some people from the surrounding neighborhoods. She works Monday to Sunday from 9 a.m. to 6 p.m. Her sales are made for cash, likewise she pays for her purchases, which she makes at warehouses, in cash.

She is applying for a Kiva loan, her first loan, through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With this loan, she will buy supplies like flour, oil, eggs, and other ingredients for the preparation of her products. Her production will benefit from this investment and so will her sales, because at this time of the year, her sales increase because of the Christmas festivities. 

Eilenn is a woman with clear goals for her future: she wants to have her own house, and to expand her commercial activities.

loans.use: to buy flour, oil, eggs, and other items for her catering business

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia vive en una comunidad llamada las minas, ella es casada tiene 56 años de edad, vive felizmente con sus tres hijos, todos son mayores de edad, las dos señoritas se dedican al oficio doméstico, el lugar donde viven es zona totalmente agrícola, pues  también trabajan en la agricultura con los vecinos de la comunidad, el hijo se dedica al trabajo de albañilería. 
Lucia es una señora que  a pesar de su avanzada edad, ella se dedica al trabajo de lavandería en su comunidad, le gusta ese trabajo ya que es una de las actividades que no le lleva mucho tiempo y no es de todos los días, pues con gran sacrificio, esta familia ha prosperado en la vida, pero ahora la necesidad de que tienen  es construir una cocina con material de block, porque lo tiene ahora es una casita de lámina, y cuando es época de lluvia el agua filtra. 
Pues Lucia con el apoyo de sus hijos estaría pagando el préstamo, el monto que Lucia necesita es de  cinco mil quinientos quetzales para empezar con la construcción, el sueño de Lucia es ver su cocina transformada, en poco tiempo, ella tiene la certeza de conseguir este apoyo.
texts.en:
Lucia lives in a community called "Las Minas."  She is married, and is 56 years old.  She lives happily with her 3 children, who are all adults.  Her two daughters help with the household chores.  They live in an area that is exclusively agricultural, and so they also work doing farming with the neighbors in the community.  Her son works in construction.

Lucia is a woman who, in spite of her age, works doing laundry in her community.  She enjoys this work, because it is an activity that does not take too much time and she doesn't have to work every day.  With great sacrifice, this family has prospered in life, but now they need to build a kitchen with cement blocks, because the kitchen they have now is made from corrugated metal and when the rainy season comes the water gets in. 

Lucia, with the support of her children, will be paying off this loan.  The sum that she is requesting is 5,500 Honduran quetzales to start the construction.  Lucia's dream is to see her kitchen transformed in a short period of time.  She is certain that she can do this with this financial support.

loans.use: to build a kitchen

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es:
Efraín, lucha  cada día con sus con sus hijos para prosperar en la vida y es más para que sus hijos en un futuro tengan lo necesario, él tiene ahora 52 años de edad, Efraín  tiene cinco hijos pero con el aún viven tres. 
Este abnegado señor a pesar de su edad, aún tiene energías para trabajar, para la generación de sus ingresos, el cultiva Zanahoria, anteriormente cultivaba arveja, pero se dio cuenta que  la zanahoria es más rentable, Pues Efrain con el apoyo de sus hijos para este año han planeado incrementar el cultivo,  pero para eso ellos necesitaran de un capital de trabajo para comprar más tubería para la ampliación del riego,  pues los trabajos de  agricultura se ha ido modernizando, por que el riego ahora se hace por medio de aspersores, esto es con el fin de economizar tiempo, mientras se puede hacer otros trabajos. Pues Efrain con sus hijos necesita un préstamo para poder hacer esta ampliación. 
Efrain acapara la mano de obra de sus hijos,  ellos no cuentan con  otros ingresos, pues la idea de Efraín, es  generar  más ingresos y por supuesto  ganancias y la meta de este padre de familia, es construirles una casa para  cada uno de ellos,  Pues para que cuando se casen tengan ya una casa donde vivir. Efraín confía en Dios para conseguir el préstamo  y hacer realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
Efraín strives each day with his children to succeed in life, and he does so so that his children in the future have what they need.  He is now 52 years old.  Efraín has five children but only three live with him now.

This selfless man, despite his age, still has energy to work.  To generate his income, he cultivates carrots.  Preciously he cultivated peas, but he realized that carrots are more profitable.  Then Efraín, with the support of his children, this year has planned to increase the crop.  But in order to do this, they needed working capital to buy more pipes for irrigation expansion.  As agriculture has been modernized, irrigation is done through sprinklers.  This is to save time so that they can do other jobs.  Therefore, Efraín, with his children, is requesting a loan to be able to make this expansion.

Efraín uses the labor of his children.  They do not have any other incomes.  The idea of Efraín is to generate more income and of course profit.  The goal of this father of the family is to build each of them a house; so that when they get married, they already have a house in which to live.  Efraín trusts in God to get the loan and to realize their dreams.

loans.use: To buy accessories (pipeline tubes).

loans.name: Fredy Alexander

texts.es: Fredy tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero y vive solo ya que a veces por motivo de su trabajo se traslada a lugares  mas lejanos debido a que se dedica a cargar madera y también se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de terneros para tenerlos en hierba que arrienda, la aspiración de este joven trabajador es de que seguir trabajando honradamente y estar preparado para su futuro.
texts.en:
Fredy is 22 years old. He is single and lives alone because he works transporting wood and sometimes has to travel long distances as part of this job. Fredy also works raising cattle and he plans to use the money from this loan to buy calves that he will let graze in a pasture that he rents.

The goal of this hard-working young man is to continue making an honest living and to be prepared for the future.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Suaney Alexandra

texts.es:
Suaney tiene 22 años de edad es casada  y tiene dos hijos de 5 y 4 años vive en Echeandia provincia de Bolivar, pertenece a la ventanilla rural Mujeres Emprendedoras. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo y solicita el crédito para comprar mercaderia (ropa)para vender en esta fechas de Navidad y asi mejorar su calidad de vida de su familia.
Realiza las compras en Ambato cada 15 días. Su sueño es mejor su negocio y salir adelante, su desafio es la falta de capital en su tiempo libre le gusta compartir con su familia.
texts.en:
22-year old Suaney is married and has two children aged 5 and 4. She lives in Echeandia in the province of Bolivar and belongs to the rural bank Mujeres Emprendedoras.

Suaney earns her living selling clothing from a catalog. She is seeking a loan so she can purchase items on slae just before the Christmas season, and thus improve her family’s standard of living. She buys her products in Ambata twice monthly. Her dream is to improve her business and get ahead. Her problem is lack of capital. Suaney likes to spend her free time with her family.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to resell

loans.name: La Luz Group

texts.es:
La comunidad donde se encuentra el grupo La Luz, se distingue por su producción de caña. En los últimos meses del año comienza la época de zafra en la cual se corta y se muele el fruto para obtener azúcar. Con esto, la carretera que conduce a la comunidad, limpia de los altos cañales permite ver las casas como las de los integrantes de La Luz:

Juana De La Cruz- Mercería, Papelería
Margarita-Plata
Amelia-Fletera
Leonarda- Comida
Alba- Ropa
Elizabeth-Bisutería 
Eliquia- Pizza
Maria-Abarrotes
Amanda-Zapatos
Yescenia- Ropa
Rafael-Refresco

Doña Juana es mejor conocida como Juanita, está casada con el señor Víctor y son padres de 3 jóvenes los cuales ya son mayores de edad y los apoyan económicamente.

Juanita se dedica a vender productos de mercería y de papelería. Su negocio inició a raíz de su propia necesidad: la distancia de su casa a la papelería del municipio era muy grande aunado a que hubo momentos en que alguno de sus hijos olvidaba el material para hacer su tarea y si era de noche, la situación era más complicada. 

Motivada a hacer algo para resolver el inconveniente que también vivían otras personas en su comunidad, abrió la pequeña papelería e incluyó productos de mercería y regalos. Para ello adecuó un espacio en su casa y con las ganancias obtenidas invertía en la compra de más mercancía para ofrecer un amplio surtido a sus clientes. Actualmente también vende refrescos y hielo en el mismo local. Juanita necesita un préstamo para comparar elástico, hilo, botones, cierres, papel de regalo, moños, lapiceros, lápiz, libretas, pinturas acrílicas, productos que más compran sus clientes. 

El apoyo incondicional de su esposo e hijos también ha sido una parte elemental en la continuidad del negocio. Además, la actividad la mantiene ocupada y la ayuda a no sentirse sola ahora que sus hijos ya son mayores. Por si fuera poco, Juanita ha planeado utilizar sus ahorros y ganancias para iniciar otro negocio, en febrero comenzará a vender tacos los fines de semana en el patio de su casa.

*La fotografía fue tomada en la papelería de Doña Juanita quien viste blusa color rosa.
texts.en:
The community where the "La Luz" group is based in is known for their sugarcane production.  Towards the end of the year, the harvest begins in which the sugarcane is cut and milled to obtain the sugar.  After this, one can see the houses of the members of "La Luz" from the road since the tall sugarcane fields have been cut down.  The members of the group are:

Juana De La Cruz- Haberdashery, Stationary
Margarita-Silver
Amelia-Transportation Services
Leonarda- Food
Alba- Clothing
Elizabeth-Jewelry 
Eliquia- Pizza
Maria-Groceries
Amanda-Shoes
Yescenia- Clothing
Rafael-Beverages

Juana, better known as Juanita, is married to Victor and is the mother of three children who are all adults and support them financially.  Juanita works selling haberdashery and stationary products.  Her business was born out of her own necessity.  The distance from her home to the local stationary store was very far, and there were times when one of her children forgot some material for their homework late at night and it was too difficult to go get it.  Motivated to remedy this inconvenience that others in the community also suffered with, she started a small stationary store that also included haberdashery and gifts.  She was able to use a space in her home and with her earnings, she invested in purchasing more merchandise to expand her offerings to her customers.  She currently also sells beverages and ice in the same store.

Juanita is in need of a loan to purchase elastic, thread, buttons, zippers, gift wrap, ribbons, pens, pencils, notebooks, acrylic paints and other commonly purchased products.  Her husband and children's unconditional support have been essential in the continuity of her business.  Additionally, the business keeps her occupied and helps her to not feel alone now that her children are grown up.

Juanita plans to use her savings and earnings to start another business.  In February she will start selling tacos on the weekends in her backyard.  

The picture was taken in Juanita's stationary store.  She is wearing a pink blouse.

loans.use: purchase elastic, thread, buttons, zippers, wrapping paper, bows, pens, pencils, notebooks and acrylic paints.
